title.enUS: Unification of Upper and Lower Egypt

description.zhCN: 美尼斯（或那尔迈）统一上下埃及，建立了第一个王朝，标志着古埃及国家的诞生和法老统治的开端，为古埃及文明的后续发展奠定了政治和文化基础。
description.enUS: Menes (or Narmer) unified Upper and Lower Egypt, establishing the First Dynasty. This event marked the birth of the ancient Egyptian state and the beginning of pharaonic rule, laying the political and cultural foundation for the future development of Egyptian civilization.

description.zhCN: 法老左赛尔统治时期修建了第一座阶梯金字塔，这象征着古王国时期的开始。该时期以金字塔的建造为代表，是古埃及建筑和中央集权达到顶峰的象征，展现了强大的组织能力和技术成就。
description.enUS: During the reign of Pharaoh Djoser, the first step pyramid was built, symbolizing the start of the Old Kingdom. This period, known for its pyramid construction, represents the peak of ancient Egyptian architecture and centralized power, showcasing remarkable organizational skills and technical achievements.

description.zhCN: 吉萨大金字塔为胡夫法老所建，是现存世界七大奇迹中唯一一座，展现了古埃及在数学、天文学和工程学方面的卓越成就。
description.enUS: The Great Pyramid of Giza, built for Pharaoh Khufu, is the only remaining of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World. It demonstrates ancient Egypt's exceptional achievements in mathematics, astronomy, and engineering.

description.zhCN: 少年法老图坦卡蒙（Tutankhamun）恢复了传统的阿蒙神崇拜，其墓葬在20世纪被完整发现，提供了大量古埃及文明的珍贵信息。
description.enUS: The young Pharaoh Tutankhamun restored the traditional worship of Amun. His tomb, discovered intact in the 20th century, provided a wealth of invaluable information about ancient Egyptian civilization.

description.zhCN: 拉美西斯二世率领埃及军队与赫梯帝国在叙利亚卡迭石爆发大规模战役，这是古代历史上记载最早的空前规模的战车战，最终以和解告终。
description.enUS: Ramesses II led the Egyptian army in a large-scale battle against the Hittite Empire at Kadesh in Syria. This was the earliest recorded chariot battle of unprecedented scale in ancient history, ultimately ending in a peace treaty.

description.zhCN: 周武王姬发率诸侯联军与商朝末代君主帝辛（纣王）的军队在牧野决战，周军大胜，商朝灭亡，西周王朝建立。
description.enUS: King Wu of Zhou led a coalition of feudal lords in a decisive battle against the army of Di Xin (King Zhou), the last monarch of the Shang Dynasty, at Muye. The Zhou army achieved a great victory, leading to the fall of the Shang Dynasty and the establishment of the Western Zhou Dynasty.

title.zhCN: 周公摄政与平定三监之乱
title.enUS: Regency of Duke of Zhou and Suppression of the Rebellion of the Three Guards

description.zhCN: 周武王去世后，其弟周公旦辅佐年幼的周成王，并平定管叔、蔡叔、霍叔联合殷商旧贵族发动的叛乱，巩固了西周统治。
description.enUS: After the death of King Wu of Zhou, his brother, the Duke of Zhou, assisted the young King Cheng and suppressed the rebellion launched by Guan Shu, Cai Shu, and Huo Shu in alliance with former Shang nobles, consolidating Western Zhou rule.

title.zhCN: 首次奥林匹克运动会举办

description.zhCN: 希腊城邦间为祭祀宙斯而举办的体育竞技活动，标志着泛希腊文化的形成，促进了城邦间的交流与和平。
description.enUS: Athletic competitions held by Greek city-states to honor Zeus, marking the formation of pan-Hellenic culture and promoting inter-city-state exchange and peace.

title.zhCN: 犬戎攻破镐京，西周灭亡
title.enUS: Dog Rong Attack Haojing, Western Zhou Falls

description.zhCN: 周幽王因宠爱褒姒而废黜太子宜臼，引发申侯联合犬戎攻打镐京，都城陷落，幽王被杀，标志着西周王朝的灭亡和东周的开始。
description.enUS: King You of Zhou's favor for Baosi and his dethronement of Crown Prince Yijiu led to Marquis Shen allying with the Dog Rong to attack Haojing. The capital fell, King You was killed, marking the end of the Western Zhou Dynasty and the beginning of the Eastern Zhou.

title.zhCN: 平王东迁洛邑，东周开始
title.enUS: King Ping Moves East to Luoyi, Eastern Zhou Begins

description.zhCN: 在申侯等诸侯的拥立下，周平王即位，并为躲避犬戎威胁将都城从镐京迁至洛邑（今河南洛阳），标志着东周时期的开启。
description.enUS: With the support of feudal lords like Marquis Shen, King Ping ascended to the throne and moved the capital from Haojing to Luoyi (present-day Luoyang, Henan) to escape the threat of the Dog Rong, marking the beginning of the Eastern Zhou period.

description.zhCN: 传说中罗慕路斯在台伯河畔帕拉蒂尼山建立罗马城，标志着古罗马历史的开端。
description.enUS: According to legend, Romulus founded the city of Rome on the Palatine Hill by the Tiber River, marking the beginning of ancient Roman history.

title.zhCN: 荷马史诗《伊利亚特》和《奥德赛》问世
title.enUS: Homer's Epics 'The Iliad' and 'The Odyssey' Emerge

description.zhCN: 被认为是西方文学的奠基之作，塑造了希腊神话与英雄形象，对西方文化和文学产生了深远影响。
description.enUS: Considered foundational works of Western literature, shaping Greek mythology and heroic figures, with a profound impact on Western culture and literature.

title.zhCN: 努比亚（库施）王朝统治埃及

description.zhCN: 来自南方努比亚的库施国王皮耶（Piye）征服埃及，建立了埃及第二十五王朝，一度恢复了埃及的统一和传统，被视为“黑人法老”时代。
description.enUS: Piye, the Kushite king from Nubia to the south, conquered Egypt and established the Twenty-Fifth Dynasty. This period briefly restored Egyptian unity and traditions, and is known as the 'Black Pharaohs' era.

title.zhCN: 齐桓公即位与管仲改革
title.enUS: Accession of Duke Huan of Qi and Guan Zhong's Reforms

description.zhCN: 齐桓公即位后，任用管仲为相，进行了一系列经济、军事和行政改革，使齐国迅速强大，成为春秋时期首位霸主。
description.enUS: After Duke Huan of Qi ascended to the throne, he appointed Guan Zhong as prime minister, initiating a series of economic, military, and administrative reforms that quickly strengthened Qi and made it the first hegemon of the Spring and Autumn period.

title.zhCN: 亚述人入侵并占领埃及
title.enUS: Assyrian Invasion and Occupation of Egypt

description.zhCN: 新亚述帝国国王埃萨尔哈顿（Esarhaddon）率军入侵埃及，击败努比亚统治者，并占领孟菲斯，使埃及沦为亚述的附庸。
description.enUS: Esarhaddon, king of the Neo-Assyrian Empire, led his army to invade Egypt, defeating the Nubian rulers and occupying Memphis, turning Egypt into an Assyrian vassal state.

description.zhCN: 齐桓公在葵丘主持诸侯会盟，周天子派代表参与，齐桓公被正式确立为霸主，标志着春秋霸主政治体系的成熟。
description.enUS: Duke Huan of Qi presided over a covenant of feudal lords at Kuiqiu, with a representative from the Son of Heaven participating. Duke Huan was formally recognized as hegemon, marking the maturation of the Spring and Autumn period's hegemon system.

description.zhCN: 雅典的第一部成文法典，以严酷著称，遏制了贵族滥用权力，但未根本解决社会矛盾。
description.enUS: Athens' first written law code, known for its severity, curbed aristocratic abuse of power but did not fundamentally resolve social conflicts.

description.zhCN: 晋楚两国在邲地展开激战，楚军大败晋军，使楚庄王称霸中原，成为春秋时期又一位重要霸主。
description.enUS: The states of Jin and Chu engaged in a fierce battle at Bi. The Chu army decisively defeated the Jin army, allowing King Zhuang of Chu to dominate the Central Plains and become another important hegemon of the Spring and Autumn period.

description.zhCN: 雅典执政官梭伦推行一系列政治经济改革，废除债务奴隶制，按财产划分公民等级，为雅典民主奠定基础。
description.enUS: Athenian archon Solon implemented a series of political and economic reforms, abolishing debt slavery and categorizing citizens by wealth, laying the foundation for Athenian democracy.

description.zhCN: 塞尔维乌斯·图利乌斯推行军事与政治改革，按财产划分公民等级，设立百人队大会取代氏族会议。
description.enUS: Servius Tullius implemented military and political reforms, dividing citizens into property-based classes and replacing tribal assemblies with the Centuriate Assembly.

description.zhCN: 春秋末期，孔子诞生于鲁国，他创立了儒家学派，其思想对中国乃至东亚文化产生了极其深远的影响。
description.enUS: In the late Spring and Autumn period, Confucius was born in the state of Lu. He founded the Confucian school of thought, whose ideas had an extremely profound influence on Chinese and even East Asian culture.

description.zhCN: 波斯阿契美尼德王朝的冈比西斯二世（Cambyses II）攻灭埃及，建立了埃及第二十七王朝（第一次波斯统治），结束了埃及本土王朝的统治，成为波斯帝国的一个省。
description.enUS: Cambyses II of the Achaemenid Persian Empire conquered Egypt, establishing the Twenty-Seventh Dynasty (First Persian Rule). This ended the rule of native Egyptian dynasties and made Egypt a province of the Persian Empire.

description.zhCN: 罗马推翻了最后一位国王卢修斯·塔克文·苏佩布的统治，建立了共和制政体，由元老院、执政官和人民大会共同管理。
description.enUS: Rome overthrew the rule of its last king, Lucius Tarquinius Superbus, and established a republican government managed by the Senate, consuls, and popular assemblies.

description.zhCN: 雅典政治家克利斯提尼推行民主改革，以地域取代血缘划分部落，创立陶片放逐法，标志着雅典民主制度的确立。
description.enUS: Athenian statesman Cleisthenes enacted democratic reforms, replacing kinship with territorial divisions for tribes and establishing ostracism, marking the establishment of Athenian democracy.

description.zhCN: 小亚细亚的希腊城邦反抗波斯统治的起义，雅典给予援助，成为希波战争的直接导火索。
description.enUS: Greek city-states in Asia Minor revolted against Persian rule, with Athenian aid, directly sparking the Greco-Persian Wars.

description.zhCN: 吴王阖闾在夫椒大败越国军队，越王勾践被迫求和，吴国国力达到鼎盛。
description.enUS: King Helü of Wu decisively defeated the Yue army at Fanjiao, forcing King Goujian of Yue to seek peace. The state of Wu reached its peak power.

description.zhCN: 罗马平民因债务和政治权利不公，集体撤离罗马城至圣山，迫使贵族设立保民官，以保护平民利益。
description.enUS: Roman plebeians collectively withdrew from Rome to the Sacred Mount due to debt and political inequality, forcing the patricians to establish the office of Tribune of the Plebs to protect plebeian interests.

description.zhCN: 雅典和普拉塔亚联军在马拉松平原击败了入侵的波斯军队，阻止了波斯对希腊的首次大规模入侵。
description.enUS: Athenian and Plataean forces defeated the invading Persian army on the plain of Marathon, halting the first major Persian invasion of Greece.

description.zhCN: 吴王夫差在艾陵击败齐国，使吴国在短暂时期内成为春秋末期的霸主之一。
description.enUS: King Fuchai of Wu defeated Qi at Ailing, making Wu one of the hegemons of the late Spring and Autumn period for a brief time.

description.zhCN: 斯巴达国王列奥尼达率少量希腊联军在温泉关抵抗波斯大军，虽最终战败但为希腊海军赢得宝贵时间，成为英勇抵抗的象征。
description.enUS: Spartan King Leonidas led a small contingent of Greek allied forces to resist the large Persian army at Thermopylae; though ultimately defeated, it bought valuable time for the Greek navy and became a symbol of heroic resistance.

description.zhCN: 希腊城邦联军在普拉泰亚战役和米卡莱战役中击败波斯军队，彻底终结了波斯对希腊的入侵威胁。这场胜利极大地提升了雅典的威望，开启了雅典的黄金时代，也标志着古希腊古典时期的真正开端。
description.enUS: The Greek city-state coalition defeated the Persian forces in the Battles of Plataea and Mycale, completely ending the Persian threat of invasion. This victory significantly boosted Athens' prestige, initiated its Golden Age, and marked the true beginning of the Greek Classical period.

description.zhCN: 越王勾践卧薪尝胆后，最终灭亡吴国，成为春秋末期最后一位霸主。
description.enUS: After enduring hardship and planning revenge, King Goujian of Yue finally conquered Wu, becoming the last hegemon of the late Spring and Autumn period.

description.zhCN: 罗马首部成文法刻于十二块铜表，公开陈列于广场，确立法律面前平民与贵族平等原则。
description.enUS: Rome's first written law code inscribed on bronze tablets displayed in the Forum, establishing equality before the law for plebeians and patricians.

description.zhCN: 平民再次集体撤离，要求重新设立保民官，并使十二铜表法得到更广泛的实施，巩固了平民权利。
description.enUS: Plebeians again collectively seceded, demanding the re-establishment of the Tribune of the Plebs and broader implementation of the Twelve Tables, solidifying plebeian rights.

description.zhCN: 雅典为祭祀雅典娜而建造的宏伟神庙，是古希腊建筑艺术的典范，体现了黄金时代的雅典繁荣。
description.enUS: A magnificent temple built in Athens to honor Athena, it stands as a prime example of ancient Greek architectural art and embodies the prosperity of Athens during its Golden Age.

description.zhCN: 雅典和斯巴达两大军事集团之间的长期战争，深刻改变了希腊城邦格局，导致希腊世界衰落。
description.enUS: A protracted war between the two major military blocs of Athens and Sparta, profoundly altering the Greek city-state landscape and leading to the decline of the Greek world.

description.zhCN: 斯巴达在爱琴海击败雅典海军，雅典投降，其霸权结束，斯巴达取得希腊霸权。
description.enUS: Sparta defeated the Athenian navy in the Aegean Sea, leading to Athens' surrender, the end of its hegemony, and the establishment of Spartan dominance in Greece.

title.enUS: Partition of Jin by Three Families

description.zhCN: 晋国大夫韩、赵、魏三家瓜分晋国土地，并获得周天子承认，标志着春秋时代结束，战国时代开始。
description.enUS: The three powerful families of Han, Zhao, and Wei, prominent ministers of Jin, partitioned the territory of Jin and gained recognition from the Son of Heaven, marking the end of the Spring and Autumn period and the beginning of the Warring States period.

description.zhCN: 哲学家苏格拉底被控亵渎神明与腐蚀青年，五百人陪审团以280票对220票判处其饮毒堇汁死刑。
description.enUS: Philosopher Socrates was charged with impiety and corrupting youth; 500-juror court sentenced him to drink hemlock by 280 to 220 votes.

description.zhCN: 经过十年围攻，罗马将军卡米卢斯率军攻陷伊特鲁里亚重要城邦维爱，极大扩张了罗马领土和资源，巩固了其在拉丁姆地区的霸权。
description.enUS: After a ten-year siege, Roman general Camillus captured Veii, a major Etruscan city-state, significantly expanding Roman territory and resources and solidifying its dominance in Latium.

description.zhCN: 卢人入侵并洗劫了罗马城，焚毁了部分建筑，对罗马造成巨大打击，但罗马最终得以重建并从中吸取教训。
description.enUS: Gauls invaded and sacked the city of Rome, burning parts of it, causing significant damage to Rome, but Rome was eventually rebuilt and learned from the experience.

description.zhCN: 柏拉图于雅典西北郊阿卡德米运动场购地建校，系统讲授哲学、数学与政治学，学园持续运营至公元529年。
description.enUS: Plato purchased land near the Academy gymnasium in northwest Athens, founding a school to systematically teach philosophy, mathematics, and politics, operating until 529 AD.

description.zhCN: 秦孝公任用商鞅推行变法，废井田、开阡陌、重农抑商、奖励军功等，使秦国国力大增，为统一六国奠定基础。
description.enUS: Duke Xiao of Qin appointed Shang Yang to implement reforms, including abolishing the well-field system, opening up land for private ownership, emphasizing agriculture and suppressing commerce, and rewarding military merit. These reforms significantly strengthened Qin, laying the foundation for its unification of the six states.

description.zhCN: 在埃及短暂恢复独立后，波斯阿尔塔薛西斯三世（Artaxerxes III）再次征服埃及，实行更严酷的统治，加速了埃及人对外国统治的反感。
description.enUS: After a brief period of Egyptian independence, Artaxerxes III of Persia reconquered Egypt, imposing harsher rule and intensifying Egyptian resentment towards foreign domination.

description.zhCN: 马其顿国王腓力二世击败雅典和底比斯联军，标志着希腊城邦独立时代的终结，马其顿霸权的建立。
description.enUS: Philip II of Macedon defeated the allied forces of Athens and Thebes, marking the end of the independent era for Greek city-states and the establishment of Macedonian hegemony.

description.zhCN: 亚历山大率军远征波斯帝国，开启了对东方世界的征服，极大地扩展了希腊文化的影响范围。
description.enUS: Alexander led his army on an expedition to the Persian Empire, beginning the conquest of the Eastern world and greatly expanding the reach of Greek culture.

title.zhCN: 亚历山大大帝征服埃及

description.zhCN: 亚历山大大帝在没有遇到抵抗的情况下征服埃及，被埃及人视为解放者，并建立了亚历山大城，开启了希腊化时代。
description.enUS: Alexander the Great conquered Egypt without resistance and was regarded by the Egyptians as a liberator. He founded the city of Alexandria, initiating the Hellenistic era.

description.zhCN: 亚历山大大帝在尼罗河三角洲西部建立亚历山大城，它迅速发展成为古代世界重要的文化、商业和学术中心，拥有著名的亚历山大图书馆和灯塔。
description.enUS: Alexander the Great founded Alexandria on the western Nile Delta. It rapidly grew into a crucial cultural, commercial, and intellectual center of the ancient world, home to the famous Library of Alexandria and Lighthouse of Alexandria.

description.zhCN: 亚历山大在巴比伦去世，其庞大的帝国随即分裂，开启了希腊化时代。
description.enUS: Alexander died in Babylon, and his vast empire subsequently fragmented, ushering in the Hellenistic Age.

description.zhCN: 古希腊哲学家亚里士多德去世，他的思想体系对逻辑学、形而上学、伦理学、政治学等领域产生深远影响。
description.enUS: The ancient Greek philosopher Aristotle died; his philosophical system profoundly influenced fields such as logic, metaphysics, ethics, and politics.

description.zhCN: 罗马修建连接罗马与卡普亚的重要军事和商业大道，促进了人员物资流通，对罗马的军事扩张和经济发展意义重大。
description.enUS: Rome began construction of a vital military and commercial road connecting Rome and Capua, facilitating the movement of people and goods, and significantly impacting Roman military expansion and economic development.

title.enUS: King Wuling of Zhao Adopts Hu-Style Dress and Cavalry Tactics

description.zhCN: 赵武灵王推行“胡服骑射”改革，学习北方游牧民族的骑兵战术和服饰，极大地增强了赵国的军事实力。
description.enUS: King Wuling of Zhao implemented the 'Hu-style dress and cavalry tactics' reform, learning cavalry warfare and attire from northern nomadic tribes, which greatly enhanced Zhao's military strength.

description.zhCN: 亚历山大大帝去世后，其部将托勒密一世（Ptolemy I Soter）在埃及建立托勒密王朝，定都亚历山大城，开始了长达近300年的希腊人统治。
description.enUS: After the death of Alexander the Great, his general Ptolemy I Soter established the Ptolemaic Dynasty in Egypt, with Alexandria as its capital, beginning nearly 300 years of Greek rule.

description.zhCN: 该法案规定由平民大会通过的决议对所有罗马公民具有法律约束力，彻底终结了罗马平民与贵族之间长达两个世纪的斗争，标志着罗马共和国民主进程的重大胜利。
description.enUS: This law stipulated that resolutions passed by the Plebeian Council were binding on all Roman citizens. It marked the end of the two-century-long Struggle of the Orders between plebeians and patricians, representing a major triumph for the democratic process of the Roman Republic.

description.zhCN: 为纪念罗德岛人民战胜入侵者而建造的太阳神赫利俄斯巨像，是古代世界七大奇迹之一，展现了希腊化时期雕塑艺术的宏伟成就。
description.enUS: A colossal statue of the sun god Helios built to commemorate the people of Rhodes' victory over invaders, it was one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World, showcasing the magnificent achievements of Hellenistic sculpture.

title.zhCN: 罗马举行首次公开角斗表演

description.zhCN: 贵族布鲁图斯为父亲葬礼举办三对角斗士表演，开启罗马角斗文化传统。
description.enUS: Aristocrat Junius Brutus held three gladiator duits at his father's funeral, initiating Rome's gladiatorial tradition.

description.zhCN: 罗马与迦太基为争夺西西里岛控制权爆发冲突，标志着罗马共和国向海外扩张的开始。
description.enUS: Conflict erupted between Rome and Carthage over control of Sicily, marking the beginning of the Roman Republic's overseas expansion.

description.zhCN: 秦国白起率军在长平大败赵军，俘虏坑杀赵国降卒约四十万，极大地削弱了赵国力量，加速了秦统一六国的进程。
description.enUS: Qin general Bai Qi led his army to decisively defeat the Zhao army at Changping, burying alive approximately 400,000 surrendered Zhao soldiers. This greatly weakened Zhao and accelerated Qin's process of unifying the six states.

description.zhCN: 叙拉古的伟大科学家和数学家阿基米德在罗马围攻中城破身亡，他的许多发明和原理对科学发展有深远影响。
description.enUS: Archimedes, the great scientist and mathematician of Syracuse, died during the Roman siege of the city; his many inventions and principles had a profound impact on scientific development.

description.zhCN: 罗马战胜迦太基，获得西西里岛、撒丁岛和科西嘉岛，成为地中海地区的主要海上强国。
description.enUS: Rome defeated Carthage, gaining Sicily, Sardinia, and Corsica, becoming a major naval power in the Mediterranean region.

description.zhCN:
该年，秦军兵临齐国都城临淄（今山东淄博），齐王建未作抵抗，直接归降，齐国灭亡。至此，韩、赵、魏、楚、燕、齐六国均被秦国兼并，战国时代结束。
秦王嬴政在咸阳召集群臣，议定新称号，确立“皇帝”尊号，自称“始皇帝”，并废除分封制，推行郡县制。
嬴政颁布诏令，推行全国统一的文字（小篆）、货币（圆形方孔钱）、度量衡标准及交通规范（车同轨）。
description.enUS: In that year, Qin forces reached Qi's capital, Linzi (now Zibo, Shandong). Qi King Jian surrendered without resistance, and Qi fell. With this, the six states—Han, Zhao, Wei, Chu, Yan, and Qi—were annexed by Qin, ending the Warring States period. In Xianyang, King Ying Zheng convened his court, adopted the title "Emperor," proclaiming himself "First Emperor" (Shi Huang). He abolished feudalism, implementing the prefecture-county system. Ying Zheng issued decrees standardizing script (Small Seal), currency (round coins with square holes), weights and measures, and transportation (uniform axle widths).

description.zhCN: 迦太基将军汉尼拔翻越阿尔卑斯山入侵意大利，引发了罗马与迦太基之间规模最大、影响最深远的战争。
description.enUS: Carthaginian general Hannibal invaded Italy by crossing the Alps, sparking the largest and most impactful war between Rome and Carthage.

title.zhCN: 秦始皇陵兵马俑的建造
title.enUS: Construction of the Terracotta Army at Qin Shi Huang's Mausoleum

description.zhCN: 秦始皇驾崩，其陵墓中庞大的兵马俑陪葬坑被建造完成，生动展现了秦朝的军事力量和艺术水平，是世界第八大奇迹。
description.enUS: Upon Qin Shi Huang's death, the vast Terracotta Army pits in his mausoleum were completed, vividly showcasing the military might and artistic skill of the Qin Dynasty, and are considered the eighth wonder of the world.

title.enUS: Chen Sheng and Wu Guang Uprising

description.zhCN: 秦末，因遇雨延期行役，陈胜、吴广在大泽乡率领农民发动起义，提出“王侯将相宁有种乎”，拉开了秦末农民战争的序幕。
description.enUS: In the late Qin Dynasty, due to delays caused by rain, Chen Sheng and Wu Guang led a peasant uprising at Daze Township, proclaiming 'Are kings and generals born with a destiny?', initiating the peasant wars at the end of Qin.

description.zhCN: 项羽率楚军在巨鹿以少胜多，大败秦军主力，此战奠定了项羽在反秦武装中的领导地位，加速了秦朝的灭亡。
description.enUS: Xiang Yu led the Chu army to a decisive victory against the main Qin forces at Julu, overcoming numerical disadvantage. This battle established Xiang Yu's leadership among the anti-Qin forces and accelerated the fall of the Qin Dynasty.

title.enUS: Liu Bang Enters Xianyang, Qin Dynasty Falls

description.zhCN: 刘邦率先攻入秦都咸阳，秦王子婴投降，秦朝正式灭亡，标志着中国历史上第一个统一王朝的终结。
description.enUS: Liu Bang was the first to capture Xianyang, the Qin capital. Prince Ziying of Qin surrendered, and the Qin Dynasty officially fell, marking the end of China's first unified dynasty.

description.zhCN: 项羽在鸿门设宴，意图刺杀刘邦，但因范增谋略不周和项伯保护，刘邦得以脱身，成为楚汉争霸的重要转折。
description.enUS: Xiang Yu hosted a banquet at Hong Gate, intending to assassinate Liu Bang. However, due to Fan Zeng's flawed strategy and Xiang Bo's protection, Liu Bang escaped, becoming a crucial turning point in the Chu-Han Contention.

description.zhCN: 楚汉战争期间，项羽在彭城大败刘邦联军，刘邦几乎全军覆没，但最终得以逃脱，展现了项羽的军事才能。
description.enUS: During the Chu-Han Contention, Xiang Yu decisively defeated Liu Bang's allied forces at Pengcheng. Liu Bang's army was almost annihilated, but he eventually escaped, showcasing Xiang Yu's military prowess.

title.zhCN: 垓下之战，项羽乌江自刎
title.enUS: Battle of Gaixia, Xiang Yu Commits Suicide at Wujiang

description.zhCN: 刘邦联合韩信、彭越在垓下合围项羽，项羽兵败，最终在乌江边自刎，标志着楚汉战争的结束和刘邦的最终胜利。
description.enUS: Liu Bang, allied with Han Xin and Peng Yue, encircled Xiang Yu at Gaixia. Xiang Yu's forces were defeated, and he ultimately committed suicide by the Wujiang River, marking the end of the Chu-Han Contention and Liu Bang's ultimate victory.

title.enUS: Liu Bang Proclaimed Emperor at Dingtao

description.zhCN: 刘邦在定陶（今山东菏泽定陶区）汜水之阳举行登基大典。楚王韩信、梁王彭越等诸侯王联名上书拥立，刘邦接受帝位，定国号为“汉”，建都雒阳（后迁长安），正式建立汉王朝，史称西汉。
description.enUS: Liu Bang held a coronation ceremony at the north bank of the Si River in Dingtao (modern Dingtao District, Heze, Shandong). Kings of Chu (Han Xin), Liang (Peng Yue), and other feudal lords jointly petitioned for his enthronement. Liu Bang accepted the imperial title, established the state name as "Han," and initially set the capital at Luoyang (later moved to Chang'an), formally founding the Han Dynasty, historically known as the Western Han.

description.zhCN: 迦太基战败，被迫割让所有海外领土并缴纳巨额赔款，罗马成为地中海西部毋庸置疑的霸主。
description.enUS: Carthage was defeated, forced to cede all overseas territories and pay a large indemnity, making Rome the undisputed hegemon of the Western Mediterranean.

description.zhCN: 汉高祖刘邦亲率大军征讨匈奴，但在白登被匈奴冒顿单于围困七日七夜，最终通过贿赂得以解围，促使西汉采取和亲政策。
description.enUS: Emperor Gaozu Liu Bang personally led a large army to campaign against the Xiongnu but was besieged by Modu Chanyu of the Xiongnu at Baideng for seven days and nights. He eventually managed to escape through bribery, leading the Western Han to adopt a policy of heqin (peace through marriage).

description.zhCN: 托勒密五世时期刻写，包含相同内容的三种文字（古埃及圣书体、世俗体和古希腊文），是后来法国学者商博良解读古埃及象形文字的关键。
description.enUS: Carved during the reign of Ptolemy V, the Rosetta Stone contains the same text in three scripts (ancient Egyptian hieroglyphic, Demotic, and ancient Greek). It was crucial for the French scholar Jean-François Champollion in deciphering ancient Egyptian hieroglyphs.

description.zhCN: 罗马在皮德纳决定性地击败马其顿珀尔修斯，标志着马其顿王国的彻底灭亡，希腊城邦彻底失去独立性。
description.enUS: Rome decisively defeated Perseus of Macedon at Pydna, marking the complete downfall of the Macedonian Kingdom and the definitive loss of independence for Greek city-states.

description.zhCN: 汉景帝听从晁错建议削藩，吴楚等七个诸侯国联合反叛，被太尉周亚夫平定，此后中央集权进一步加强。
description.enUS: Emperor Jing of Han, following Chao Cuo's advice, reduced the power of feudal states. Seven vassal states, including Wu and Chu, jointly rebelled but were suppressed by Grand Commandant Zhou Yafu, further strengthening central authority thereafter.

description.zhCN: 罗马对迦太基发起最后的战争，以彻底摧毁其潜在的威胁，反映了罗马的扩张野心。
description.enUS: Rome launched a final war against Carthage to completely destroy its potential threat, reflecting Rome's expansionist ambitions.

description.zhCN: 罗马军团攻陷并彻底摧毁科林斯城，作为对希腊反抗的惩罚，标志着罗马对希腊的完全征服。
description.enUS: Roman legions captured and utterly destroyed the city of Corinth as punishment for Greek resistance, marking Rome's complete conquest of Greece.

description.zhCN: 罗马攻陷并彻底摧毁迦太基城，标志着迦太基的终结，其领土成为罗马非洲行省。
description.enUS: Rome captured and completely destroyed the city of Carthage, marking the end of Carthage, with its territory becoming the Roman province of Africa.

title.enUS: Zhang Qian's First Diplomatic Mission to the Western Regions

description.zhCN: 汉武帝派张骞出使西域，寻求联合大月氏以对抗匈奴。张骞历经十三年，虽未达成军事联盟，但带回大量西域地理和风俗信息。
description.enUS: Emperor Wu of Han sent Zhang Qian on a diplomatic mission to the Western Regions, seeking an alliance with the Dayuezhi against the Xiongnu. After thirteen years, Zhang Qian, though failing to secure a military alliance, brought back valuable information on the geography and customs of the Western Regions.

title.zhCN: 汉武帝采纳董仲舒“独尊儒术”建议
title.enUS: Emperor Wu of Han Adopts Dong Zhongshu's 'Exclusively Honoring Confucianism' Proposal

description.zhCN: 儒家学者董仲舒向汉武帝提出“罢黜百家，独尊儒术”的建议，被武帝采纳并付诸实施，儒家思想由此成为中国封建社会正统思想，影响深远。
description.enUS: Confucian scholar Dong Zhongshu proposed 'Banning all other schools, exclusively honoring Confucianism' to Emperor Wu of Han. Upon its adoption and implementation, Confucianism became the orthodox ideology of Chinese feudal society, with far-reaching influence.

description.zhCN: 保民官提比略·格拉古提出土地改革法案，旨在解决贫富分化和社会矛盾，但最终被反对派刺杀，开启了罗马政治暴力的先河。
description.enUS: Tiberius Gracchus, a tribune of the plebs, proposed land reform to address wealth disparity and social conflict, but was ultimately assassinated by opponents, initiating an era of political violence in Rome.

description.zhCN: 盖乌斯·马略允许无产者入伍，创建了职业化军队，增强了军队战斗力，但也为个人军事独裁埋下伏笔。
description.enUS: Gaius Marius allowed landless citizens to enlist, creating a professional army that increased military effectiveness but also laid the groundwork for individual military dictatorships.

title.enUS: Completion of Records of the Grand Historian

description.zhCN: 西汉史学家司马迁耗费巨资和心血，完成《史记》的编纂，开创了纪传体通史的先河，对后世史学影响巨大。
description.enUS: Sima Qian, a Western Han historian, expended vast resources and effort to complete the compilation of the Records of the Grand Historian, pioneering the biographical-chronological style of general history, which profoundly influenced later historiography.

description.zhCN: 马略的对手苏拉率军攻入罗马城，镇压政治对手，开创了罗马将领以武力干预政治的先例，标志着罗马共和国危机的加剧。
description.enUS: Sulla, Marius' opponent, marched his army into Rome to suppress political rivals, setting a precedent for Roman generals to intervene in politics by force and escalating the crisis of the Roman Republic.

description.zhCN: 角斗士斯巴达克斯领导大规模奴隶起义，震撼了罗马共和国，暴露了奴隶制度的脆弱性。
description.enUS: The gladiator Spartacus led a massive slave revolt that shook the Roman Republic and exposed the fragility of the slave system.

title.zhCN: 斯巴达克斯起义被镇压

description.zhCN: 克拉苏和庞培联手镇压了斯巴达克斯起义，数千名起义者被处死，显示了罗马统治的残酷性。
description.enUS: Crassus and Pompey together suppressed Spartacus' revolt, with thousands of rebels executed, demonstrating the brutality of Roman rule.

title.zhCN: 第一次三巨头同盟成立

description.zhCN: 凯撒、庞培和克拉苏秘密结盟，共同掌握罗马政治权力，架空元老院，是共和国走向衰落的重要标志。
description.enUS: Caesar, Pompey, and Crassus secretly formed an alliance to jointly wield Roman political power, bypassing the Senate, marking a significant sign of the Republic's decline.

title.enUS: Western Han Establishes the Protectorate of the Western Regions

description.zhCN: 为加强对西域地区的管理，西汉在乌垒城设立西域都护府，标志着西域正式纳入中国版图，对丝绸之路的畅通有重要意义。
description.enUS: To strengthen governance over the Western Regions, the Western Han established the Protectorate of the Western Regions in Wulei City, marking the official inclusion of the Western Regions into Chinese territory and holding significant importance for the smooth flow of the Silk Road.

description.zhCN: 凯撒在高卢地区发动一系列战役，最终征服高卢，为罗马带来了巨大财富和声望，也锻炼了他的军事力量。
description.enUS: Caesar launched a series of campaigns in Gaul, ultimately conquering it, bringing immense wealth and prestige to Rome, and honing his military prowess.

description.zhCN: 凯撒率军渡过卢比孔河，向罗马进军，标志着罗马内战的全面爆发，成为一句著名的历史格言。
description.enUS: Caesar crossed the Rubicon with his army and marched on Rome, marking the full outbreak of the Roman Civil War and becoming a famous historical idiom.

description.zhCN: 凯撒推行新的历法，比旧历更精确，成为欧洲沿用了16个世纪的标准历法，体现了罗马的科学和管理进步。
description.enUS: Caesar introduced a new calendar, more accurate than the old one, which became the standard calendar in Europe for 16 centuries, reflecting Roman scientific and administrative progress.

description.zhCN: 罗马独裁者凯撒在元老院被共和派刺杀，旨在恢复共和，但反而引发了更激烈的内战和政治混乱。
description.enUS: Julius Caesar, dictator of Rome, was assassinated by republican conspirators in the Senate, intending to restore the Republic, but instead triggering more intense civil war and political chaos.

description.zhCN: 屋大维、安东尼和雷必达结成同盟，共同掌握罗马权力，旨在报复刺杀凯撒者并分割权力。
description.enUS: Octavian, Antony, and Lepidus formed an alliance to jointly wield Roman power, aiming to avenge Caesar's assassination and divide authority.

description.zhCN: 屋大维的舰队在希腊西海岸的亚克兴角击败安东尼和克利奥帕特拉的联军，标志着罗马内战的最终胜利。
description.enUS: Octavian's fleet defeated the combined forces of Antony and Cleopatra at Actium on the western coast of Greece, marking the final victory of the Roman Civil War.

description.zhCN: 屋大维在亚克兴角战役中击败马克·安东尼和克利奥帕特拉七世，埃及成为罗马帝国的一个行省，标志着古埃及法老统治的彻底终结。
description.enUS: Octavian (later Augustus) defeated Mark Antony and Cleopatra VII at the Battle of Actium. Egypt became a Roman province, marking the definitive end of pharaonic rule in ancient Egypt.

title.zhCN: 屋大维被授予奥古斯都称号

description.zhCN: 元老院授予屋大维“奥古斯都”称号，标志着罗马共和国的终结和罗马帝国的开端，开创了罗马和平与繁荣的时代。
description.enUS: The Senate granted Octavian the title of 'Augustus,' marking the end of the Roman Republic and the beginning of the Roman Empire, ushering in an era of Roman peace and prosperity.

title.enUS: Wang Mang Usurps Han, Establishes the Xin Dynasty

description.zhCN: 西汉外戚王莽通过禅让形式，废黜孺子婴，建立新朝，推行一系列改革，但最终因政策不当和天灾人祸而覆灭。
description.enUS: Wang Mang, an imperial relative of the Western Han, deposed Emperor Ruzi Ying through abdication, established the Xin Dynasty, and implemented a series of reforms. However, his rule ultimately collapsed due to misguided policies and natural disasters combined with human misfortunes.

title.zhCN: 绿林军攻入长安，新朝灭亡
title.enUS: Green Forest Army Enters Chang'an, Xin Dynasty Falls

description.zhCN: 绿林军攻入长安，王莽被杀，新朝灭亡，标志着西汉与东汉之间短暂的过渡王朝的终结。
description.enUS: The Green Forest Army entered Chang'an, Wang Mang was killed, and the Xin Dynasty fell, marking the end of the brief transitional dynasty between the Western and Eastern Han.

title.enUS: Liu Xiu Establishes the Eastern Han Dynasty

description.zhCN: 绿林、赤眉起义推翻王莽新朝后，刘玄建立更始政权。刘秀在河北站稳脚跟，于洛阳称帝，建立东汉，恢复了汉室统治。
description.enUS: After the Green Forest and Red Eyebrows uprisings overthrew Wang Mang's Xin Dynasty, Liu Xuan established the Gengshi regime. Liu Xiu consolidated his position in Hebei, proclaimed himself emperor in Luoyang, and established the Eastern Han Dynasty, restoring Han rule.

description.zhCN: 罗马皇帝克劳狄乌斯派军入侵不列颠，建立罗马不列颠尼亚行省，首府为卡姆罗多努姆（今科尔切斯特）。
description.enUS: Emperor Claudius sent Roman forces to invade Britain, establishing the province of Britannia with its capital at Camulodunum (modern Colchester).

description.zhCN: 克劳狄乌斯逝世后，尼禄继位，其统治初期表现良好，但后期因暴政和荒淫引发广泛不满。
description.enUS: After Claudius' death, Nero ascended to the throne. His early reign was promising, but his later rule was marked by tyranny and extravagance, leading to widespread discontent.

description.zhCN: 罗马城发生大规模火灾，对城市造成巨大破坏，尼禄被指控纵火并嫁祸基督徒，加剧了对基督徒的迫害。
description.enUS: A massive fire broke out in Rome, causing extensive damage to the city. Nero was accused of arson and blaming Christians, intensifying the persecution of Christians.

description.zhCN: 相传东汉明帝夜梦金人，派使者西行求法，将佛教经典和僧侣带回洛阳，建白马寺，标志着佛教正式传入中国。
description.enUS: Legend holds that Emperor Ming of Eastern Han dreamed of a golden man, sent envoys to the West to seek Dharma, and brought Buddhist scriptures and monks back to Luoyang, where White Horse Temple was built, marking the official introduction of Buddhism to China.

title.zhCN: 尼禄自杀与“四帝之年”开始
title.enUS: Nero's Suicide and the 'Year of the Four Emperors' Begins

description.zhCN: 尼禄因叛乱而自杀，导致罗马帝国陷入内战，一年内出现了四位皇帝，标志着帝国政治不稳定期的到来。
description.enUS: Nero committed suicide due to rebellion, plunging the Roman Empire into civil war. Four emperors emerged within a single year, marking the beginning of a period of political instability for the empire.

description.zhCN: 罗马将军提图斯率军攻陷耶路撒冷，摧毁了第二圣殿，结束了第一次犹太战争，对犹太历史和文化产生了深远影响。
description.enUS: Roman general Titus captured Jerusalem and destroyed the Second Temple, ending the First Jewish-Roman War, which had a profound impact on Jewish history and culture.

description.zhCN: 维苏威火山爆发，摧毁了庞贝、赫库兰尼姆等城市，造成巨大人员伤亡，但也为后世留下了保存完好的罗马城市遗址。
description.enUS: Mount Vesuvius erupted, destroying cities like Pompeii and Herculaneum and causing immense casualties, but also preserving well-preserved Roman urban archaeological sites for posterity.

description.zhCN: 提图斯皇帝完成了其父韦斯巴芗启动的罗马斗兽场建设，成为罗马帝国宏伟建筑的象征，用于角斗士比赛和公共表演。
description.enUS: Emperor Titus completed the construction of the Colosseum, initiated by his father Vespasian. It became a symbol of monumental Roman architecture, used for gladiatorial contests and public spectacles.

title.zhCN: 图密善遇刺与五贤帝时代开始
title.enUS: Assassination of Domitian and Beginning of the Five Good Emperors

description.zhCN: 图密善被刺杀，元老院推举涅尔瓦继位，开启了罗马帝国长达近一个世纪的“五贤帝时代”，标志着相对和平与繁荣。
description.enUS: Domitian was assassinated, and the Senate elected Nerva as emperor, initiating the nearly century-long 'Five Good Emperors' period of the Roman Empire, marked by relative peace and prosperity.

description.zhCN: 东汉宦官蔡伦总结前人经验，改进了造纸术，扩大了造纸原料来源，使得纸张能够大规模生产，对文化传播具有划时代意义。
description.enUS: Cai Lun, an Eastern Han eunuch, summarized previous experiences and improved papermaking technology, expanding the sources of raw materials for paper, enabling large-scale paper production, and marking a new era for cultural dissemination.

description.zhCN: 图拉真皇帝在两次达契亚战争后彻底征服达契亚王国，将其变为罗马行省，为帝国带来了巨额黄金和财富。
description.enUS: Emperor Trajan completely conquered the Dacian kingdom after two Dacian Wars, transforming it into a Roman province and bringing immense gold and wealth to the empire.

description.zhCN: 为纪念图拉真皇帝征服达契亚而修建的宏伟胜利柱，其螺旋浮雕生动描绘了战争场景，是罗马艺术和工程的杰作。
description.enUS: A magnificent victory column built to commemorate Emperor Trajan's conquest of Dacia, with spiral reliefs vividly depicting war scenes, a masterpiece of Roman art and engineering.

description.zhCN: 哈德良皇帝下令在不列颠修建大型防御工事，以巩固帝国北部边界，防止野蛮部落入侵，是罗马防御工事的杰作。
description.enUS: Emperor Hadrian ordered the construction of a large defensive fortification in Britain to secure the empire's northern border and prevent barbarian invasions, a masterpiece of Roman defensive engineering.

description.zhCN: 东汉科学家张衡发明了世界上第一台用于测定地震方向的仪器——候风地动仪，体现了中国古代科技的先进水平。
description.enUS: Zhang Heng, an Eastern Han scientist, invented the world's first instrument for determining earthquake direction, the seismograph, demonstrating the advanced level of ancient Chinese science and technology.

description.zhCN: 罗马帝国爆发大规模瘟疫，可能为天花或麻疹，导致大量人口死亡，对帝国社会和经济造成严重打击。
description.enUS: A widespread plague, possibly smallpox or measles, erupted in the Roman Empire, causing significant population loss and severely impacting the empire's society and economy.

description.zhCN: 太平道首领张角发动大规模农民起义，因起义军头裹黄巾而得名。起义虽然被镇压，但严重动摇了东汉王朝的统治。
description.enUS: Zhang Jiao, leader of the Way of Great Peace, launched a large-scale peasant uprising, named after the yellow headscarves worn by the rebels. Although suppressed, the rebellion severely destabilized the Eastern Han Dynasty.

description.zhCN: 汉灵帝驾崩后，大将军何进召董卓进京，董卓趁机控制朝政，废少帝，立献帝，开启了东汉末年军阀混战的局面。
description.enUS: After Emperor Ling of Han's death, Grand General He Jin summoned Dong Zhuo to the capital. Dong Zhuo seized the opportunity to control the court, depose the young emperor, and enthrone Emperor Xian, initiating the era of warlordism at the end of the Eastern Han Dynasty.

title.enUS: Cao Cao 'Holds the Son of Heaven to Command the Feudal Lords'

description.zhCN: 曹操将汉献帝迎到许都（今河南许昌），以此号令天下，为曹操统一北方奠定了政治基础，并加速了汉末走向三国分裂的进程。
description.enUS: Cao Cao welcomed Emperor Xian of Han to Xudu (present-day Xuchang, Henan) and used him to issue commands to the realm, laying the political foundation for Cao Cao's unification of the North and accelerating the process towards the Three Kingdoms division at the end of Han.

description.zhCN: 曹操在官渡以少胜多，击败北方军阀袁绍，奠定了曹操在北方地区的统治地位，是中国古代史上以弱胜强的著名战例。
description.enUS: Cao Cao, outnumbered, defeated the northern warlord Yuan Shao at Guandu, establishing Cao Cao's dominance in the northern region and becoming a famous example of a weaker force overcoming a stronger one in ancient Chinese history.

description.zhCN: 曹操率大军南下，与孙权、刘备联军在赤壁决战，曹军惨败，奠定了三国鼎立的局面，成为中国历史上著名的以少胜多战役。
description.enUS: Cao Cao led a large army southwards and engaged in a decisive battle with the allied forces of Sun Quan and Liu Bei at Red Cliffs. Cao's army suffered a crushing defeat, establishing the tripartite division of the Three Kingdoms, and becoming a famous example of a smaller force defeating a larger one in Chinese history.

description.zhCN: 卡拉卡拉皇帝颁布敕令，授予帝国境内所有自由民罗马公民权，极大扩展了公民群体，但也导致公民权贬值和税基扩大。
description.enUS: Emperor Caracalla issued an edict granting Roman citizenship to all free men within the empire, significantly expanding the citizen body but also devaluing citizenship and broadening the tax base.

title.enUS: Cao Pi Usurps Han, Establishes Cao Wei

description.zhCN: 曹操之子曹丕逼迫汉献帝禅让帝位，建立曹魏政权，定都洛阳，标志着东汉王朝的彻底灭亡和中国历史进入三国时期。
description.enUS: Cao Pi, son of Cao Cao, forced Emperor Xian of Han to abdicate, establishing the Cao Wei regime with its capital in Luoyang, marking the complete fall of the Eastern Han Dynasty and the beginning of the Three Kingdoms period in Chinese history.

title.enUS: Liu Bei Proclaims Emperor, Establishes Shu Han

description.zhCN: 刘备在曹丕代汉后，于成都称帝，沿用汉的国号，史称蜀汉。
description.enUS: After Cao Pi usurped Han, Liu Bei proclaimed himself emperor in Chengdu, retaining the Han dynastic title, historically known as Shu Han.

description.zhCN: 刘备为关羽复仇，率军攻打东吴，被陆逊火攻大败于夷陵，蜀汉元气大伤，巩固了孙权在江东的地位。
description.enUS: Liu Bei, seeking revenge for Guan Yu, led an army to attack Eastern Wu and was decisively defeated by Lu Xun's fire attack at Yiling. Shu Han suffered heavy losses, consolidating Sun Quan's position in Jiangdong.

title.enUS: Sun Quan Proclaims Emperor, Establishes Eastern Wu

description.zhCN: 孙权在曹魏和蜀汉相继建立后，于武昌（后迁建业）称帝，建立东吴政权，至此三国鼎立局面正式形成。
description.enUS: After Cao Wei and Shu Han were successively established, Sun Quan proclaimed himself emperor in Wuchang (later Jianye), establishing the Eastern Wu regime, thereby formally completing the tripartite division of the Three Kingdoms.

description.zhCN: 蜀汉丞相诸葛亮率军北伐曹魏，在五丈原与司马懿对峙，最终诸葛亮病逝军中，北伐无功而返。
description.enUS: Zhuge Liang, Chancellor of Shu Han, led his army on a Northern Expedition against Cao Wei, confronting Sima Yi at Wuzhang Plains. Zhuge Liang ultimately died in the army, and the expedition ended without success.

title.enUS: Beginning of the 'Crisis of the Third Century'

description.zhCN: 塞维鲁王朝最后一位皇帝被刺杀，罗马帝国陷入长达50年的政治、军事和经济危机，频繁更换皇帝，边境压力巨大。
description.enUS: The assassination of the last Severan emperor plunged the Roman Empire into a 50-year political, military, and economic crisis, marked by frequent changes in emperors and immense border pressure.

title.zhCN: 卑弥呼派遣使者至曹魏
title.enUS: Queen Himiko Sends an Envoy to Cao Wei

description.zhCN: 根据《三国志·魏志·倭人传》记载，邪马台国女王卑弥呼派遣使者难升米、都市牛利等人，远赴中国曹魏的京城洛阳，向明帝曹叡进贡。这次使节往来标志着日本与中国最早的有确切年份记载的外交关系。
description.enUS: According to the 'Records of the Three Kingdoms: Wei Chronicle: Account of the Wa people,' Queen Himiko of Yamatai-koku sent envoys like Nashime and Toshi Uri to Luoyang, the capital of Cao Wei, to pay tribute to Emperor Ming. This diplomatic exchange marks the earliest reliably dated event in Japan's international relations.

title.enUS: Himiko's Conflict with the Kingdom of Kunu

description.zhCN: 《三国志》记载，邪马台国与邻近的狗奴国之间发生激烈战争。卑弥呼再次向曹魏求援，希望获得支持以对抗敌人。这表明当时日本列岛上的小国之间存在着复杂的政治和军事冲突。
description.enUS: The 'Records of the Three Kingdoms' notes that Yamatai-koku was engaged in a fierce war with its neighboring state, the Kingdom of Kunu. Himiko once again sought aid from Cao Wei, hoping for support against her enemies. This indicates the complex political and military conflicts among the small states on the Japanese archipelago at the time.

description.zhCN: 司马懿趁曹爽陪魏帝曹芳出城扫墓之际发动政变，诛杀曹爽及其党羽，掌握曹魏军政大权，为司马氏代魏奠定基础。
description.enUS: Sima Yi launched a coup while Cao Shuang accompanied Emperor Cao Fang of Wei to sweep graves outside the city, executing Cao Shuang and his faction, seizing military and political power in Cao Wei, and laying the foundation for the Sima family to usurp Wei.

description.zhCN: 罗马将领波斯图穆斯在高卢、不列颠和西班牙等地建立独立的政权，进一步分裂了罗马帝国，反映了中央政府的失控。
description.enUS: Roman general Postumus established an independent polity in Gaul, Britain, and Hispania, further fragmenting the Roman Empire and reflecting the central government's loss of control.

description.zhCN: 曹魏派遣邓艾、钟会等大举进攻蜀汉，邓艾偷渡阴平，直抵成都，蜀汉后主刘禅投降，蜀汉灭亡。
description.enUS: Cao Wei dispatched Deng Ai, Zhong Hui, and others to launch a large-scale invasion of Shu Han. Deng Ai secretly crossed Yinping, directly reaching Chengdu. Liu Shan, the last emperor of Shu Han, surrendered, leading to Shu Han's demise.

title.zhCN: 司马炎代魏建晋，西晋建立
title.enUS: Sima Yan Usurps Wei and Establishes Jin, Western Jin Established

description.zhCN: 司马昭之子司马炎逼迫魏元帝曹奂禅让帝位，建立晋朝（史称西晋），定都洛阳，标志着曹魏政权的终结。
description.enUS: Sima Yan, son of Sima Zhao, forced Emperor Yuan of Wei, Cao Huan, to abdicate, establishing the Jin Dynasty (historically known as Western Jin) with its capital in Luoyang, marking the end of the Cao Wei regime.

description.zhCN: 东部帕尔米拉的统治者奥登纳图斯死后，其妻芝诺比娅建立独立帝国，控制了罗马东部行省，加剧了帝国分裂。
description.enUS: After the death of Odenathus, ruler of Palmyra in the East, his wife Zenobia established an independent empire, controlling Rome's eastern provinces and intensifying the empire's fragmentation.

description.zhCN: 奥勒良皇帝为保护罗马城免受蛮族入侵而修建了坚固的城墙，标志着罗马帝国防御策略的转变。
description.enUS: Aurelian ascended to the throne. With his exceptional military and political skills, he reunified the Roman Empire in a short period, earning the title 'Restorer of the World'.

description.zhCN: 奥勒良皇帝击败芝诺比娅的帕尔米拉军队，收复了东方分裂的行省，短暂恢复了帝国的统一。
description.enUS: Emperor Aurelian defeated Zenobia's Palmyrene army and recovered the seceded eastern provinces, briefly restoring the empire's unity.

description.zhCN: 奥勒良皇帝通过军事行动和外交手段，将高卢帝国重新并入罗马帝国，基本结束了“三世纪危机”中的分裂局面。
description.enUS: Through military action and diplomacy, Emperor Aurelian reintegrated the Gallic Empire into the Roman Empire, largely ending the fragmentation seen during the 'Crisis of the Third Century'.

description.zhCN: 西晋大举出兵进攻东吴，吴主孙皓投降，至此三国归晋，中国再次实现短暂的统一。
description.enUS: The Western Jin launched a large-scale military campaign against Eastern Wu. Sun Hao, the ruler of Wu, surrendered, thus unifying the Three Kingdoms under Jin, and China achieved a brief period of reunification.

title.enUS: Rebellion of the Eight Princes Breaks Out

description.zhCN: 西晋惠帝时期，以贾南风专权为导火索，诸王为争夺中央权力而相互攻伐，历时十六年，严重削弱了西晋统治，导致国力衰退。
description.enUS: During Emperor Hui's reign in Western Jin, ignited by Empress Jia Nanfeng's usurpation of power, various princes fought each other for central authority. Lasting sixteen years, this severely weakened Western Jin rule and led to national decline.

title.zhCN: 四帝共治制度正式建立

description.zhCN: 戴克里先正式设立四帝共治制度，将帝国划分为东西两部，各设一位奥古斯都和一位凯撒，以分担统治压力并确保继承。
description.enUS: Diocletian formally established the Tetrarchy, dividing the empire into Eastern and Western halves, each with an Augustus and a Caesar, to share governing responsibilities and ensure succession.

title.zhCN: 戴克里先颁布《最高限价法令》

description.zhCN: 为了遏制通货膨胀，戴克里先皇帝颁布法令，对商品和劳务价格设置最高限价，但未能成功稳定经济，反而导致黑市盛行。
description.enUS: To curb inflation, Emperor Diocletian issued an edict setting maximum prices for goods and services, but it failed to stabilize the economy and instead led to widespread black markets.

description.zhCN: 戴克里先皇帝对基督徒发起帝国史上最后一次也是最残酷的大规模迫害，旨在恢复传统罗马宗教和维护帝国统一。
description.enUS: Emperor Diocletian launched the last and most severe large-scale persecution of Christians in imperial history, aiming to restore traditional Roman religion and maintain imperial unity.

title.zhCN: 刘渊建汉，五胡乱华开端
title.enUS: Liu Yuan Establishes Han, Beginning of the Five Barbarians Uprising

description.zhCN: 南匈奴贵族刘渊在晋末八王之乱之际起兵，自称汉王，建立汉赵（后称前赵），标志着北方少数民族内迁与中原王朝冲突的加剧。
description.enUS: Liu Yuan, a noble of the Southern Xiongnu, raised an army during the Rebellion of the Eight Princes in late Jin, proclaiming himself King of Han and establishing Han Zhao (later Former Zhao), marking the intensification of conflicts between northern ethnic minorities and the Central Plains dynasty.

description.zhCN: 匈奴刘曜攻陷洛阳，俘虏晋怀帝，造成“永嘉之乱”，西晋灭亡，北方陷入长期的胡汉对立和分裂割据。
description.enUS: Liu Yao of the Xiongnu captured Luoyang and imprisoned Emperor Huai of Jin, leading to the 'Yongjia Rebellion.' The Western Jin fell, and the North descended into a long period of ethnic conflict and fragmentation.

description.zhCN: 君士坦丁在罗马米尔维安大桥击败马克森提乌斯，成为西罗马帝国的唯一统治者，传说他在此战前看到了十字架的异象。
description.enUS: Constantine defeated Maxentius at the Milvian Bridge in Rome, becoming the sole ruler of the Western Roman Empire. Legend states he saw a vision of a cross before this battle.

description.zhCN: 君士坦丁大帝与李锡尼共同颁布法令，宣布罗马帝国境内对所有宗教信仰自由，结束了对基督徒的迫害。
description.enUS: Emperor Constantine and Licinius jointly issued an edict declaring religious freedom for all faiths within the Roman Empire, ending the persecution of Christians.

description.zhCN: 西晋灭亡后，琅琊王司马睿在江南建康（今南京）称帝，建立东晋，偏安江南，与北方胡人政权长期对峙。
description.enUS: After the fall of Western Jin, Sima Rui, King of Langya, proclaimed himself emperor in Jiankang (present-day Nanjing) in Jiangnan, establishing the Eastern Jin Dynasty. It settled in the South, facing a long standoff with northern nomadic regimes.

description.zhCN: 君士坦丁大帝将帝国首都从罗马迁至拜占庭，更名为君士坦丁堡，标志着罗马帝国政治重心东移，并对帝国未来发展产生深远影响。
description.enUS: Emperor Constantine moved the imperial capital from Rome to Byzantium, renaming it Constantinople. This marked a shift in the Roman Empire's political center eastward and had a profound impact on its future development.

title.enUS: Huan Wen's Northern Expedition Recaptures Chengdu

description.zhCN: 东晋权臣桓温率军北伐，成功收复了被成汉占据的成都，展现了东晋北伐的力量，但未能彻底恢复中原。
description.enUS: Huan Wen, a powerful official of Eastern Jin, led a northern expedition and successfully recaptured Chengdu, which had been occupied by Cheng Han. This demonstrated the Eastern Jin's military strength in the North, but it failed to fully restore the Central Plains.

description.zhCN: 哥特人在阿德里安堡大败罗马军队，瓦伦斯皇帝阵亡，此战役被认为是罗马帝国衰落的转折点。
description.enUS: The Goths decisively defeated the Roman army at Adrianople, and Emperor Valens was killed. This battle is considered a turning point in the decline of the Roman Empire.

title.enUS: Completion of Sou Shen Ji (In Search of the Supernatural)

description.zhCN: 东晋干宝编撰的志怪小说集《搜神记》成书，收录了大量神仙鬼怪故事，反映了魏晋南北朝时期民间信仰和文化特色。
description.enUS: Gan Bao's collection of supernatural tales, Sou Shen Ji, was compiled during the Eastern Jin. It contains numerous stories of gods, spirits, and demons, reflecting the folk beliefs and cultural characteristics of the Wei, Jin, Northern and Southern Dynasties period.

description.zhCN: 前秦苻坚率百万大军南下企图灭东晋，被谢玄、谢安率领的晋军以少胜多击败，保全了东晋半壁江山，奠定南北朝对峙局面。
description.enUS: Fu Jian of Former Qin led a million-strong army south, attempting to destroy Eastern Jin. He was defeated by the Jin army led by Xie Xuan and Xie An, who, though outnumbered, won a decisive victory. This preserved the Eastern Jin and established the North-South division.

description.zhCN: 鲜卑族拓跋珪在代北称王，建立北魏，逐渐统一北方，为后来北朝的建立和发展奠定了基础。
description.enUS: Tuoba Gui, of the Xianbei ethnic group, proclaimed himself king in Daibei and established the Northern Wei Dynasty. He gradually unified the North, laying the foundation for the later establishment and development of the Northern Dynasties.

title.zhCN: 狄奥多西一世禁止所有异教崇拜
title.enUS: Theodosius I Forbids All Pagan Worship

description.zhCN: 狄奥多西一世彻底禁止所有异教崇拜和献祭活动，标志着基督教在罗马帝国的完全胜利和异教的终结。
description.enUS: Theodosius I completely forbade all pagan worship and sacrifices, marking the complete triumph of Christianity in the Roman Empire and the end of paganism.

title.enUS: Formal Division of the Roman Empire

description.zhCN: 狄奥多西一世逝世后，罗马帝国正式分为东罗马帝国和西罗马帝国，从此再未统一，是帝国历史上的重要分水岭。
description.enUS: After Theodosius I's death, the Roman Empire formally split into the Eastern and Western Roman Empires, never to be reunited, a significant watershed in imperial history.

description.zhCN: 汪达尔人、阿兰人、苏维汇人等日耳曼部落渡过冰封的莱茵河，大规模入侵高卢，标志着罗马帝国西部边境防御体系的崩溃。
description.enUS: Vandal, Alan, and Suebian Germanic tribes crossed the frozen Rhine River, massively invading Gaul, marking the collapse of the Western Roman Empire's border defense system.

description.zhCN: 刘裕率东晋北伐军攻灭南燕，这是东晋北伐取得的重要胜利，也提升了刘裕的政治和军事声望。
description.enUS: Liu Yu led the Eastern Jin Northern Expeditionary army to conquer Southern Yan. This was an important victory for the Eastern Jin's northern campaigns and enhanced Liu Yu's political and military prestige.

description.zhCN: 西哥特国王阿拉里克率领军队攻入罗马城并进行洗劫，对罗马的心理冲击巨大，被视为帝国衰落的象征性事件。
description.enUS: Visigothic King Alaric led his army into Rome and sacked it, causing immense psychological shock to Rome and becoming a symbolic event of the empire's decline.

description.zhCN: 刘裕率大军北伐，攻陷长安，灭亡后秦，短暂收复关中和洛阳，达到了东晋北伐的最高成就。
description.enUS: Liu Yu led a large army on a Northern Expedition, capturing Chang'an and destroying Later Qin. This briefly recovered Guanzhong and Luoyang, marking the highest achievement of Eastern Jin's northern campaigns.

title.zhCN: 刘裕代晋建宋，南朝开始
title.enUS: Liu Yu Usurps Jin and Establishes Song, Beginning of Southern Dynasties

description.zhCN: 东晋大将刘裕废黜晋恭帝司马德文，自立为帝，建立刘宋王朝，定都建康，标志着东晋的灭亡，开启了中国历史上南北朝时期的序幕。
description.enUS: Liu Yu, a prominent general of the Eastern Jin, deposed Emperor Gong of Jin, Sima Dewen, and established himself as emperor, creating the Liu Song Dynasty with its capital in Jiankang. This marked the fall of the Eastern Jin and the beginning of the Northern and Southern Dynasties period in Chinese history.

description.zhCN: 汪达尔人越过直布罗陀海峡入侵罗马帝国重要的粮食产地北非，对西罗马帝国的经济和军事造成致命打击。
description.enUS: The Vandals crossed the Strait of Gibraltar and invaded North Africa, a vital grain-producing region for the Roman Empire, dealing a fatal blow to the economy and military of the Western Roman Empire.

description.zhCN: 汪达尔人攻占并定都罗马帝国在北非最重要的城市迦太基，建立了独立的汪达尔王国，控制了西地中海的海上贸易。
description.enUS: The Vandals captured and established their capital in Carthage, the most important Roman city in North Africa, forming an independent Vandal kingdom and controlling maritime trade in the Western Mediterranean.

description.zhCN: 北魏太武帝拓跋焘率军攻灭北凉，至此北魏统一北方，结束了十六国分裂割据的局面，形成了与南方刘宋对峙的格局。
description.enUS: Emperor Taiwu of Northern Wei, Tuoba Tao, led his army to conquer Northern Liang, thus unifying the North under Northern Wei. This ended the Sixteen Kingdoms' fragmentation and established a standoff with the Southern Liu Song Dynasty.

description.zhCN: 东罗马帝国皇帝狄奥多西二世下令编纂的罗马法典，收集整理了罗马帝国自君士坦丁大帝以来颁布的各项法律。
description.enUS: A Roman law code compiled by order of Eastern Roman Emperor Theodosius II, collecting and organizing various laws issued by the Roman Empire since Constantine the Great.

description.zhCN: 汪达尔国王盖萨里克率舰队从北非抵达罗马，对城市进行了为期两周的洗劫，比哥特人洗劫更为彻底。
description.enUS: Vandal king Gaiseric led his fleet from North Africa to Rome, sacking the city for two weeks, a more thorough plunder than the Visigothic sack.

title.enUS: Northern Wei Emperor Xiaowen's Reforms Begin

description.zhCN: 北魏孝文帝拓跋宏亲政后，推行汉化改革，包括迁都洛阳、改汉姓、说汉话、穿汉服等，促进了民族融合，加强了中央集权。
description.enUS: After Emperor Xiaowen of Northern Wei, Tuoba Hong, took personal control of the government, he implemented sinicization reforms, including moving the capital to Luoyang, adopting Han surnames, speaking Han language, and wearing Han clothing. This promoted ethnic integration and strengthened central authority.

description.zhCN: 日耳曼将领奥多亚塞罢黜西罗马末代皇帝罗慕路斯·奥古斯都，向拜占庭皇帝芝诺称臣。
description.enUS: Germanic commander Odoacer deposed last Western Emperor Romulus Augustulus, pledging allegiance to Eastern Emperor Zeno.

title.enUS: Northern Wei Emperor Xiaowen Moves Capital to Luoyang

description.zhCN: 北魏孝文帝为深化汉化改革，将都城从平城（今山西大同）迁至洛阳，此举加速了鲜卑族与汉族的融合。
description.enUS: To deepen sinicization reforms, Emperor Xiaowen of Northern Wei moved the capital from Pingcheng (present-day Datong, Shanxi) to Luoyang, accelerating the integration of the Xianbei and Han ethnic groups.

title.zhCN: 法兰克国王克洛维皈依基督教
title.enUS: Conversion of Clovis I to Christianity

description.zhCN: 法兰克国王克洛维一世在兰斯受洗，皈依罗马天主教。此举巩固了法兰克王国与罗马教会的关系，为法兰克人日后在西欧的崛起奠定基础。
description.enUS: Clovis I, King of the Franks, was baptized in Reims, converting to Roman Catholicism. This solidified the relationship between the Frankish Kingdom and the Roman Church, laying the groundwork for the Franks' future rise in Western Europe.

description.zhCN: 法兰克国王克洛维一世在武耶战役中击败西哥特人，巩固了法兰克人在高卢的统治，并推动了法兰克王国的扩张。
description.enUS: Frankish King Clovis I defeated the Visigoths at the Battle of Vouillé, solidifying Frankish rule in Gaul and promoting the expansion of the Frankish kingdom.

title.zhCN: 查士丁尼法典编纂启动

description.zhCN: 拜占庭皇帝查士丁尼一世下令编纂《民法大全》（即查士丁尼法典），系统整理和修订了罗马法，对后世欧洲的法律体系产生了深远影响。
description.enUS: Byzantine Emperor Justinian I ordered the compilation of the Corpus Juris Civilis (Justinian Code), a systematic collection and revision of Roman law that profoundly influenced later European legal systems.

description.zhCN: 君士坦丁堡爆发了影响广泛的尼卡暴动，对查士丁尼一世的统治构成严峻挑战，暴乱最终被残酷镇压，展现了皇权的强大。
description.enUS: The widespread Nika Riots erupted in Constantinople, posing a severe challenge to the rule of Justinian I. The rebellion was ultimately brutally suppressed, demonstrating the emperor's power.

description.zhCN: 位于君士坦丁堡的圣索菲亚大教堂竣工并举行落成典礼，其宏伟的建筑和独特的穹顶技术代表了拜占庭艺术和建筑的巅峰。
description.enUS: The Hagia Sophia in Constantinople was completed and consecrated. Its grand architecture and unique dome technology represented the pinnacle of Byzantine art and architecture.

description.zhCN: 起源于埃及的鼠疫蔓延至拜占庭帝国，导致人口锐减，对欧洲和近东的社会经济造成了严重破坏，是人类历史上最早的大规模鼠疫之一。
description.enUS: A plague originating in Egypt spread to the Byzantine Empire, causing massive population decline and severe socio-economic devastation in Europe and the Near East, becoming one of the earliest widespread plague pandemics in human history.

title.enUS: Eastern Wei and Western Wei Split

description.zhCN: 北魏权臣高欢与宇文泰斗争，导致北魏分裂为东魏和西魏，南北朝时期进入东魏、西魏与南朝梁对峙的新阶段。
description.enUS: The struggle between powerful Northern Wei officials Gao Huan and Yuwen Tai led to the split of Northern Wei into Eastern Wei and Western Wei, initiating a new phase of the Northern and Southern Dynasties with Eastern Wei, Western Wei, and Southern Liang in a standoff.

description.zhCN: 传说有僧侣将蚕种和养蚕技术从中国成功走私到拜占庭帝国，打破了中国对丝绸生产的垄断。
description.enUS: Legend says that monks successfully smuggled silkworm eggs and sericulture technology from China to the Byzantine Empire, breaking China's monopoly on silk production.

description.zhCN: 东魏权臣高欢之子高洋废黜东魏孝静帝，自立为帝，建立北齐王朝，取代东魏，继续与西魏对峙。
description.enUS: Gao Yang, son of powerful Eastern Wei official Gao Huan, deposed Emperor Xiaojing of Eastern Wei and established himself as emperor, creating the Northern Qi Dynasty, replacing Eastern Wei, and continuing to confront Western Wei.

description.zhCN: 拜占庭将领纳尔塞斯在巴斯塔加罗伦战役中击败东哥特国王托提拉，此战役成为哥特战争的转折点，标志着拜占庭帝国对意大利的重新征服进入收官阶段。
description.enUS: Byzantine general Narses defeated the Ostrogothic king Totila at the Battle of Busta Gallorum. This battle was a turning point in the Gothic War, marking the final phase of the Byzantine re-conquest of Italy.

description.zhCN: 西魏权臣宇文泰之子宇文觉废黜西魏恭帝，自立为帝，建立北周王朝，取代西魏，与北齐并立。
description.enUS: Yuwen Jue, son of powerful Western Wei official Yuwen Tai, deposed Emperor Gong of Western Wei and established himself as emperor, creating the Northern Zhou Dynasty, replacing Western Wei, and standing alongside Northern Qi.

description.zhCN: 伦巴底人在阿尔博因的带领下入侵意大利，建立伦巴底王国，使得意大利半岛陷入分裂，并改变了当地的政治和族群格局。
description.enUS: The Lombards, led by Alboin, invaded Italy and established the Lombard Kingdom. This fragmented the Italian peninsula and altered its political and ethnic landscape.

description.zhCN: 北周武帝宇文邕率军攻灭北齐，统一了北方，结束了北齐与北周长期对峙的局面，为隋朝统一全国奠定基础。
description.enUS: Emperor Wu of Northern Zhou, Yuwen Yong, led his army to conquer Northern Qi, unifying the North. This ended the long standoff between Northern Qi and Northern Zhou and laid the foundation for the Sui Dynasty's unification of China.

title.zhCN: 杨坚受禅建隋，隋朝建立
title.enUS: Yang Jian Receives Abdication, Establishes Sui Dynasty

description.zhCN: 北周外戚杨坚代周建隋，称帝建立隋朝，史称隋文帝。
description.enUS: Yang Jian, an imperial relative of Northern Zhou, usurped Zhou and established the Sui Dynasty, proclaiming himself Emperor Wen of Sui.

title.zhCN: 西哥特王国皈依天主教

description.zhCN: 西哥特国王雷卡雷德一世放弃阿里乌教派，皈依尼西亚基督教，标志着伊比利亚半岛在宗教上与罗马教廷的整合。
description.enUS: Visigothic King Reccared I renounced Arianism and converted to Nicene Christianity, marking the religious integration of the Iberian Peninsula with the Roman Papacy.

description.zhCN: 隋文帝杨坚派晋王杨广率大军南下，攻灭南朝陈，结束了南北朝长达270余年的分裂局面，实现了中国的大一统。
description.enUS: Emperor Wen of Sui, Yang Jian, dispatched Prince Yang Guang to lead a large army south, conquering the Southern Chen Dynasty. This ended over 270 years of division during the Northern and Southern Dynasties and achieved China's reunification.

title.zhCN: 格列高利一世就任教皇

description.zhCN: 格列高利一世当选罗马主教，他加强了教皇的世俗权力，并在教会改革、传教和文化保存方面发挥了关键作用，巩固了教皇在中世纪西欧的地位。
description.enUS: Gregory I was elected Bishop of Rome. He strengthened the pope's temporal power and played a crucial role in church reform, missionary work, and cultural preservation, solidifying the papacy's position in medieval Western Europe.

title.enUS: Empress Suiko Ascends to the Throne

description.zhCN: 推古天皇是日本历史上第一位有确切记载的女天皇。她的即位标志着日本政治史上女性统治的开端，并在圣德太子的辅佐下，推动了佛教在日本的传播和国家体制的改革。
description.enUS: Empress Suiko was the first Japanese female monarch with a definite reign date. Her accession marked the beginning of female rule in Japanese political history. With Prince Shotoku as her regent, she promoted the spread of Buddhism and reformed the state structure.

title.zhCN: 圣奥古斯丁抵达英格兰传教
title.enUS: Saint Augustine Arrives in England for Missionary Work

description.zhCN: 教皇格里高利一世派遣圣奥古斯丁前往盎格鲁-撒克逊人的英格兰传教，开启了英格兰基督教化的重要进程。
description.enUS: Pope Gregory I sent Saint Augustine to evangelize Anglo-Saxon England, initiating a significant process of Christianization in England.

description.zhCN: 拜占庭帝国与萨珊波斯之间爆发了一场旷日持久的战争，双方为争夺近东霸权，耗费巨大资源，对两国国力造成严重削弱。
description.enUS: A prolonged war erupted between the Byzantine Empire and Sasanian Persia. Both sides expended immense resources in their struggle for dominance in the Near East, severely weakening their respective empires.

title.enUS: Emperor Yang of Sui Digs the Grand Canal

description.zhCN: 隋炀帝杨广征发大量民力，开凿和修缮以洛阳为中心，连接南北的隋朝大运河，沟通了南北经济文化交流，但也加重了人民负担。
description.enUS: Emperor Yang of Sui, Yang Guang, mobilized vast labor to dig and repair the Sui Grand Canal, centered in Luoyang and connecting north and south. This facilitated economic and cultural exchange between north and south but also burdened the populace.

title.enUS: First Official Japanese Envoy to Sui China

description.zhCN: 圣德太子派遣小野妹子作为遣隋使前往中国隋朝，开始有组织地学习中国先进的政治制度、文化和技术。
description.enUS: Prince Shotoku dispatched Ono no Imoko as the first official Japanese envoy to Sui China. This organized mission aimed to learn about China's advanced political systems, culture, and technology.

description.zhCN: 赫拉克利乌斯从非洲起兵，推翻了不得人心的福卡斯皇帝，登基后他改革军事和行政体制，力挽狂澜抵抗波斯入侵。
description.enUS: Heraclius launched an expedition from Africa, overthrowing the unpopular Emperor Phocas. Upon his ascension, he reformed the military and administrative systems, turning the tide against the Persian invasion.

title.zhCN: 穆罕默德开始接受启示

description.zhCN: 先知穆罕默德在麦加城外的希拉洞穴中，开始接受来自真主安拉的启示，标志着伊斯兰教的开端。
description.enUS: The Prophet Muhammad began receiving revelations from Allah in the Cave of Hira outside Mecca, marking the beginning of Islam.

title.zhCN: 隋炀帝第一次征高句丽
title.enUS: Emperor Yang of Sui's First Expedition Against Goguryeo

description.zhCN: 隋炀帝为扩大疆域和树立威望，首次大规模征讨高句丽，但因准备不足和高句丽顽强抵抗而失败，耗费巨大。
description.enUS: Emperor Yang of Sui, seeking to expand territory and establish prestige, launched his first large-scale expedition against Goguryeo. However, it failed due to insufficient preparation and Goguryeo's staunch resistance, incurring enormous costs.

title.zhCN: 法兰克王国《巴黎敕令》颁布
title.enUS: Edict of Paris Issued in Frankish Kingdom

description.zhCN: 法兰克国王克洛塔尔二世颁布《巴黎敕令》，赋予贵族更多权力，削弱王权，为后来宫相崛起和墨洛温王朝衰落埋下伏笔。
description.enUS: Frankish King Chlothar II issued the Edict of Paris, granting more power to the nobility and weakening royal authority, foreshadowing the rise of the Mayors of the Palace and the decline of the Merovingian dynasty.

description.zhCN: 隋末农民起义风起云涌，太原留守李渊趁势起兵，攻占长安，废隋恭帝，建立唐朝，史称唐高祖，开启了唐朝盛世。
description.enUS: Amidst widespread peasant uprisings in the late Sui Dynasty, Li Yuan, garrison commander of Taiyuan, seized the opportunity to raise an army, capture Chang'an, depose Emperor Gong of Sui, and establish the Tang Dynasty, known historically as Emperor Gaozu of Tang, ushering in the prosperous Tang era.

description.zhCN: 穆罕默德及其追随者因受迫害从麦加迁徙到麦地那（雅特里布），标志着伊斯兰历的元年，是伊斯兰教发展的重要转折点。
description.enUS: Muhammad and his followers migrated from Mecca to Medina (Yathrib) due to persecution, marking the beginning of the Islamic calendar and a crucial turning point in the development of Islam.

description.zhCN: 秦王李世民在玄武门发动政变，杀死太子李建成和齐王李元吉，迫使唐高祖李渊退位，李世民登基为帝，史称唐太宗。
description.enUS: Li Shimin, Prince of Qin, launched a coup at Xuanwu Gate, killing Crown Prince Li Jiancheng and Prince Li Yuanji. He then forced Emperor Gaozu Li Yuan to abdicate, and Li Shimin ascended the throne as Emperor Taizong.

description.zhCN: 唐太宗李世民在位期间，励精图治，政治清明，经济发展，文化繁荣，社会安定，史称“贞观之治”，为唐朝盛世奠定基础。
description.enUS: During Emperor Taizong Li Shimin's reign, he worked diligently, resulting in clear governance, economic development, cultural prosperity, and social stability. This period, known as the 'Reign of Zhenguan,' laid the foundation for the Tang Dynasty's golden age.

description.zhCN: 赫拉克利乌斯率领拜占庭军队在尼尼微大败萨珊波斯军队，直接导致萨珊国王库思老二世被废黜和波斯帝国的衰落。
description.enUS: Heraclius led the Byzantine army to a decisive victory over the Sasanian Persian forces at Nineveh, directly leading to the deposition of Sasanian King Khosrow II and the decline of the Persian Empire.

title.enUS: Xuanzang's Journey to the West for Buddhist Scriptures

description.zhCN: 唐代僧人玄奘从长安出发，西行前往天竺（印度）求取佛经，历时十七年，带回大量佛经并翻译，对佛教在中国传播影响深远。
description.enUS: Xuanzang, a Tang Dynasty monk, departed from Chang'an on a journey to Tianzhu (India) to seek Buddhist scriptures. He spent seventeen years there, bringing back numerous scriptures and translating them, profoundly influencing the spread of Buddhism in China.

description.zhCN: 穆罕默德率领穆斯林军队和平进入麦加，拆除了克尔白中的偶像，标志着伊斯兰教在阿拉伯半岛的统治地位确立。
description.enUS: Muhammad led the Muslim army peacefully into Mecca, dismantling the idols in the Kaaba, marking the establishment of Islamic dominance in the Arabian Peninsula.

title.zhCN: 穆罕默德去世与四大哈里发时期开始
title.enUS: Death of Muhammad and Beginning of the Rashidun Caliphate

description.zhCN: 先知穆罕默德去世，阿布·伯克尔被推选为首任哈里发，开启了伊斯兰教的四大哈里发时期和对外扩张的序幕。
description.enUS: The Prophet Muhammad died, and Abu Bakr was elected as the first Caliph, beginning the Rashidun Caliphate period of Islam and the prelude to its outward expansion.

description.zhCN: 新兴的阿拉伯穆斯林军队在亚尔穆克战役中决定性地击败拜占庭军队，导致拜占庭永久失去了对叙利亚和巴勒斯坦的控制。
description.enUS: The nascent Arab Muslim army decisively defeated the Byzantine forces at the Battle of Yarmouk, leading to Byzantium's permanent loss of control over Syria and Palestine.

description.zhCN: 阿姆鲁·本·阿斯率领的阿拉伯穆斯林军队开始征服拜占庭统治下的埃及，逐渐将其纳入哈里发国版图。
description.enUS: The Arab Muslim army, led by Amr ibn al-As, began the conquest of Byzantine-ruled Egypt, gradually incorporating it into the Caliphate.

description.zhCN: 唐太宗将宗室女文成公主嫁与吐蕃赞普松赞干布，带去先进的文化和生产技术，促进了汉藏民族间的交流与融合。
description.enUS: Emperor Taizong of Tang married Princess Wencheng, a woman of the imperial clan, to Songtsen Gampo, the King of Tibet. She brought advanced culture and production techniques, promoting exchange and integration between the Han and Tibetan peoples.

title.zhCN: 赫拉克利乌斯去世与帝国领土丧失
title.enUS: Death of Heraclius and Imperial Territorial Losses

description.zhCN: 赫拉克利乌斯皇帝去世，其继任者面临着阿拉伯人迅速扩张的严峻挑战，帝国在数年内失去了埃及、北非等核心省份。
description.enUS: Emperor Heraclius died, and his successors faced the severe challenge of rapid Arab expansion, with the empire losing core provinces like Egypt and North Africa within a few years.

description.zhCN: 中大兄皇子（后来的天智天皇）和中臣镰足等人发动政变，诛杀了当时掌握大权的苏我入鹿，随后推行以中国唐朝为模板的“大化改新”，旨在加强中央集权，建立律令制国家。
description.enUS: Prince Naka no Oe (later Emperor Tenji) and Nakatomi no Kamatari orchestrated a coup, assassinating Soga no Iruka, who held great power at the time. This was followed by the 'Taika Reform,' a series of reforms modeled on Tang China, aimed at centralizing power and establishing a Ritsuryo-style state.

title.enUS: Compilation of the Standard Qur'an Completed

description.zhCN: 在第三任哈里发奥斯曼的领导下，伊斯兰教的圣典《古兰经》的最终定本完成，统一了各地的诵读版本。
description.enUS: Under the leadership of the third Caliph Uthman, the final standardized version of the Qur'an, the holy book of Islam, was completed, unifying various regional recitations.

title.zhCN: 伊嗣俟三世被杀与萨珊王朝灭亡
title.enUS: Death of Yazdegerd III and Fall of the Sasanian Dynasty

description.zhCN: 萨珊末代国王伊嗣俟三世在逃亡途中被杀，标志着萨珊波斯王朝的彻底灭亡，波斯从此被纳入伊斯兰哈里发国的统治之下。
description.enUS: The last Sasanian king, Yazdegerd III, was killed while fleeing, marking the complete collapse of the Sasanian Persian dynasty and the incorporation of Persia under the rule of the Islamic Caliphate.

description.zhCN: 西哥特国王雷塞斯文特颁布了《西哥特法典》，取代了罗马法和日耳曼习惯法，对伊比利亚半岛的法律体系产生深远影响。
description.enUS: Visigothic King Recceswinth issued the Visigothic Code, replacing Roman law and Germanic customary law, profoundly influencing the legal system of the Iberian Peninsula.

description.zhCN: 唐高宗联合新罗攻灭百济，打破了朝鲜半岛三国鼎立的局面，加强了唐朝在东北亚地区的影响力。
description.enUS: Emperor Gaozong of Tang allied with Silla to conquer Baekje, breaking the tripartite division of the Korean Peninsula and strengthening Tang Dynasty's influence in Northeast Asia.

title.zhCN: 什叶派与逊尼派分裂的开端

description.zhCN: 阿里·本·阿比·塔利卜遇刺身亡，标志着四大哈里发时期的结束，并导致了伊斯兰教逊尼派和什叶派之间持续至今的分裂。
description.enUS: The assassination of Ali ibn Abi Talib marked the end of the Rashidun Caliphate and led to the enduring split between Sunni and Shia Islam.

description.zhCN: 唐高宗联合新罗攻灭高句丽，彻底结束了朝鲜半岛的战乱局面，唐朝版图达到极盛。
description.enUS: Emperor Gaozong of Tang allied with Silla to conquer Goguryeo, completely ending the state of war on the Korean Peninsula and bringing the Tang Dynasty's territory to its greatest extent.

title.zhCN: 第一次阿拉伯人围攻君士坦丁堡

description.zhCN: 阿拉伯乌迈耶王朝舰队首次大规模围攻君士坦丁堡，但拜占庭凭借“希腊火”的运用成功抵御了进攻。
description.enUS: The Umayyad Caliphate's fleet launched its first major siege of Constantinople, but Byzantium successfully repelled the attack with the use of 'Greek fire'.

description.zhCN: 穆罕默德外孙侯赛因·本·阿里在卡尔巴拉被乌迈耶王朝军队杀害，这一事件成为什叶派伊斯兰教最重要的悲剧性事件。
description.enUS: Husayn ibn Ali, grandson of Muhammad, was killed by Umayyad forces at Karbala. This event became the most significant tragic event in Shia Islam.

title.zhCN: 《林迪斯法恩福音书》开始创作
title.enUS: Creation of the Lindisfarne Gospels Begins

description.zhCN: 这部著名的泥金手抄本福音书在英格兰东北部的林迪斯法恩修道院开始创作，是盎格鲁-撒克逊艺术的杰出代表。
description.enUS: This famous illuminated manuscript of the Gospels began to be created at Lindisfarne Priory in Northeast England, representing an outstanding example of Anglo-Saxon art.

description.zhCN: 武则天废唐睿宗，自立为帝，改国号为周，是中国历史上唯一一位正统女皇帝，其统治推动了社会和政治变革。
description.enUS: Wu Zetian deposed Emperor Ruizong of Tang and established herself as empress, changing the dynastic name to Zhou. She was the only legitimate female emperor in Chinese history, and her rule brought about social and political changes.

description.zhCN: 阿拉伯军队攻陷拜占庭在北非的最后一个主要据点迦太基，标志着拜占庭帝国彻底丧失北非领土。
description.enUS: Arab forces captured Carthage, the last major Byzantine stronghold in North Africa, marking the complete loss of Byzantine territory in North Africa.

description.zhCN: 张柬之等大臣发动政变，逼迫武则天退位，迎唐中宗复位，唐朝复辟，结束了武周王朝的统治。
description.enUS: Ministers like Zhang Jianzhi launched a coup, forcing Wu Zetian to abdicate and restoring Emperor Zhongzong of Tang, thus ending the Wu Zhou Dynasty and restoring the Tang.

title.zhCN: 迁都平城京（奈良时代开始）
title.enUS: Capital Moved to Heijo-kyo (Start of the Nara Period)

description.zhCN: 元明天皇将首都从飞鸟迁至平城京（今奈良），标志着奈良时代的开始。新都城仿照中国唐朝首都长安建造，是日本历史上第一个长期稳定的首都，也是律令制国家体制、佛教文化和汉文化繁荣的时期。
description.enUS: Empress Genmei moved the capital from Asuka to Heijo-kyo (modern-day Nara), marking the beginning of the Nara Period. The new capital, modeled after Tang China's Chang'an, was Japan's first stable, long-term capital and a time of flourishing Ritsuryo-style statehood, Buddhist culture, and Chinese influence.

title.zhCN: 塔里克·本·齐亚德登陆伊比利亚半岛
title.enUS: Tariq ibn Ziyad Lands on the Iberian Peninsula

description.zhCN: 穆斯林柏柏尔将领塔里克·本·齐亚德率军渡过直布罗陀海峡，开始对西哥特王国统治下的伊比利亚半岛进行征服，开启了安达卢斯的历史。
description.enUS: Muslim Berber general Tariq ibn Ziyad led his army across the Strait of Gibraltar, beginning the conquest of the Iberian Peninsula under Visigothic rule and initiating the history of Al-Andalus.

title.zhCN: 穆萨·本·努赛尔征服伊比利亚半岛
title.enUS: Musa ibn Nusayr Conquers the Iberian Peninsula

description.zhCN: 北非总督穆萨·本·努赛尔率大军增援塔里克，两人合作在数年内完成了对伊比利亚半岛大部分地区的征服。
description.enUS: Musa ibn Nusayr, the governor of North Africa, led a large army to reinforce Tariq. Together, they completed the conquest of most of the Iberian Peninsula within a few years.

description.zhCN: 唐玄宗李隆基亲政后，任用贤能，励精图治，使唐朝进入经济、文化、政治的鼎盛时期，史称“开元盛世”。
description.enUS: After Emperor Xuanzong Li Longji took personal control of the government, he employed capable officials and diligently governed, leading the Tang Dynasty into its golden age of economic, cultural, and political prosperity, known as the 'Kaiyuan Era of Prosperity'.

title.zhCN: 第二次阿拉伯人围攻君士坦丁堡

description.zhCN: 穆斯林阿拉伯人对君士坦丁堡发动第二次大规模围攻，但在利奥三世皇帝的领导和“希腊火”的有效使用下，拜占庭成功守卫了首都。
description.enUS: Muslim Arabs launched a second major siege of Constantinople, but under the leadership of Emperor Leo III and the effective use of 'Greek Fire,' Byzantium successfully defended its capital.

description.zhCN: 利奥三世登基，开创了伊苏利亚王朝，他结束了帝国的混乱时期，并通过军事和行政改革稳定了帝国。
description.enUS: Leo III ascended to the throne, establishing the Isaurian Dynasty. He ended a period of imperial chaos and stabilized the empire through military and administrative reforms.

description.zhCN: 利奥三世颁布敕令禁止崇拜圣像，引发了持续一个多世纪的圣像破坏运动，导致帝国社会和宗教的巨大动荡。
description.enUS: Leo III issued an edict prohibiting the veneration of icons, sparking the Iconoclastic movement that lasted over a century and caused significant social and religious turmoil within the empire.

description.zhCN: 法兰克王国宫相查理·马特在普瓦捷击败了伍麦叶王朝的穆斯林军队，阻止了其向欧洲西部的进一步扩张。
description.enUS: Charles Martel, Mayor of the Palace of the Frankish Kingdom, defeated the Umayyad Muslim army at Poitiers, halting their further expansion into Western Europe.

description.zhCN: 阿拔斯革命推翻了伍麦叶王朝，阿拔斯王朝建立，标志着伊斯兰哈里发国从阿拉伯中心向更具普世性的发展。
description.enUS: The Abbasid Revolution overthrew the Umayyad Dynasty, establishing the Abbasid Caliphate and marking a shift in the Islamic Caliphate from an Arab-centric focus to a more universal one.

description.zhCN: 伦巴第人攻陷拉文纳，标志着拜占庭帝国在意大利中部最后一个重要行政区的丧失，加强了教皇在意大利的世俗权力。
description.enUS: The Lombards captured Ravenna, marking the loss of the last significant Byzantine administrative center in central Italy and strengthening the Pope's secular authority in Italy.

description.zhCN: 唐朝与阿拉伯帝国在中亚怛罗斯展开激战，唐军战败，此战影响深远，促使中国造纸术等技术西传。
description.enUS: The Tang Dynasty and the Abbasid Caliphate engaged in a fierce battle at Talas in Central Asia. The Tang army was defeated, but this battle had far-reaching effects, leading to the westward transmission of Chinese papermaking and other technologies.

title.zhCN: 丕平加冕为法兰克国王
title.enUS: Pepin Crowned King of the Franks

description.zhCN: 矮子丕平在教皇支持下废黜墨洛温王朝末代国王，自立为法兰克国王，开创了加洛林王朝。
description.enUS: Pepin the Short, with papal support, deposed the last Merovingian king and crowned himself King of the Franks, initiating the Carolingian dynasty.

description.zhCN: 法兰克国王丕平将意大利中部拉文纳等地区赠予教皇，为教皇国的建立奠定了基础，强化了教皇的世俗权力。
description.enUS: Frankish King Pepin granted the Exarchate of Ravenna and other territories in central Italy to the Pope, laying the foundation for the Papal States and strengthening the Pope's temporal power.

description.zhCN: 节度使安禄山、史思明发动叛乱，攻陷洛阳、长安，持续八年，严重削弱了唐朝国力，是唐朝由盛转衰的转折点。
description.enUS: An Lushan and Shi Siming, jiedushi (military governors), launched a rebellion, capturing Luoyang and Chang'an. Lasting eight years, it severely weakened the Tang Dynasty's national strength and marked the turning point from prosperity to decline.

title.zhCN: 科尔多瓦埃米尔国建立

description.zhCN: 伍麦叶王朝幸存者阿卜杜勒-拉赫曼一世在伊比利亚半岛建立了独立的科尔多瓦埃米尔国，与东方阿拔斯王朝对立。
description.enUS: Abd al-Rahman I, a surviving member of the Umayyad dynasty, established the independent Emirate of Cordoba in the Iberian Peninsula, in opposition to the Abbasid Caliphate in the East.

description.zhCN: 阿拔斯王朝哈里发曼苏尔下令修建新都巴格达，这座城市很快成为伊斯兰世界的政治、文化和学术中心。
description.enUS: Abbasid Caliph Al-Mansur ordered the construction of a new capital, Baghdad, which quickly became the political, cultural, and intellectual center of the Islamic world.

description.zhCN: 叛乱持续八年，最终在唐军和回纥援军的共同努力下被平定，但唐朝中央权威受到极大削弱，藩镇割据局面形成。
description.enUS: The rebellion lasted eight years and was finally suppressed by the joint efforts of Tang forces and Uighur reinforcements. However, the central authority of the Tang Dynasty was greatly weakened, and the phenomenon of warlordism emerged.

title.zhCN: 查理曼即位法兰克国王

description.zhCN: 查理曼继承法兰克国王位，在其统治下，法兰克王国达到鼎盛，成为西欧的主导力量，开启了“加洛林文艺复兴”。
description.enUS: Charlemagne inherited the Frankish throne. Under his rule, the Frankish Kingdom reached its zenith, becoming the dominant power in Western Europe and initiating the 'Carolingian Renaissance'.

title.zhCN: 萨克森战争与维尔登大屠杀
title.enUS: Saxon Wars and Massacre of Verden

description.zhCN: 查理曼对萨克森人进行长期征服战争，并在维尔登进行大规模屠杀，强制萨克森人皈依基督教。
description.enUS: Charlemagne waged a long war of conquest against the Saxons and carried out a large-scale massacre at Verden, forcing the Saxons to convert to Christianity.

description.zhCN: 哈伦·拉希德成为阿拔斯王朝哈里发，其统治时期被视为阿拔斯王朝的黄金时代，文化和科学发展达到顶峰。
description.enUS: Harun al-Rashid became the Abbasid Caliph. His reign is considered the golden age of the Abbasid Caliphate, during which culture and science reached their peak.

title.zhCN: 第二次尼西亚公会议召开

description.zhCN: 在伊琳娜女皇的主持下，此次大公会议恢复了圣像的敬拜，暂时结束了第一次圣像破坏运动。
description.enUS: Presided over by Empress Irene, this ecumenical council restored the veneration of icons, temporarily ending the first period of Iconoclasm.

title.zhCN: 林迪斯法恩修道院被维京人劫掠

description.zhCN: 维京人首次大规模袭击英格兰林迪斯法恩修道院，标志着维京时代的开始，对欧洲造成深远影响。
description.enUS: Vikings launched their first major raid on Lindisfarne Monastery in England, marking the beginning of the Viking Age and profoundly impacting Europe.

title.zhCN: 迁都平安京（平安时代开始）
title.enUS: Capital Moved to Heian-kyo (Start of the Heian Period)

description.zhCN: 桓武天皇将首都迁至平安京（今京都），以摆脱佛教势力对政治的干预。此后，日本进入了长达四百多年的平安时代，这一时期形成了独特的国风文化，并在贵族阶层中发展出精美的文学和艺术。
description.enUS: Emperor Kanmu moved the capital to Heian-kyo (modern-day Kyoto) to escape the political influence of Buddhist institutions. This ushered in the Heian Period, which lasted over four centuries. During this era, a unique Japanese national culture flourished, and refined literature and arts developed among the aristocracy.

title.zhCN: 伊琳娜女皇废黜君士坦丁六世并统治
title.enUS: Empress Irene Deposes and Rules over Constantine VI

description.zhCN: 伊琳娜女皇废黜并致盲了自己的儿子君士坦丁六世，独自掌握了皇权，成为拜占庭帝国唯一的女皇。
description.enUS: Empress Irene deposed and blinded her son Constantine VI, seizing sole imperial power and becoming the only female empress of the Byzantine Empire.

title.zhCN: 教皇利奥三世被罗马贵族袭击
title.enUS: Pope Leo III Attacked by Roman Nobles

description.zhCN: 教皇利奥三世在罗马遭到反对派贵族袭击并寻求查理曼保护，为查理曼加冕罗马皇帝奠定基础。
description.enUS: Pope Leo III was attacked by opposing nobles in Rome and sought protection from Charlemagne, laying the groundwork for Charlemagne's coronation as Roman Emperor.

title.zhCN: 查理曼加冕为罗马皇帝

description.zhCN: 教皇利奥三世在罗马圣彼得大教堂为法兰克国王查理曼加冕为“罗马人的皇帝”，标志着西欧罗马帝国概念的复兴。
description.enUS: Pope Leo III crowned Charlemagne, King of the Franks, as 'Emperor of the Romans' in St. Peter's Basilica in Rome, marking the revival of the concept of a Roman Empire in Western Europe.

description.zhCN: 伊琳娜女皇被其财政大臣尼基弗鲁斯一世废黜，结束了伊苏利亚王朝的统治，帝国进入了尼基弗鲁斯王朝时期。
description.enUS: Empress Irene was deposed by her finance minister Nikephoros I, ending the Isaurian dynasty and ushering in the Nikephorian dynasty for the empire.

description.zhCN: 唐顺宗即位后，王叔文、柳宗元等推行改革，打击宦官和藩镇势力，但仅进行八个月即失败，未能挽救唐朝衰势。
description.enUS: After Emperor Shunzong ascended the throne, Wang Shuwen, Liu Zongyuan, and others initiated reforms to curb eunuch and provincial warlord power. However, it failed after only eight months, unable to reverse the Tang Dynasty's decline.

title.zhCN: 普利斯卡战役与尼基弗鲁斯一世之死
title.enUS: Battle of Pliska and Death of Nikephoros I

description.zhCN: 拜占庭皇帝尼基弗鲁斯一世在与保加利亚人的普利斯卡战役中阵亡，这是罗马皇帝首次在战场上阵亡，对帝国士气打击巨大。
description.enUS: Byzantine Emperor Nikephoros I was killed in the Battle of Pliska against the Bulgarians, marking the first time a Roman emperor died in battle and a significant blow to imperial morale.

title.enUS: House of Wisdom Flourishes in Baghdad

description.zhCN: 在哈里发马蒙统治时期，“智者之家”在巴格达达到顶峰，成为一个重要的学术翻译和研究中心，推动了伊斯兰世界的科学和哲学发展。
description.enUS: Under the reign of Caliph al-Ma'mun, the House of Wisdom reached its peak in Baghdad, becoming a crucial center for academic translation and research, promoting scientific and philosophical advancements in the Islamic world.

description.zhCN: 查理曼大帝去世，他生前统一了西欧大部分地区，建立了庞大的加洛林帝国，对欧洲历史进程产生深远影响。
description.enUS: Charlemagne died, having unified much of Western Europe and established a vast Carolingian Empire, profoundly influencing the course of European history.

title.zhCN: 克里特岛被阿拉伯人征服

description.zhCN: 一群来自安达卢斯的阿拉伯流亡者征服了拜占庭帝国控制的克里特岛，并在岛上建立了埃米尔国，成为地中海东部的海盗基地。
description.enUS: A group of Arab exiles from Al-Andalus conquered the Byzantine-controlled island of Crete, establishing an emirate there that became a pirate base in the Eastern Mediterranean.

title.zhCN: 阿格拉布王朝入侵西西里岛

description.zhCN: 阿格拉布王朝军队入侵拜占庭控制的西西里岛，开始了长达数十年的征服过程，最终导致西西里岛被纳入伊斯兰世界。
description.enUS: Aghlabid forces invaded Byzantine-controlled Sicily, beginning a decades-long conquest that eventually led to Sicily's incorporation into theamic world.

description.zhCN: 唐武宗在位期间，下令大规模拆毁寺庙，强迫僧尼还俗，没收寺产，旨在打击佛教势力，充实国库，史称“会昌法难”。
description.enUS: During Emperor Wuzong's reign, a large-scale suppression of Buddhism occurred, involving the destruction of temples, forced laicization of monks and nuns, and confiscation of monastic property. This event, known as the 'Huichang Suppression of Buddhism,' aimed to curb Buddhist influence and replenish the state treasury.

title.zhCN: 圣像崇拜恢复（正教胜利）
title.enUS: Restoration of Icon Veneration (Triumph of Orthodoxy)

description.zhCN: 摄政皇后狄奥多拉和牧首墨托狄乌斯一世最终恢复了圣像崇拜，结束了第二次圣像破坏运动，这一天成为东正教的重要节日。
description.enUS: Regent Empress Theodora and Patriarch Methodius I finally restored the veneration of icons, ending the second period of Iconoclasm, and this day became an important feast day for Orthodox Christianity.

description.zhCN: 查理曼的三个孙子签订《凡尔登条约》，将加洛林帝国分裂为西法兰克、中法兰克和东法兰克王国，奠定了现代欧洲国家格局的雏形。
