description.enUS: Charlemagne's three grandsons signed the Treaty of Verdun, dividing the Carolingian Empire into West Francia, Middle Francia, and East Francia, laying the groundwork for the modern European state system.

title.zhCN: 维京人劫掠伦敦和坎特伯雷

description.zhCN: 维京海盗大规模入侵英格兰，劫掠了伦敦和坎特伯雷等重要城市，对盎格鲁-撒克逊诸王国构成严重威胁。
description.enUS: Viking raiders launched large-scale invasions of England, plundering important cities like London and Canterbury, posing a serious threat to the Anglo-Saxon kingdoms.

title.zhCN: 留里克在诺夫哥罗德建立罗斯王国
title.enUS: Rurik Establishes Rus' Kingdom in Novgorod

description.zhCN: 根据传统记载，瓦兰吉人留里克在诺夫哥罗德建立罗斯公国，标志着早期罗斯国家的形成和斯拉夫-维京文化融合的开始。
description.enUS: According to tradition, the Varangian Rurik established the Rus' principality in Novgorod, marking the formation of early Rus' states and the beginning of the Slav-Viking cultural synthesis.

title.zhCN: 巴西尔一世建立马其顿王朝
title.enUS: Basil I Establishes the Macedonian Dynasty

description.zhCN: 巴西尔一世通过政变登基，开创了持续近两个世纪的马其顿王朝。这一时期被认为是拜占庭帝国的黄金时代，帝国在军事、文化和经济上都取得了显著的复兴。
description.enUS: Basil I ascended the throne through a coup, establishing the Macedonian dynasty which lasted for nearly two centuries. This period is considered the golden age of the Byzantine Empire, with significant military, cultural, and economic revival.

title.zhCN: 艾哈迈德·伊本·图伦在埃及建立图伦王朝
title.enUS: Ahmad ibn Tulun Establishes Tulunid Dynasty in Egypt

description.zhCN: 阿拔斯王朝任命的埃及总督艾哈迈德·伊本·图伦利用巴格达中央政府的衰落，在埃及建立半独立的图伦王朝。
description.enUS: Ahmad ibn Tulun, the Abbasid-appointed governor of Egypt, took advantage of the weakening central government in Baghdad to establish the semi-independent Tulunid dynasty in Egypt.

title.zhCN: 阿尔弗雷德大帝成为威塞克斯国王
title.enUS: Alfred the Great Becomes King of Wessex

description.zhCN: 阿尔弗雷德大帝在与维京人的长期斗争中表现出色，成为威塞克斯国王，并逐步统一了英格兰，被视为英格兰的奠基人之一。
description.enUS: Alfred the Great distinguished himself in prolonged struggles against the Vikings, becoming King of Wessex and gradually unifying England, regarded as one of the founders of England.

title.zhCN: 萨曼王朝在河中地区建立

description.zhCN: 萨曼家族在河中地区（中亚）建立独立的萨曼王朝，成为波斯文化和伊斯兰学术的重要中心。
description.enUS: The Samanid family established the independent Samanid dynasty in Transoxiana (Central Asia), which became an important center for Persian culture and Islamic scholarship.

description.zhCN: 唐末，因连年灾荒和政治腐败，黄巢率领农民发动大规模起义，攻陷长安，建立大齐政权，彻底动摇了唐朝统治。
description.enUS: In the late Tang Dynasty, due to successive years of famine and political corruption, Huang Chao led a large-scale peasant uprising, capturing Chang'an and establishing the Great Qi regime, thoroughly shaking the Tang Dynasty's rule.

title.zhCN: 埃丁顿战役与威塞克斯的胜利
title.enUS: Battle of Edington and Wessex Victory

description.zhCN: 阿尔弗雷德大帝在埃丁顿战役中决定性地击败了维京大军，迫使维京领袖古思伦接受洗礼并签订《威德莫尔条约》。
description.enUS: Alfred the Great decisively defeated the Great Heathen Army at the Battle of Edington, forcing Viking leader Guthrum to be baptized and sign the Treaty of Wedmore.

description.zhCN: 巴西尔一世发起对查士丁尼《民法大全》的修订和简化，形成了《巴西利卡法典》，成为拜占庭帝国后期重要的法律基础。
description.enUS: Basil I initiated the revision and simplification of Justinian's Corpus Juris Civilis, forming the Basilica, which became an important legal foundation for the later Byzantine Empire.

description.zhCN: 胖子查理被废黜后，加洛林帝国彻底分裂为数个独立的王国，标志着查理曼帝国作为一个统一实体的终结。
description.enUS: After the deposition of Charles the Fat, the Carolingian Empire completely fragmented into several independent kingdoms, marking the end of Charlemagne's empire as a unified entity.

description.zhCN: 藩镇朱温废唐哀帝，自立为帝，建立后梁，标志着唐朝的彻底灭亡，中国进入五代十国大分裂时期。
description.enUS: Zhu Wen, a provincial warlord, deposed Emperor Ai of Tang and established himself as emperor, creating the Later Liang Dynasty. This marked the complete fall of the Tang Dynasty and the beginning of China's Five Dynasties and Ten Kingdoms period of great division.

title.zhCN: 奥列格进攻君士坦丁堡

description.zhCN: 基辅罗斯的奥列格大公率领大批维京人和斯拉夫人围攻君士坦丁堡，最终通过签订贸易条约而撤退，展示了罗斯人在黑海地区的实力。
description.enUS: Grand Prince Oleg of Kiev Rus' led a large force of Vikings and Slavs to besiege Constantinople, eventually withdrawing after signing a trade treaty, demonstrating Rus' power in the Black Sea region.

title.zhCN: 法蒂玛王朝在北非建立
title.enUS: Fatimid Dynasty Established in North Africa

description.zhCN: 什叶派伊斯玛仪派的法蒂玛王朝在北非伊夫起亚建立，挑战了阿拔斯王朝在伊斯兰世界的权威，并逐步向东扩张。
description.enUS: The Ismaili Shia Fatimid dynasty was established in Ifriqiya (North Africa), challenging the Abbasid Caliphate's authority in the Islamic world and gradually expanding eastward.

title.zhCN: 克吕尼修道院建立与克吕尼改革
title.enUS: Foundation of Cluny Abbey and the Cluniac Reforms

description.zhCN: 阿奎丹公爵“虔诚者”威廉建立克吕尼修道院，并赋予其独立于世俗和主教控制的特权。这开启了一场重要的教会改革运动，旨在净化教会、恢复戒律，为后来的教皇权力提升和叙任权之争奠定基础。
description.enUS: William I, Duke of Aquitaine, founded Cluny Abbey and granted it privileges of independence from secular and episcopal control. This marked the beginning of a major church reform movement aimed at purifying the clergy and restoring monastic discipline, laying the groundwork for the later increase in papal power and the Investiture Controversy.

title.zhCN: 西法兰克国王查理三世授予维京人诺曼底
title.enUS: King Charles III of West Francia Grants Normandy to Vikings

description.zhCN: 西法兰克国王查理三世（“糊涂查理”）与维京首领罗洛签订《圣克莱尔施埃普特条约》，授予其在诺曼底地区建立封地，最终形成了强大的诺曼底公国。
description.enUS: King Charles III of West Francia ('Charles the Simple') signed the Treaty of Saint-Clair-sur-Epte with Viking chieftain Rollo, granting him land to establish a fiefdom in Normandy, which eventually led to the powerful Duchy of Normandy.

title.zhCN: 西美昂一世围攻君士坦丁堡

description.zhCN: 保加利亚沙皇西美昂一世在拜占庭内部权力斗争之际，多次围攻君士坦丁堡，寻求获得皇帝头衔，给帝国带来巨大压力。
description.enUS: Bulgarian Tsar Simeon I repeatedly besieged Constantinople amidst Byzantine internal power struggles, seeking to gain the imperial title and putting immense pressure on the empire.

title.enUS: Li Cunxu Conquers Later Liang and Establishes Later Tang

description.zhCN: 晋王李存勖攻灭后梁，建立后唐，定都洛阳，成为五代时期第一个由沙陀族建立的王朝。
description.enUS: Li Cunxu, King of Jin, conquered Later Liang and established Later Tang, with its capital in Luoyang. It became the first dynasty established by the Shatuo Turks during the Five Dynasties period.

description.zhCN: 托米斯拉夫大公被加冕为克罗地亚国王，标志着第一个统一的克罗地亚王国的建立。
description.enUS: Duke Tomislav was crowned King of Croatia, marking the establishment of the first unified Kingdom of Croatia.

title.zhCN: 保加利亚西美昂一世去世
title.enUS: Death of Simeon I of Bulgaria

description.zhCN: 保加利亚沙皇西美昂一世去世，其继承人与拜占庭帝国签订和平条约，结束了保加利亚与拜占庭之间多年的战争状态。
description.enUS: Bulgarian Tsar Simeon I died, and his successor signed a peace treaty with the Byzantine Empire, ending years of war between Bulgaria and Byzantium.

title.zhCN: 科尔多瓦埃米尔国升级为哈里发国
title.enUS: Emirate of Cordoba Elevates to Caliphate

description.zhCN: 科尔多瓦埃米尔阿卜杜勒-拉赫曼三世宣布自己为哈里发，使得伊比利亚半岛的穆斯林政权正式与阿拔斯王朝和法蒂玛王朝鼎足而立。
description.enUS: Abd al-Rahman III, Emir of Cordoba, declared himself Caliph, formally elevating the Muslim rule in the Iberian Peninsula to a caliphate, standing as a rival to the Abbasids and Fatimids.

title.zhCN: 石敬瑭割让幽云十六州
title.enUS: Shi Jingtang Cedes the Sixteen Prefectures of Yan and Yun

description.zhCN: 后唐节度使石敬瑭为借契丹之力建立后晋，向契丹割让幽云十六州，此举为北方边患埋下祸根，影响此后三百年中国北方防御。
description.enUS: Shi Jingtang, a jiedushi of Later Tang, ceded the Sixteen Prefectures of Yan and Yun to the Khitans in exchange for their support to establish Later Jin. This act sowed the seeds of northern border troubles, affecting China's northern defense for the next three centuries.

title.zhCN: 伊戈尔进攻君士坦丁堡

description.zhCN: 基辅罗斯的伊戈尔大公再次率舰队进攻君士坦丁堡，拜占庭海军再次运用“希腊火”成功击退了罗斯人的进攻。
description.enUS: Grand Prince Igor of Kiev Rus' once again led a fleet to attack Constantinople, and the Byzantine navy successfully repelled the Rus' attack by employing 'Greek fire' again.

description.zhCN: 波斯的什叶派白益王朝军队进入巴格达，控制了阿拔斯哈里发，使其成为白益王朝的傀儡，标志着阿拔斯哈里发实权的丧失。
description.enUS: The Persian Shia Buyid dynasty's army entered Baghdad, gaining control over the Abbasid Caliph and rendering him a puppet, marking the loss of effective power by the Abbasid Caliphate.

title.enUS: Khitan Conquers Later Jin, Establishes Liao Dynasty

description.zhCN: 契丹攻灭后晋，将国号改为大辽，正式建立辽朝，统治北方，与中原王朝长期对峙。
description.enUS: The Khitan conquered Later Jin, changed their dynastic name to Great Liao, and formally established the Liao Dynasty, ruling the North and engaging in a long standoff with the Central Plains dynasties.

title.enUS: Chanzhou Mutiny and the Founding of Later Zhou

description.zhCN: 后汉大将郭威在澶州（今河南濮阳）被将士拥立为帝，黄袍加身。郭威率军返京，迫后汉李太后下诏禅位，改国号为周，史称后周，后汉灭亡。后周是五代最后一个中原王朝。
description.enUS: The Later Han general Guo Wei was proclaimed emperor by his troops at Chanzhou (modern Puyang, Henan), who draped him in a yellow robe. Guo Wei marched back to the capital, forced Empress Dowager Li to issue an abdication edict, established the Zhou dynasty (Later Zhou), marking the end of Later Han. Later Zhou is the last Central Plains dynasty of the Five Dynasties.

description.zhCN: 奥托一世率领的德意志军队在莱希菲尔德战役中决定性地击败了马扎尔人（匈牙利人），结束了其对西欧长达数十年的劫掠。
description.enUS: Otto I's German army decisively defeated the Magyars (Hungarians) at the Battle of Lechfeld, ending their decades-long raids into Western Europe.

title.enUS: Chenqiao Mutiny and the Founding of the Song Dynasty

description.zhCN: 后周禁军统帅赵匡胤借抵御契丹之名率军北上，行至陈桥驿（今河南封丘）时被将士拥立为帝，黄袍加身。赵匡胤回师开封，迫后周恭帝柴宗训禅位，改国号为宋，定都开封，后周灭亡，五代十国时期结束。
description.enUS: Zhao Kuangyin, commander of the Later Zhou imperial guards, led troops north under the pretext of resisting the Khitan invasion. At Chenqiao Post (modern Fengqiu, Henan), he was proclaimed emperor by his troops and draped in a yellow robe. Returning to Kaifeng, he forced Emperor Gong of Later Zhou to abdicate, established the Song dynasty with its capital at Kaifeng, marking the end of Later Zhou and the conclusion of the Five Dynasties and Ten Kingdoms period.

title.enUS: Relinquishing Military Power Over a Cup of Wine

description.zhCN: 宋太祖赵匡胤通过巧妙的方式，解除了高级将领的兵权，加强了中央集权，避免了藩镇割据的重演。
description.enUS: Emperor Taizu Zhao Kuangyin skillfully relieved his senior generals of their military power, strengthening central authority and preventing the recurrence of regional warlordism.

description.zhCN: 尼基弗鲁斯·福卡斯将军率领拜占庭大军，经过长期围攻，成功从阿拉伯人手中收复了战略要地克里特岛。
description.enUS: General Nikephoros Phokas led a large Byzantine army to successfully recapture the strategically important island of Crete from the Arabs after a prolonged siege.

title.zhCN: 奥托一世加冕神圣罗马帝国皇帝
title.enUS: Otto I Crowned Holy Roman Emperor

description.zhCN: 教皇约翰十二世在罗马为奥托一世加冕为“罗马人的皇帝”，标志着神圣罗马帝国的正式建立，并开创了德意志民族在欧洲的长期主导地位。
description.enUS: Pope John XII crowned Otto I 'Emperor of the Romans' in Rome, marking the official establishment of the Holy Roman Empire and initiating a long period of German dominance in Europe.

description.zhCN: 拜占庭帝国军队在约翰一世·齐米斯基斯皇帝的指挥下，从阿拉伯人手中收复了重要的城市安条克，极大地扩张了帝国在东方的版图。
description.enUS: Byzantine imperial forces, under the command of Emperor John I Tzimiskes, recaptured the important city of Antioch from the Arabs, greatly expanding the empire's territory in the East.

description.zhCN: 法蒂玛王朝军队在焦哈尔将军的带领下征服了埃及，推翻了伊赫什德王朝，并将开罗定为新首都。
description.enUS: The Fatimid army, led by General Jawhar, conquered Egypt, overthrowing the Ikhshidid dynasty and establishing Cairo as their new capital.

description.zhCN: 法蒂玛王朝在开罗建立了爱资哈尔清真寺和大学，该机构成为伊斯兰世界最重要的学术和宗教中心之一，尤其侧重于什叶派学说。
description.enUS: The Fatimid dynasty founded Al-Azhar Mosque and University in Cairo. This institution became one of the most important academic and religious centers in the Islamic world, with a particular focus on Shia doctrines.

description.zhCN: 巴西尔二世正式亲政，他通过强硬的军事政策和内政改革，使拜占庭帝国达到了中世纪盛期的顶峰，被称为“保加利亚屠夫”。
description.enUS: Basil II officially began his personal rule. Through aggressive military policies and internal reforms, he brought the Byzantine Empire to its medieval zenith, earning the epithet 'Bulgar-Slayer'.

title.enUS: Emperor Taizong of Song Conquers Northern Han

description.zhCN: 宋太宗赵光义率军攻灭北汉，结束了五代十国的分裂局面，除幽云十六州外，初步实现了中国大部的统一。
description.enUS: Emperor Taizong Zhao Guangyi of Song led his army to conquer Northern Han, ending the division of the Five Dynasties and Ten Kingdoms period. Except for the Sixteen Prefectures of Yan and Yun, most of China was initially unified.

description.zhCN: 宋太宗发动的旨在收复幽云十六州的北伐战争，初期有所进展，但最终惨败，此后宋朝对辽采取守势。
description.enUS: Emperor Taizong of Song launched a Northern Expedition aiming to recover the Sixteen Prefectures of Yan and Yun. Although initially successful, it ultimately ended in a crushing defeat, leading the Song Dynasty to adopt a defensive stance against the Liao thereafter.

title.zhCN: 雨果·卡佩建立卡佩王朝

description.zhCN: 西法兰克王国贵族推选巴黎伯爵雨果·卡佩为国王，开创了卡佩王朝，这是法兰西王国历史上的重要转折点。
description.enUS: The nobility of West Francia elected Hugh Capet, Count of Paris, as king, establishing the Capetian dynasty, a significant turning point in the history of the Kingdom of France.

description.zhCN: 基辅罗斯大公弗拉基米尔一世接受拜占庭东正教并强制罗斯人民皈依基督教，这深刻影响了俄罗斯、乌克兰和白俄罗斯的文化和宗教。
description.enUS: Grand Prince Vladimir I of Kievan Rus' adopted Byzantine Orthodox Christianity and forcibly converted the Rus' people, profoundly influencing the culture and religion of Russia, Ukraine, and Belarus.

description.zhCN: 突厥奴隶将领塞布克特勤之子马哈茂德在阿富汗建立了伽色尼王朝，该王朝成为重要的军事强权，并向印度次大陆扩张。
description.enUS: Mahmud, son of the Turkic slave general Sebuktigin, established the Ghaznavid dynasty in Afghanistan. This dynasty became a significant military power and expanded into the Indian subcontinent.

description.zhCN: 英格兰国王埃塞尔雷德二世下令屠杀英格兰境内的所有丹麦人，引发了丹麦国王斯韦恩一世对英格兰的多次入侵。
description.enUS: King Æthelred II of England ordered the massacre of all Danes in England, which provoked multiple invasions of England by Danish King Sweyn I.

description.zhCN: 辽圣宗率军南下，宋真宗御驾亲征，双方在澶州达成和议，宋辽以兄弟之国相称，宋岁贡，维持了百年和平，但宋朝军事上处于劣势。
description.enUS: Emperor Shengzong of Liao led his army south, and Emperor Zhenzong of Song personally led the imperial army. Both sides reached a peace agreement at Chanyuan, establishing a fraternal relationship between Song and Liao, with Song paying annual tribute. This maintained a century of peace, though the Song Dynasty remained militarily inferior.

title.zhCN: 克雷迪昂战役（克里登战役）

description.zhCN: 拜占庭皇帝巴西尔二世在克雷迪昂战役中对保加利亚军队取得决定性胜利，此战役对保加利亚造成毁灭性打击，巴西尔二世因此被称为“保加利亚屠夫”。
description.enUS: Byzantine Emperor Basil II achieved a decisive victory over the Bulgarian army at the Battle of Kleidion. This battle inflicted a devastating blow on Bulgaria, and Basil II was consequently named the 'Bulgar-Slayer'.

title.zhCN: 克努特大帝统治英格兰

description.zhCN: 丹麦国王克努特征服英格兰，建立北海大帝国，短暂地将英格兰、丹麦和挪威统一在其统治之下。
description.enUS: Cnut the Great, King of Denmark, conquered England and established the North Sea Empire, briefly unifying England, Denmark, and Norway under his rule.

title.zhCN: 拜占庭征服保加利亚第一帝国
title.enUS: Byzantine Conquest of the First Bulgarian Empire

description.zhCN: 经过数十年的战争，拜占庭皇帝巴西尔二世彻底征服了保加利亚第一帝国，使其成为拜占庭帝国的一个行省，帝国版图达到鼎盛。
description.enUS: After decades of warfare, Byzantine Emperor Basil II completely conquered the First Bulgarian Empire, turning it into a Byzantine province. The empire's territory reached its peak during this period.

title.zhCN: 勃艮第王国并入神圣罗马帝国
title.enUS: Kingdom of Burgundy Incorporated into Holy Roman Empire

description.zhCN: 勃艮第国王鲁道夫三世去世后无嗣，将其王国遗赠给神圣罗马帝国皇帝康拉德二世，扩大了帝国的版图。
description.enUS: After the childless death of King Rudolf III of Burgundy, he bequeathed his kingdom to Holy Roman Emperor Conrad II, expanding the empire's territory.

description.zhCN: 突厥游牧民族塞尔柱人在图赫里勒·贝格的领导下建立起强大的塞尔柱帝国，其后征服了波斯、美索不达米亚和叙利亚，并威胁到拜占庭帝国。
description.enUS: The Seljuk Turks, a nomadic people, established the powerful Seljuk Empire under the leadership of Tughril Beg. They subsequently conquered Persia, Mesopotamia, and Syria, and posed a threat to the Byzantine Empire.

description.zhCN: 宋仁宗时期，范仲淹、富弼等人推行改革，旨在整顿吏治、强化武备等，因守旧派反对而失败，但开启了北宋改革的先河。
description.enUS: During Emperor Renzong's reign, Fan Zhongyan, Fu Bi, and others implemented reforms aimed at rectifying administration and strengthening military preparedness. They ultimately failed due to conservative opposition but initiated the trend of reforms in the Northern Song Dynasty.

description.zhCN: 君士坦丁九世皇帝在君士坦丁堡重建了大学，尤其注重法律和哲学教育，推动了拜占庭学术的复兴。
description.enUS: Emperor Constantine IX re-established the University of Constantinople, with a strong emphasis on legal and philosophical education, fostering a revival of Byzantine scholarship.

title.enUS: Great Schism of East and West

description.zhCN: 罗马教宗和君士坦丁堡牧首相互绝罚，标志着西方罗马天主教会和东方东正教会的正式分裂，对基督教世界产生深远影响。
description.enUS: The Roman Pope and the Patriarch of Constantinople excommunicated each other, marking the formal schism between the Western Roman Catholic Church and the Eastern Orthodox Church, profoundly impacting the Christian world.

description.zhCN: 塞尔柱王朝的图赫里勒·贝格进入巴格达，被阿拔斯哈里发授予“苏丹”称号，标志着阿拔斯哈里发彻底沦为塞尔柱人的傀儡。
description.enUS: Tughril Beg of the Seljuk dynasty entered Baghdad and was granted the title of 'Sultan' by the Abbasid Caliph, marking the complete subjugation of the Abbasid Caliphate to the Seljuks.

description.zhCN: 诺曼底公爵威廉率军入侵英格兰，在黑斯廷斯战役中击败哈罗德二世，随后加冕为英格兰国王，深刻改变了英格兰的政治、社会和文化。
description.enUS: William, Duke of Normandy, invaded England, defeated Harold II at the Battle of Hastings, and was subsequently crowned King of England, profoundly transforming England's political, social, and cultural landscape.

description.zhCN: 宋神宗任用王安石为宰相，推行青苗法、募役法、市易法等一系列改革，旨在富国强兵，但因阻力重重，最终未能彻底成功。
description.enUS: Emperor Shenzong appointed Wang Anshi as chancellor, implementing a series of reforms such as the Green Sprouts Act, Service Exemption Act, and Market Exchange Act, aimed at enriching the state and strengthening the military. However, due to strong opposition, these reforms ultimately did not fully succeed.

description.zhCN: 诺曼人攻陷意大利南部的巴里，标志着拜占庭帝国在意大利的最后一个据点失守，彻底结束了拜占庭在意大利南部的统治。
description.enUS: The Normans captured Bari in southern Italy, marking the fall of the last Byzantine stronghold in Italy and definitively ending Byzantine rule in Southern Italy.

description.zhCN: 教皇格里高利七世与神圣罗马帝国皇帝亨利四世之间爆发了关于主教叙任权的长期冲突，标志着教权与皇权斗争的激化。
description.enUS: A long-standing conflict over the right of investiture erupted between Pope Gregory VII and Holy Roman Emperor Henry IV, marking the intensification of the struggle between papal and imperial power.

description.zhCN: 神圣罗马帝国皇帝亨利四世在被教皇格里高利七世绝罚后，前往卡诺莎城堡向教皇忏悔，以求解除绝罚，凸显了教皇在精神领域的权威。
description.enUS: After being excommunicated by Pope Gregory VII, Holy Roman Emperor Henry IV traveled to Canossa Castle to seek absolution from the Pope, highlighting the Pope's spiritual authority.

title.zhCN: 阿莱克修斯一世·科穆宁即位
title.enUS: Alexios I Komnenos Ascends to Throne

description.zhCN: 阿莱克修斯一世·科穆宁在帝国面临内忧外患之际通过政变登基，他重建了帝国军队，开创了科穆宁王朝的复兴时期。
description.enUS: Alexios I Komnenos ascended to the throne through a coup during a period of internal and external crisis for the empire. He rebuilt the imperial army, initiating the Komnenian Restoration period.

description.zhCN: 征服者威廉下令对英格兰进行全国性土地和财产普查，编纂成《末日审判书》，旨在评估税收和军事资源，是中世纪欧洲重要的行政文献。
description.enUS: William the Conqueror ordered a nationwide survey of land and property in England, compiled into the Domesday Book, to assess tax and military resources, serving as an important administrative document in medieval Europe.

description.zhCN: 哈桑·本·萨巴赫在波斯建立了尼扎里伊斯玛仪派，西方人因其政治暗杀活动而称之为“刺客组织”（Hashashin），“刺客”（Assassin）一词即来源于此。
description.enUS: Hasan-i Sabbah established the Nizari Ismaili sect in Persia. Westerners referred to them as the 'Assassins' (Hashashin) due to their political assassinations, and the English word 'assassin' is derived from this group.

description.zhCN: 阿莱克修斯一世·科穆宁在莱沃尼翁战役中联合库曼人，决定性地击败了入侵的佩切涅格人，解除了对君士坦丁堡的直接威胁。
description.enUS: Alexios I Komnenos, allied with the Cumans, decisively defeated the invading Pechenegs at the Battle of Levounion, removing a direct threat to Constantinople.

title.zhCN: 阿莱克修斯一世向西方求援
title.enUS: Alexios I Appeals for Western Aid

description.zhCN: 阿莱克修斯一世向西方国家求援，以对抗塞尔柱突厥人的威胁，这最终导致了第一次十字军东征的爆发。
description.enUS: Alexios I appealed to Western states for aid against the Seljuk Turkish threat, which ultimately led to the launch of the First Crusade.

title.zhCN: 克莱蒙会议与第一次十字军东征号召
title.enUS: Council of Clermont and Call for the First Crusade

description.zhCN: 教皇乌尔班二世在克莱蒙会议上号召欧洲基督徒前往圣地，从穆斯林手中夺回耶路撒冷，标志着十字军东征的正式开始。
description.enUS: Pope Urban II called upon European Christians at the Council of Clermont to journey to the Holy Land to reclaim Jerusalem from the Muslims, marking the official beginning of the Crusades.

title.zhCN: 第一次十字军东征抵达君士坦丁堡

description.zhCN: 应拜占庭皇帝阿莱克修斯一世的求援，第一次十字军的军队陆续抵达君士坦丁堡。虽然为帝国收复部分失地，但十字军与拜占庭帝国之间的猜疑和冲突也埋下了深刻的裂痕。
description.enUS: In response to a plea for help from Byzantine Emperor Alexios I, the armies of the First Crusade arrived at Constantinople. Although they helped the empire reclaim some lost territories, the suspicion and conflicts between the Crusaders and the Byzantine Empire created deep rifts.

title.zhCN: 耶路撒冷被十字军攻陷

description.zhCN: 第一次十字军东征的军队攻陷耶路撒冷，对城内穆斯林和犹太居民进行了屠杀，并建立了耶路撒冷王国。
description.enUS: The army of the First Crusade captured Jerusalem, massacring its Muslim and Jewish inhabitants, and established the Kingdom of Jerusalem.

description.zhCN: 宋徽宗时期，宣和画院汇聚了大量优秀画家，画风精湛，成为中国绘画史上的一座高峰，徽宗本人也以瘦金体书法和绘画闻名。
description.enUS: During Emperor Huizong's reign, the Xuanhe Painting Academy gathered a large number of outstanding painters, whose exquisite style marked a peak in Chinese painting history. Huizong himself was renowned for his 'Slender Gold' calligraphy and painting.

description.zhCN: 神圣罗马帝国皇帝亨利五世与教皇卡利克斯特二世签订协议，结束了长期以来的叙任权之争，规定了世俗君主和教会在主教叙任上的权限。
description.enUS: Holy Roman Emperor Henry V and Pope Callixtus II signed an agreement, ending the long-standing Investiture Controversy by defining the powers of secular rulers and the Church in appointing bishops.

description.zhCN: 金兵攻陷北宋都城开封，俘虏宋徽宗、宋钦宗父子及大量皇室成员、大臣，北宋灭亡，标志着宋朝历史的分水岭。
description.enUS: The Jurchen army captured Kaifeng, the capital of the Northern Song Dynasty, taking Emperor Huizong, Emperor Qinzong, and a large number of imperial family members and officials captive. This marked the fall of the Northern Song Dynasty and was a watershed moment in Song history.

title.zhCN: 康王赵构称帝，建立南宋
title.enUS: Prince Kang Zhao Gou Proclaims Emperor, Establishes Southern Song Dynasty

description.zhCN: 靖康之变后，宋徽宗第九子赵构在南京应天府（今河南商丘）即位，建立南宋，定都临安（今杭州），偏安江南。
description.enUS: After the Jingkang Incident, Zhao Gou, the ninth son of Emperor Huizong, ascended the throne in Nanjing Yingfu (present-day Shangqiu, Henan), establishing the Southern Song Dynasty. Its capital was Lin'an (present-day Hangzhou), where it remained in the south.

title.zhCN: 格拉提安《教会法汇要》完成

description.zhCN: 博洛尼亚大学的修士格拉提安编纂了《教会法汇要》，系统整理了教会法，成为中世纪欧洲法学教育和实践的基础。
description.enUS: Gratian, a monk from the University of Bologna, compiled the Decretum, systematically organizing canon law and establishing it as a foundational text for legal education and practice in medieval Europe.

description.zhCN: 南宋与金朝达成和议，宋向金称臣，割地赔款，岳飞等主战派将领被害，虽换来短暂和平，但也加深了民族矛盾。
description.enUS: The Southern Song and Jin dynasties reached a peace agreement. Song became a vassal of Jin, ceded territory, and paid indemnities. Pro-war generals like Yue Fei were killed. While this brought a brief period of peace, it also intensified ethnic tensions.

title.enUS: Fall of the County of Edessa

description.zhCN: 伊马德丁·赞吉率领的穆斯林军队攻陷十字军建立的埃德萨伯国，引发了第二次十字军东征。
description.enUS: The Muslim army led by Imad ad-Din Zengi captured the Crusader County of Edessa, triggering the Second Crusade.

title.zhCN: 第二次十字军东征开始

description.zhCN: 在埃德萨伯国陷落后，教皇尤金三世和圣伯纳德号召发起了第二次十字军东征，由法国国王路易七世和德意志国王康拉德三世率领。
description.enUS: After the fall of the County of Edessa, Pope Eugene III and Bernard of Clairvaux called for the Second Crusade, led by King Louis VII of France and King Conrad III of Germany.

title.zhCN: 第二次十字军东征途经拜占庭

description.zhCN: 第二次十字军的军队途经拜占庭帝国前往圣地，其混乱的行为和与拜占庭皇帝曼努埃尔一世的摩擦加剧了东西方之间的不信任。
description.enUS: The armies of the Second Crusade passed through the Byzantine Empire on their way to the Holy Land. Their disorderly conduct and friction with Byzantine Emperor Manuel I intensified distrust between East and West.

description.zhCN: 萨拉丁废黜了法蒂玛王朝的最后一位哈里发，并宣布效忠阿拔斯哈里发，标志着法蒂玛王朝的正式终结和阿尤布王朝的建立。
description.enUS: Saladin deposed the last Fatimid Caliph and declared allegiance to the Abbasid Caliph, marking the official end of the Fatimid dynasty and the establishment of the Ayyubid dynasty.

description.zhCN: 曼努埃尔一世率领的拜占庭军队在密列奥塞法隆被塞尔柱罗姆苏丹国军队击败，此战终结了拜占庭收复小亚细亚内陆的希望，是帝国走向衰落的重要标志。
description.enUS: The Byzantine army, led by Manuel I, was defeated by the Seljuk Sultanate of Rum at the Battle of Myriokephalon. This battle ended Byzantine hopes of reconquering inland Asia Minor and was a significant marker of the empire's decline.

description.zhCN: 君士坦丁堡爆发针对西方拉丁商人的大规模排外屠杀，反映了拜占庭民众对西方日益增长的仇恨和经济不满，加剧了东西方的隔阂。
description.enUS: A large-scale xenophobic massacre targeting Western Latin merchants erupted in Constantinople, reflecting the growing hatred and economic discontent of the Byzantine populace towards the West, deepening the divide between East and West.

description.zhCN: 源义经在坛之浦海战中歼灭平氏，幼帝安德天皇投海，源赖朝成为实际统治者。
description.enUS: Minamoto no Yoshitsune destroyed the Taira clan in the naval battle of Dan-no-ura, where child Emperor Antoku drowned, leaving Minamoto no Yoritomo as de facto ruler.

title.zhCN: 保加利亚第二帝国建立

description.zhCN: 由于拜占庭帝国的衰弱和内乱，保加利亚爆发起义，建立了独立的保加利亚第二帝国，重新获得巴尔干地区的控制权。
description.enUS: Due to the decline and internal strife of the Byzantine Empire, a rebellion erupted in Bulgaria, leading to the establishment of the independent Second Bulgarian Empire, regaining control over the Balkan region.

title.zhCN: 安德洛尼卡一世·科穆宁被废黜与处决
title.enUS: Andronikos I Komnenos Deposed and Executed

description.zhCN: 安德洛尼卡一世因其暴政和残忍而遭到民众反抗并被废黜处决，标志着科穆宁王朝的结束，帝国陷入混乱。
description.enUS: Andronikos I was overthrown and executed by popular revolt due to his tyranny and cruelty, marking the end of the Komnenian dynasty and plunging the empire into chaos.

description.zhCN: 萨拉丁率领的穆斯林军队在哈丁战役中决定性地击败十字军，几乎歼灭了耶路撒冷王国的全部兵力。
description.enUS: Saladin's Muslim army decisively defeated the Crusader forces at the Battle of Hattin, virtually annihilating the entire military strength of the Kingdom of Jerusalem.

title.zhCN: 耶路撒冷被萨拉丁收复

description.zhCN: 萨拉丁在哈丁战役胜利后，兵不血刃地收复了耶路撒冷，结束了十字军对该城88年的统治，引发了第三次十字军东征。
description.enUS: After his victory at the Battle of Hattin, Saladin recaptured Jerusalem without bloodshed, ending 88 years of Crusader rule over the city and triggering the Third Crusade.

title.zhCN: 第三次十字军东征开始

description.zhCN: 为响应萨拉丁对耶路撒冷的收复，欧洲主要君主（腓特烈一世、理查一世、腓力二世）发起了第三次十字军东征。
description.enUS: In response to Saladin's recapture of Jerusalem, major European monarchs (Frederick I, Richard I, Philip II) launched the Third Crusade.

description.zhCN: 源赖朝被任命为“征夷大将军”，在镰仓建立幕府，开启了日本长达近七百年的武家政权时代。这一事件标志着日本政治中心从朝廷贵族转向武士阶层。
description.enUS: Minamoto no Yoritomo was appointed 'Sei-i Taishogun' (Shogun) and established the shogunate in Kamakura. This event marked the beginning of nearly seven centuries of samurai rule in Japan, shifting the political center of power from the imperial court nobility to the warrior class.

title.zhCN: 第四次十字军攻占君士坦丁堡（首次）

description.zhCN: 第四次十字军首次攻破君士坦丁堡，扶持被废黜的伊萨克二世复位，并引发了城内的骚乱和冲突。
description.enUS: The Fourth Crusade first breached Constantinople, reinstating the deposed Isaac II, and triggering unrest and conflict within the city.

title.zhCN: 第四次十字军再次攻占君士坦丁堡与拉丁帝国建立
title.enUS: Fourth Crusade Recaptures Constantinople and Establishment of Latin Empire

description.zhCN: 第四次十字军再次攻占并洗劫君士坦丁堡，随后建立了拉丁帝国，标志着拜占庭帝国暂时灭亡，并在希腊和小亚细亚地区建立了多个流亡政权。
description.enUS: The Fourth Crusade once again captured and plundered Constantinople, subsequently establishing the Latin Empire. This marked the temporary fall of the Byzantine Empire and the formation of several successor states in Greece and Asia Minor.

description.zhCN: 在君士坦丁堡陷落后，拜占庭贵族狄奥多尔·拉斯卡里斯在小亚细亚建立了尼西亚帝国，成为拜占庭复兴的主要继承者。
description.enUS: After the fall of Constantinople, Byzantine nobleman Theodore Laskaris established the Empire of Nicaea in Asia Minor, becoming the primary successor state for Byzantine restoration.

description.zhCN: 保加利亚沙皇卡洛扬在阿德里安堡战役中击败了拉丁帝国军队，俘虏了拉丁皇帝鲍德温一世，削弱了拉丁帝国在巴尔干的统治。
description.enUS: Bulgarian Tsar Kaloyan defeated the Latin Empire's army at the Battle of Adrianople, capturing Latin Emperor Baldwin I and weakening Latin rule in the Balkans.

description.zhCN: 铁木真统一蒙古各部，被推举为成吉思汗，建立大蒙古国，开始对周边国家进行大规模征伐，包括对南宋的威胁。
description.enUS: Temüjin unified the Mongol tribes and was proclaimed Genghis Khan, establishing the Great Mongol Empire. He began large-scale conquests of neighboring states, including posing a threat to the Southern Song Dynasty.

title.zhCN: 阿尔比派十字军东征开始

description.zhCN: 教皇英诺森三世发动了针对法国南部阿尔比派（卡特派）异端的十字军东征，导致了持续多年的血腥战争和法国南方文化的衰落。
description.enUS: Pope Innocent III launched a crusade against the Albigensian (Cathar) heresy in Southern France, leading to years of bloody warfare and the decline of Southern French culture.

description.zhCN: 英格兰国王约翰被迫签署《大宪章》，限制了国王的权力，保障了贵族和自由民的权利，对后世宪政发展产生了深远影响。
description.enUS: King John of England was forced to sign the Magna Carta, which limited the king's power and guaranteed the rights of nobles and freemen, profoundly influencing the development of constitutionalism.

title.zhCN: 蒙古人入侵花剌子模帝国
title.enUS: Mongol Invasion of the Khwarazmian Empire

description.zhCN: 蒙古帝国在成吉思汗的领导下入侵中亚强大的花剌子模帝国，造成巨大破坏，为其后续西征中东奠定基础。
description.enUS: The Mongol Empire, under the leadership of Genghis Khan, invaded the powerful Khwarazmian Empire in Central Asia, causing immense destruction and laying the groundwork for their subsequent westward expansion into the Middle East.

description.zhCN: 教皇霍诺留三世批准了圣方济各制定的方济各会规，方济各会成为中世纪欧洲重要的托钵修会，对社会和宗教生活产生巨大影响。
description.enUS: Pope Honorius III approved the Rule of Saint Francis, establishing the Franciscan Order as a significant mendicant order in medieval Europe, which profoundly influenced social and religious life.

title.zhCN: 条顿骑士团迁至普鲁士

description.zhCN: 条顿骑士团将总部迁至普鲁士，开始对当地异教徒进行征服和基督教化，建立了强大的条顿骑士团国。
description.enUS: The Teutonic Order moved its headquarters to Prussia, beginning a conquest and Christianization campaign against the local pagans, establishing a powerful Teutonic Order State.

description.zhCN: 南宋与蒙古达成协议，共同攻灭金朝。金朝虽被消灭，但也使南宋面临蒙古的直接威胁，最终被蒙古所灭。
description.enUS: The Southern Song and Mongol empires allied to jointly conquer the Jin Dynasty. Although the Jin Dynasty was destroyed, this also brought the Southern Song under direct threat from the Mongols, eventually leading to its demise at Mongol hands.

description.zhCN: 哥特式建筑的杰作科隆大教堂奠基，其建造持续数百年，是中世纪欧洲艺术和信仰的象征。
description.enUS: The foundation for Cologne Cathedral, a masterpiece of Gothic architecture, was laid. Its construction spanned centuries, symbolizing medieval European art and faith.

title.zhCN: 马穆鲁克王朝在埃及建立

description.zhCN: 埃及的马穆鲁克军人推翻了阿尤布王朝，建立了马穆鲁克苏丹国，成为中东地区抵抗蒙古人和十字军的主导力量。
description.enUS: The Mamluk military in Egypt overthrew the Ayyubid dynasty and established the Mamluk Sultanate, becoming the dominant force in the Middle East resisting the Mongols and Crusaders.

title.enUS: Collège de Sorbonne Founded in Paris

description.zhCN: 罗贝尔·德·索邦在巴黎建立了索邦学院，最初为神学教育机构，后发展成为著名的巴黎大学，是欧洲最早的大学之一。
description.enUS: Robert de Sorbon founded the Collège de Sorbonne in Paris, initially as a theological institution, which later developed into the renowned University of Paris, one of Europe's earliest universities.

title.zhCN: 旭烈兀攻陷巴格达，阿拔斯王朝灭亡
title.enUS: Hulagu Captures Baghdad, Abbasid Caliphate Falls

description.zhCN: 蒙古军队在旭烈兀的领导下攻陷并洗劫了巴格达，杀害了末代阿拔斯哈里发，标志着伊斯兰黄金时代的终结和哈里发国作为统一政治实体的灭亡。
description.enUS: The Mongol army, led by Hulagu, captured and plundered Baghdad, killing the last Abbasid Caliph. This marked the end of the Islamic Golden Age and the demise of the Caliphate as a unified political entity.

description.zhCN: 埃及马穆鲁克军队在艾因贾鲁特战役中击败了蒙古军队，这是蒙古西征以来首次重大失败，阻止了蒙古人进一步向非洲和中东扩张。
description.enUS: The Egyptian Mamluk army defeated the Mongol forces at the Battle of Ain Jalut. This was the first major defeat for the Mongols since their westward expansion, halting their further advance into Africa and the Middle East.

title.zhCN: 米海尔八世收复君士坦丁堡

description.zhCN: 尼西亚帝国皇帝米海尔八世·帕里奥洛格斯兵不血刃地收复君士坦丁堡，重建了拜占庭帝国，但帝国的实力已大不如前。
description.enUS: Emperor Michael VIII Palaiologos of the Nicaean Empire recaptured Constantinople without bloodshed, restoring the Byzantine Empire, though its power was significantly diminished.

description.zhCN: 蒙古大汗忽必烈在大都（今北京）建立元朝，改蒙古国号为元，标志着一个多民族统一王朝的建立，并继续对南宋用兵。
description.enUS: Kublai Khan, the Great Khan of the Mongols, established the Yuan Dynasty in Dadu (present-day Beijing), changing the Mongol dynastic name to Yuan. This marked the establishment of a multi-ethnic unified dynasty and its continued military campaigns against the Southern Song.

title.zhCN: 文永之役（蒙古第一次入侵日本）
title.enUS: Battle of Bun'ei (First Mongol Invasion of Japan)

description.zhCN: 元朝忽必烈派遣军队入侵日本，但因遭遇台风（被日本人称为“神风”）和武士阶层的顽强抵抗而失败。这次入侵巩固了镰仓幕府的统治，并增强了日本的民族认同感。
description.enUS: Kublai Khan of the Yuan Dynasty sent an army to invade Japan. The invasion was repelled by a typhoon (known as 'kamikaze' by the Japanese) and the fierce resistance of the samurai. This invasion strengthened the Kamakura shogunate's rule and enhanced a sense of national identity in Japan.

title.zhCN: 元军攻陷临安，俘虏宋恭帝
title.enUS: Yuan Army Captures Lin'an, Emperor Gong of Song Captured

description.zhCN: 元军攻陷南宋都城临安，宋恭帝赵㬎出降，标志着南宋王朝的实际灭亡，但残余势力仍在抵抗。
description.enUS: The Yuan army captured Lin'an, the capital of the Southern Song Dynasty. Emperor Gong of Song, Zhao Xian, surrendered, marking the de facto fall of the Southern Song Dynasty, though remnant forces continued to resist.

title.enUS: Battle of Yamen, Southern Song Falls

description.zhCN: 元朝军队与南宋残余势力在广东崖山进行最后一场大规模海战，宋军大败，陆秀夫抱少帝赵昺投海，南宋彻底灭亡。
description.enUS: The Yuan Dynasty army and the remnant forces of the Southern Song engaged in their final large-scale naval battle at Yamen in Guangdong. The Song army suffered a crushing defeat, and Lu Xiufu embraced the young Emperor Zhao Bing and jumped into the sea, marking the complete fall of the Southern Song Dynasty.

description.zhCN: 英格兰国王爱德华一世颁布法令，下令驱逐所有犹太人，导致英格兰犹太社区消失数百年，是欧洲反犹主义的早期大规模体现。
description.enUS: King Edward I of England issued a decree expelling all Jews from the country, leading to the disappearance of the Jewish community in England for several centuries and representing an early large-scale manifestation of anti-Semitism in Europe.

description.zhCN: 马穆鲁克军队攻陷十字军在黎凡特的最后一个主要据点阿卡城，标志着十字军在圣地统治的彻底终结。
description.enUS: The Mamluk army captured Acre, the last major Crusader stronghold in the Levant, marking the definitive end of Crusader rule in the Holy Land.

description.zhCN: 元世祖忽必烈去世，其后继者在政治、经济上出现诸多问题，元朝开始走向衰落。
description.enUS: Kublai Khan, the founder of the Yuan Dynasty, passed away. His successors faced numerous political and economic challenges, marking the beginning of the Yuan Dynasty's decline.

description.zhCN: 奥斯曼一世在安纳托利亚西北部建立了奥斯曼贝伊国，标志着奥斯曼帝国的肇始，该国将逐步崛起为横跨欧亚非的大帝国。
description.enUS: Osman I established the Ottoman Beylik in northwestern Anatolia, marking the beginning of the Ottoman Empire, which would gradually rise to become a vast empire spanning Europe, Asia, and Africa.

title.zhCN: 教廷迁往阿维尼翁（阿维尼翁之囚）

description.zhCN: 教皇克莱门特五世在法王腓力四世的压力下将教廷迁至法国阿维尼翁，开始了持续近70年的“阿维尼翁之囚”时期，削弱了教皇的普世权威。
description.enUS: Under pressure from French King Philip IV, Pope Clement V moved the Papacy to Avignon, France, beginning nearly 70 years of the 'Avignon Papacy,' which weakened the Pope's universal authority.

title.enUS: Restoration of the Imperial Examination System

description.zhCN: 元仁宗恢复因元太祖和忽必烈曾废除的科举制度，以儒家经典为主要考试内容，对稳定统治和文化传承起到一定作用。
description.enUS: Emperor Renzong of Yuan restored the imperial examination system, which had been abolished by Emperor Taizu and Kublai Khan. With Confucian classics as the main examination content, it played a role in stabilizing governance and cultural inheritance.

description.zhCN: 拜占庭帝国爆发祖孙两代安德洛尼卡皇帝之间的内战，严重削弱了帝国的国力，并为塞尔维亚和奥斯曼土耳其的扩张创造了机会。
description.enUS: A civil war erupted within the Byzantine Empire between Emperor Andronikos II Palaiologos and his grandson Andronikos III Palaiologos. This conflict severely weakened the empire, creating opportunities for the expansion of Serbia and the Ottoman Turks.

title.zhCN: 镰仓幕府灭亡与建武中兴
title.enUS: Fall of the Kamakura Shogunate and Kenmu Restoration

description.zhCN: 足利尊氏等武将响应后醍醐天皇号召，推翻了镰仓幕府。后醍醐天皇试图恢复朝廷统治，但由于未能满足武士阶层的利益，最终导致了南北朝的分裂。
description.enUS: Warlords like Ashikaga Takauji responded to Emperor Go-Daigo's call to overthrow the Kamakura shogunate. Emperor Go-Daigo attempted to restore imperial rule, but his failure to satisfy the samurai class ultimately led to the Nanboku-cho (Northern and Southern Courts) period.

title.enUS: Emperor Shun of Yuan Ascends the Throne

description.zhCN: 元顺帝妥懽帖睦尔登基，他是元朝的末代皇帝，其在位期间元朝爆发了大规模的农民起义。
description.enUS: Toghon Temür, Emperor Shun of Yuan, ascended the throne. He was the last emperor of the Yuan Dynasty, during whose reign large-scale peasant uprisings erupted.

description.zhCN: 英格兰国王爱德华三世要求继承法国王位，导致英格兰和法兰西之间爆发了长达百年的战争，对两国社会和政治格局产生深远影响。
description.enUS: King Edward III of England claimed the French throne, leading to the Hundred Years' War between England and France, which profoundly impacted the social and political structures of both nations.

title.zhCN: 第二次帕里奥洛格斯内战

description.zhCN: 约翰六世·坎塔库泽努斯与约翰五世·帕里奥洛格斯之间爆发第二次内战，双方都引入外国势力（包括奥斯曼土耳其人）参战，进一步加速了帝国的崩溃。
description.enUS: A second civil war erupted between John VI Kantakouzenos and John V Palaiologos. Both sides involved foreign powers, including the Ottoman Turks, further accelerating the empire's collapse.

description.zhCN: 毁灭性的黑死病席卷欧洲，也传入拜占庭帝国，导致人口锐减和社会秩序进一步瓦解。
description.enUS: The devastating Black Death swept across Europe and reached the Byzantine Empire, leading to a drastic population decline and further disintegration of social order.

description.zhCN: 毁灭性的黑死病（鼠疫）通过商船传入欧洲，导致欧洲人口锐减约三分之一到二分之一，对社会、经济和文化产生巨大冲击。
description.enUS: The devastating Black Death (bubonic plague) arrived in Europe via merchant ships, causing a reduction of roughly one-third to one-half of Europe's population and immense impacts on society, economy, and culture.

description.zhCN: 元末，黄河泛滥，政府强征民夫治河，引发刘福通、韩山童等领导的红巾军起义，拉开了元末农民大起义的序幕。
description.enUS: In the late Yuan Dynasty, the Yellow River overflowed, and the government conscripted laborers for flood control, triggering the Red Turban Rebellion led by Liu Futong, Han Shantong, and others. This marked the beginning of the great peasant uprisings at the end of the Yuan Dynasty.

title.zhCN: 盖利博卢地震与奥斯曼土耳其登陆欧洲
title.enUS: Gallipoli Earthquake and Ottoman Landing in Europe

description.zhCN: 盖利博卢发生地震，震毁了该地的拜占庭防御工事。奥斯曼土耳其人趁机占领了这座战略要地，在欧洲建立了第一个永久立足点，开始了对巴尔干的征服。
description.enUS: An earthquake struck Gallipoli, destroying its Byzantine fortifications. The Ottoman Turks seized the opportunity to occupy this strategic location, establishing their first permanent foothold in Europe and beginning their conquest of the Balkans.

description.zhCN: 英格兰军队在“黑太子”爱德华的指挥下，在普瓦捷战役中大败法军，俘虏了法国国王约翰二世，进一步打击了法国的国力。
description.enUS: The English army, under the command of Edward the 'Black Prince,' decisively defeated the French forces at the Battle of Poitiers, capturing King John II of France and further crippling France's national power.

description.zhCN: 在元末农民起义中脱颖而出的朱元璋，在应天（今南京）称帝，建立明朝，史称明太祖，开启了明朝的统治。
description.enUS: Zhu Yuanzhang, who emerged victorious from the peasant uprisings at the end of the Yuan Dynasty, proclaimed himself emperor in Yingtian (present-day Nanjing), establishing the Ming Dynasty, known historically as Emperor Taizu of Ming, and initiating the Ming Dynasty's rule.

title.zhCN: 明军攻陷大都，元朝灭亡
title.enUS: Ming Army Captures Dadu, Yuan Dynasty Falls

description.zhCN: 明朝大将徐达率军攻入元朝都城大都，元顺帝北逃，元朝在中原的统治结束，标志着元朝的彻底灭亡。
description.enUS: Xu Da, a prominent general of the Ming Dynasty, led his army into Dadu, the Yuan capital. Emperor Shun of Yuan fled north, ending the Yuan Dynasty's rule in the Central Plains and marking its complete collapse.

description.zhCN: 帖木儿在中亚建立了帖木儿帝国，他自称是成吉思汗的继承者，并展开大规模军事征服，对伊斯兰世界和周边地区产生深远影响。
description.enUS: Timur established the Timurid Empire in Central Asia. Claiming to be a descendant of Genghis Khan, he embarked on vast military conquests, profoundly impacting the Islamic world and surrounding regions.

description.zhCN: 罗马和阿维尼翁同时选出教皇，导致西方教会出现两位甚至三位教皇并立的局面，严重损害了教皇的权威和教会的统一性。
description.enUS: The simultaneous election of popes in Rome and Avignon led to a period with two, and at times three, competing popes in the Western Church, severely damaging papal authority and the unity of the Church.

title.zhCN: 英格兰农民起义（瓦特·泰勒起义）
title.enUS: Peasants' Revolt (Wat Tyler's Rebellion) in England

description.zhCN: 因黑死病后的劳动力短缺、高税收和封建压迫，英格兰爆发大规模农民起义，虽被镇压但动摇了传统封建制度。
description.enUS: Fueled by post-Black Death labor shortages, high taxes, and feudal oppression, a large-scale peasant revolt erupted in England. Though suppressed, it shook the foundations of the traditional feudal system.

description.zhCN: 奥斯曼帝国在科索沃战役中击败了塞尔维亚和波斯尼亚联军，进一步巩固了其在巴尔干半岛的统治，穆拉德一世在此役中阵亡。
description.enUS: The Ottoman Empire defeated the combined forces of Serbia and Bosnia at the Battle of Kosovo, further solidifying its rule in the Balkan Peninsula. Murad I died in this battle.

description.zhCN: 奥斯曼苏丹巴耶济德一世在尼科波利斯战役中大败由匈牙利、法兰西等国组成的十字军，巩固了奥斯曼帝国在巴尔干的霸权。
description.enUS: Ottoman Sultan Bayezid I decisively defeated the Crusader army, composed of forces from Hungary, France, and other nations, at the Battle of Nicopolis, solidifying the Ottoman Empire's hegemony in the Balkans.

description.zhCN: 丹麦、挪威和瑞典（包括芬兰）在丹麦女王玛格丽特一世的推动下，通过《卡尔马联盟条约》联合为一个共主邦联，维持了100多年的稳定。
description.enUS: Denmark, Norway, and Sweden (including Finland), instigated by Queen Margaret I of Denmark, united under the Treaty of Kalmar to form a personal union that maintained stability for over a century.

title.zhCN: 安卡拉战役与拜占庭短暂复苏
title.enUS: Battle of Ankara and Brief Byzantine Resurgence

description.zhCN: 帖木儿帝国在安卡拉战役中击败并俘虏了奥斯曼苏丹巴耶济德一世，导致奥斯曼帝国陷入“大空位期”，为拜占庭帝国提供了短暂的喘息和复苏机会。
description.enUS: The Timurid Empire defeated and captured Ottoman Sultan Bayezid I at the Battle of Ankara, plunging the Ottoman Empire into the 'Ottoman Interregnum' and offering the Byzantine Empire a brief respite and opportunity for resurgence.

title.enUS: Zheng He's Voyages to the Western Oceans Begin

description.zhCN: 明成祖朱棣派宦官郑和率庞大船队七次远航西洋，最远到达非洲东海岸，展现了明朝强大的航海技术和国力，促进了海外交流。
description.enUS: Emperor Yongle of Ming dispatched the eunuch Zheng He to lead a massive fleet on seven voyages to the 'Western Oceans,' reaching as far as the East African coast. These expeditions demonstrated the Ming Dynasty's powerful navigational technology and national strength, promoting overseas exchange.

title.zhCN: 格伦瓦德战役（坦能堡战役）

description.zhCN: 波兰-立陶宛联军在格伦瓦德战役中对条顿骑士团取得决定性胜利，此役削弱了条顿骑士团的势力，并巩固了波兰-立陶宛在东欧的地位。
description.enUS: The Polish-Lithuanian allied forces achieved a decisive victory over the Teutonic Knights at the Battle of Grunwald, weakening the Teutonic Order's power and consolidating Polish-Lithuanian influence in Eastern Europe.

description.zhCN: 英格兰国王亨利五世率领的军队在阿金库尔战役中以少胜多，大败法军，重创法国贵族阶层，进一步加剧了百年战争的进程。
description.enUS: The English army, led by King Henry V, achieved a decisive victory against a larger French force at the Battle of Agincourt, inflicting heavy losses on the French nobility and further escalating the Hundred Years' War.

title.zhCN: 康斯坦茨大公会议结束西方大分裂
title.enUS: Council of Constance Ends Western Schism

description.zhCN: 康斯坦茨大公会议选举马丁五世为唯一教皇，结束了长达数十年的西方教会大分裂，恢复了教廷的统一。
description.enUS: The Council of Constance elected Martin V as the sole Pope, ending the decades-long Western Schism and restoring unity to the Papacy.

title.enUS: Emperor Yongle Moves Capital to Beijing

description.zhCN: 明成祖朱棣将都城从南京迁至北京，并大规模营建北京城和紫禁城，此举巩固了北方边防，也提升了北京的政治地位。
description.enUS: Emperor Yongle Zhu Di moved the capital from Nanjing to Beijing and extensively constructed Beijing City and the Forbidden City. This move strengthened northern defenses and elevated Beijing's political status.

description.zhCN: 圣女贞德在奥尔良之围中率法军击败英军，解除了奥尔良的围困，扭转了百年战争的局势，成为法国民族认同的重要象征。
description.enUS: Joan of Arc led the French army to victory against the English at the Siege of Orléans, lifting the siege and turning the tide of the Hundred Years' War. She became a significant symbol of French national identity.

description.zhCN: 奥斯曼帝国从威尼斯人手中夺取了拜占庭的第二大城市塞萨洛尼基，这是拜占庭帝国失去的重要经济和文化中心。
description.enUS: The Ottoman Empire captured Thessaloniki, Byzantium's second-largest city, from the Venetians. This was a significant economic and cultural center lost by the Byzantine Empire.

description.zhCN: 拜占庭皇帝约翰八世·帕里奥洛格斯和君士坦丁堡牧首约瑟夫二世出席了佛罗伦萨大公会议，试图与罗马天主教会达成统一，以换取西方对奥斯曼威胁的军事援助，但其成果在拜占庭国内遭到普遍抵制。
description.enUS: Byzantine Emperor John VIII Palaiologos and Patriarch Joseph II of Constantinople attended the Council of Florence, attempting to achieve union with the Roman Catholic Church in exchange for Western military aid against the Ottoman threat. However, its outcomes faced widespread resistance within Byzantium.

title.zhCN: 古腾堡发明活字印刷术
title.enUS: Gutenberg Invents the Printing Press with Movable Type

description.zhCN: 约翰内斯·古腾堡在神圣罗马帝国发明了活字印刷术，这项革命性技术极大地促进了书籍的批量生产和知识的传播，对欧洲的宗教改革、科学发展和文艺复兴产生了深远影响。
description.enUS: Johannes Gutenberg invented the printing press with movable type in the Holy Roman Empire. This revolutionary technology greatly facilitated the mass production of books and the dissemination of knowledge, profoundly impacting the Reformation, scientific advancements, and the Renaissance in Europe.

description.zhCN: 奥斯曼帝国苏丹穆拉德二世在瓦尔纳战役中彻底击败了由波兰、匈牙利等国组成的十字军，巩固了奥斯曼在巴尔干半岛的统治，并为日后攻占君士坦丁堡扫清了障碍。
description.enUS: Ottoman Sultan Murad II decisively defeated the Crusader army, composed of forces from Poland, Hungary, and other nations, at the Battle of Varna, solidifying Ottoman rule in the Balkan Peninsula and clearing the way for the future conquest of Constantinople.

description.zhCN: 君士坦丁十一世·帕里奥洛格斯即位，成为拜占庭帝国的末代皇帝。他致力于保卫君士坦丁堡，直至最后牺牲。
description.enUS: Constantine XI Palaiologos ascended to the throne, becoming the last emperor of the Byzantine Empire. He dedicated himself to defending Constantinople until his final sacrifice.

description.zhCN: 明英宗朱祁镇在宦官王振的怂恿下亲征瓦剌，结果在土木堡被瓦剌军大败并被俘，严重打击了明朝国力。
description.enUS: Emperor Yingzong Zhu Qizhen, instigated by the eunuch Wang Zhen, personally led a campaign against the Oirat Mongols. He suffered a devastating defeat at Tumu Fortress and was captured, severely impacting the Ming Dynasty's national strength.

title.zhCN: 君士坦丁堡陷落与拜占庭帝国灭亡
title.enUS: Fall of Constantinople and End of the Byzantine Empire

description.zhCN: 奥斯曼苏丹穆罕默德二世率军攻陷君士坦丁堡，将其定为新首都并改名伊斯坦布尔，标志着延续千年的拜占庭帝国正式灭亡，也常常被视为中世纪的结束。
description.enUS: Ottoman Sultan Mehmed II led his army to capture Constantinople, making it the new capital and renaming it Istanbul. marking the official end of the thousand-year-old Byzantine Empire and often considered the end of the Middle Ages.

title.zhCN: 君士坦丁堡陷落与拜占庭学者西迁
title.enUS: Fall of Constantinople and Migration of Byzantine Scholars to the West

description.zhCN: 奥斯曼帝国攻陷君士坦丁堡后，大量拜占庭学者携带古典手稿逃往西欧，尤其意大利，为欧洲文艺复兴带来了丰富的希腊文化和古典知识，推动了人文主义研究。
description.enUS: After the Ottoman Empire captured Constantinople, many Byzantine scholars fled to Western Europe, particularly Italy, bringing with them a wealth of Greek culture and classical knowledge in the form of manuscripts. This greatly fueled humanistic studies during the European Renaissance.

description.zhCN: 兰开斯特家族和约克家族之间爆发了争夺英格兰王位的内战，即玫瑰战争，给英格兰社会带来长期动荡。
description.enUS: The Wars of the Roses, a civil war for the English throne between the Houses of Lancaster and York, began, bringing long-term instability to English society.

description.zhCN: 以京都为主要战场的应仁之乱爆发，标志着室町幕府权威的彻底衰落和“战国时代”的开始。在这场长达十年的内战中，日本社会秩序崩溃，地方大名崛起。
description.enUS: The Ōnin War erupted, with Kyoto as its main battleground. This conflict marked the complete decline of the Muromachi shogunate's authority and the beginning of the 'Sengoku Period' (Warring States period). During this decade-long civil war, Japan's social order collapsed, and regional daimyo (feudal lords) rose to power.

title.zhCN: 博斯沃思原野战役与都铎王朝建立
title.enUS: Battle of Bosworth Field and Establishment of Tudor Dynasty

description.zhCN: 亨利·都铎在博斯沃思原野战役中击败理查三世并加冕为亨利七世，结束了玫瑰战争，开创了都铎王朝在英格兰的统治。
description.enUS: Henry Tudor defeated Richard III at the Battle of Bosworth Field and was crowned Henry VII, ending the Wars of the Roses and establishing the Tudor dynasty's rule in England.

title.zhCN: 格拉纳达陷落，收复失地运动结束
title.enUS: Fall of Granada, End of the Reconquista

description.zhCN: 卡斯蒂利亚和阿拉贡的基督教军队攻陷了伊比利亚半岛上最后的穆斯林王国格拉纳达，标志着长达781年的西班牙收复失地运动（Reconquista）的最终胜利和穆斯林在西欧统治的结束。
description.enUS: The Christian armies of Castile and Aragon captured Granada, the last Muslim kingdom on the Iberian Peninsula, marking the final victory of the 781-year-long Spanish Reconquista and the end of Muslim rule in Western Europe.

description.zhCN: 克里斯托弗·哥伦布在西班牙王室资助下抵达美洲，这一发现开启了“地理大发现”时代，彻底改变了欧洲的世界观和全球贸易格局，也推动了文艺复兴时期的探索精神。
description.enUS: Christopher Columbus, funded by the Spanish monarchy, arrived in the Americas. This discovery inaugurated the 'Age of Discovery,' profoundly transforming Europe's worldview and global trade patterns, and fueling the exploratory spirit of the Renaissance.

title.zhCN: 萨法维王朝在波斯建立

description.zhCN: 伊斯玛仪一世建立萨法维王朝，他强制什叶派伊斯兰教为国教，使波斯成为什叶派的堡垒，并与逊尼派奥斯曼帝国长期对抗。
description.enUS: Ismail I established the Safavid Dynasty, making Shia Islam the mandatory state religion. This transformed Persia into a stronghold of Shiism and led to a prolonged rivalry with the Sunni Ottoman Empire.

description.zhCN: 美第奇家族的乔瓦尼·德·美第奇当选教皇利奥十世，他是文艺复兴盛期最重要的教皇之一，大力赞助艺术和科学，但其奢靡和出售赎罪券的行为也直接引发了宗教改革。"
description.enUS: Giovanni de' Medici of the Medici family was elected Pope Leo X. He was one of the most important popes of the High Renaissance, a great patron of arts and sciences. However, his lavish lifestyle and the sale of indulgences directly fueled the Protestant Reformation.

title.zhCN: 米开朗基罗开始绘制西斯廷教堂天顶画
title.enUS: Michelangelo Begins Painting the Sistine Chapel Ceiling

description.zhCN: 意大利文艺复兴艺术家米开朗基罗受教皇尤利乌斯二世委托，开始绘制罗马西斯廷教堂天顶画。这项杰作历时四年完成，以其宏伟的构图和对人体的精湛描绘，成为文艺复兴盛期艺术的典范，体现了人文主义思想的辉煌成就。
description.enUS: Italian Renaissance artist Michelangelo was commissioned by Pope Julius II to begin painting the ceiling of the Sistine Chapel in Rome. This masterpiece, completed in four years, with its magnificent composition and masterful depiction of the human form, became a prime example of High Renaissance art and a glorious achievement of humanist thought.

description.zhCN: 奥斯曼帝国在查尔迪兰战役中击败了萨法维王朝，遏制了萨法维在安纳托利亚的扩张，并巩固了奥斯曼对东部边境的控制，确定了两大帝国之间的界限。
description.enUS: The Ottoman Empire defeated the Safavid Dynasty at the Battle of Chaldiran, halting Safavid expansion into Anatolia and solidifying Ottoman control over its eastern borders, thus defining the boundaries between the two great empires.

title.zhCN: 托马斯·莫尔《乌托邦》出版

description.zhCN: 英国人文主义思想家托马斯·莫尔的著作《乌托邦》出版。该书虚构了一个理想的岛屿社会，对当时的社会弊病进行了深刻批判，开启了“乌托邦”文学的先河，并对后世的政治哲学产生了重要影响。
description.enUS: The work 'Utopia' by English humanist thinker Thomas More was published. The book imagined an ideal island society, offering a profound critique of the social ills of the time, pioneering the genre of 'utopian' literature, and significantly influencing later political philosophy.

title.zhCN: 奥斯曼帝国征服埃及与马穆鲁克王朝灭亡
title.enUS: Ottoman Conquest of Egypt and Fall of the Mamluk Sultanate

description.zhCN: 奥斯曼苏丹塞利姆一世征服埃及，推翻了马穆鲁克王朝，将伊斯兰教三大圣城（麦加、麦地那和耶路撒冷）的控制权纳入奥斯曼帝国版图，并宣布自己为哈里发，进一步提升了奥斯曼帝国在伊斯兰世界的领导地位。
description.enUS: Ottoman Sultan Selim I conquered Egypt, overthrowing the Mamluk Sultanate. This brought control of the three holiest cities of Islam (Mecca, Medina, and Jerusalem) under the Ottoman Empire and led Selim to declare himself Caliph, further enhancing the Ottoman Empire's leadership in the Islamic world.

title.zhCN: 马丁·路德发表《九十五条论纲》
title.enUS: Martin Luther Posts the Ninety-five Theses

description.zhCN: 马丁·路德在维滕贝格教堂门上贴出《九十五条论纲》，批评赎罪券和教廷腐败，标志着宗教改革的正式开始，对欧洲的宗教、政治和社会结构产生了巨大冲击。
description.enUS: Martin Luther posted his Ninety-five Theses on the door of the Wittenberg Castle Church, criticizing indulgences and papal corruption. This marked the official beginning of the Protestant Reformation, which had a profound impact on Europe's religious, political, and social structures.

title.enUS: Suleiman the Magnificent Ascends to Throne

description.zhCN: 苏莱曼一世即位奥斯曼苏丹，在其统治下，奥斯曼帝国达到鼎盛时期，在军事、政治、经济和文化方面都取得了辉煌成就。
description.enUS: Suleiman I ascended as Ottoman Sultan. Under his reign, the Ottoman Empire reached its zenith, achieving brilliant success in military, political, economic, and cultural spheres.

title.zhCN: 第一次帕尼帕特战役与莫卧儿帝国建立
title.enUS: First Battle of Panipat and Establishment of the Mughal Empire

description.zhCN: 帖木儿的后裔巴布尔在第一次帕尼帕特战役中击败德里苏丹国，建立了莫卧儿帝国，将其统治扩展到印度次大陆。
description.enUS: Babur, a descendant of Timur, defeated the Delhi Sultanate at the First Battle of Panipat, establishing the Mughal Empire and extending his rule into the Indian subcontinent.

description.zhCN: 奥斯曼帝国苏莱曼大帝率军围攻哈布斯堡王朝的维也纳，尽管未能攻克，但标志着奥斯曼帝国对中欧的强大威胁达到顶峰。
description.enUS: Suleiman the Magnificent, Sultan of the Ottoman Empire, led his army in a siege of Habsburg Vienna. Although unsuccessful, this marked the peak of the formidable Ottoman threat to Central Europe.

title.zhCN: 马基雅维利《君主论》出版

description.zhCN: 尼科洛·马基雅维利的政治哲学著作《君主论》在作者去世五年后出版。该书探讨了权术和国家统治的现实，被认为是现代政治学和现实主义思想的开端，反映了文艺复兴时期对世俗权力和人性的重新审视。
description.enUS: Niccolò Machiavelli's political philosophy treatise 'The Prince' was published five years after his death. This book explored statecraft and the realities of governance, and is considered the beginning of modern political science and realist thought, reflecting the Renaissance's re-examination of secular power and human nature.

title.zhCN: 哥白尼《天体运行论》出版

description.zhCN: 尼古拉·哥白尼的《天体运行论》出版，提出了日心说，挑战了托勒密的地心说宇宙模型，标志着科学革命的开端，也体现了文艺复兴时期理性与探索精神的进步。
description.enUS: Nicolaus Copernicus' 'De revolutionibus orbium coelestium' was published, proposing the heliocentric model of the universe and challenging Ptolemy's geocentric model. This marked the beginning of the Scientific Revolution and exemplified the progress of reason and exploratory spirit during the Renaissance.

title.zhCN: 葡萄牙人抵达日本与火器传入
title.enUS: Portuguese Arrive in Japan and Firearms Introduced

description.zhCN: 一艘葡萄牙船只因风暴漂流到种子岛，带来了火绳枪。火器的传入彻底改变了日本战国时代的战争模式，加速了统一进程。
description.enUS: A Portuguese ship was carried by a storm to Tanegashima Island, introducing arquebuses (matchlock firearms) to Japan. The introduction of firearms completely changed the style of warfare during the Sengoku period and accelerated the process of unification.

description.zhCN: 瓦剌俺答汗率军大举进犯明朝京畿地区，兵临北京城下，虽然最终退兵，但暴露了明朝边防的虚弱。
description.enUS: Altan Khan of the Oirat Mongols led a large invasion force into the Ming capital region, reaching the walls of Beijing. Although they eventually withdrew, this exposed the weakness of Ming's border defenses.

description.zhCN: 英格兰著名剧作家、诗人威廉·莎士比亚出生，其作品代表了文艺复兴时期人文主义文学的巅峰，对英语语言和世界戏剧产生了深远影响。
description.enUS: The renowned English playwright and poet William Shakespeare was born. His works represent the pinnacle of Humanist literature during the Renaissance and have profoundly influenced the English language and world drama.

description.zhCN: 明穆宗隆庆皇帝开放福建漳州月港，允许民间合法出海贸易，部分解除海禁，促进了海外贸易和白银流入，缓解了倭寇问题。
description.enUS: Emperor Muzong Longqing opened Yuegang port in Zhangzhou, Fujian, allowing legal private overseas trade. This partial lifting of the maritime ban boosted overseas trade and silver inflow, and helped alleviate the Wokou (Japanese pirate) problem.

description.zhCN: 神圣同盟（西班牙、威尼斯和教皇国）海军在勒班陀战役中大败奥斯曼帝国舰队，这是奥斯曼帝国海军的首次重大失败，遏制了其在地中海的扩张。
description.enUS: The Holy League navy (Spain, Venice, and the Papal States) decisively defeated the Ottoman Empire's fleet at the Battle of Lepanto. This was the first major defeat for the Ottoman navy, curbing its expansion in the Mediterranean.

description.zhCN: 即将统一日本的织田信长在本能寺被部下明智光秀背叛并杀害。这一事件使日本的统一进程暂时中断，但为丰臣秀吉的崛起创造了机会。
description.enUS: Oda Nobunaga, who was on the verge of unifying Japan, was betrayed and killed by his subordinate Akechi Mitsuhide at Honnō-ji Temple. This incident temporarily halted the unification process of Japan but created an opportunity for the rise of Toyotomi Hideyoshi.

title.zhCN: 英国击败西班牙无敌舰队

description.zhCN: 英国海军在英吉利海峡击败了西班牙的“无敌舰队”，此战标志着西班牙海上霸权的衰落和英国海上力量的崛起，也为英国在全球的殖民扩张铺平了道路。
description.enUS: The English navy defeated the Spanish 'Invincible Armada' in the English Channel. This battle marked the decline of Spanish naval supremacy and the rise of English sea power, paving the way for Britain's global colonial expansion.

title.zhCN: 万历援朝战争（朝鲜壬辰倭乱）

description.zhCN: 明朝派兵援救朝鲜，抵抗日本丰臣秀吉的入侵，历时七年，最终击退日军，巩固了中朝关系，但耗费巨大。
description.enUS: The Ming Dynasty dispatched troops to aid Korea against the Japanese invasion led by Toyotomi Hideyoshi. Lasting seven years, the war ultimately repelled the Japanese, solidified Sino-Korean relations, but incurred immense costs.

description.zhCN: 法国国王亨利四世颁布南特敕令，赋予胡格诺派（法国新教徒）在天主教法国的信仰自由，结束了法国宗教战争，标志着法国文艺复兴向更稳定社会阶段的过渡。
description.enUS: King Henry IV of France issued the Edict of Nantes, granting religious freedom to Huguenots (French Protestants) in Catholic France. This ended the French Wars of Religion and marked a transition to a more stable social phase in the French Renaissance.

description.zhCN: 德川家康在关原之战中击败了以石田三成和毛利辉元为首的西军，取得了日本的实际统治权。这场战役为德川幕府的建立奠定了基础。
description.enUS: Tokugawa Ieyasu defeated the Western Army led by Ishida Mitsunari and Mori Terumoto at the Battle of Sekigahara, gaining de facto control of Japan. This battle laid the foundation for the establishment of the Tokugawa shogunate.

title.enUS: The English East India Company Is Established

description.zhCN: 英国女王伊丽莎白一世授予英国商人皇家特许状，成立了东印度公司。该公司起初是一家贸易公司，但随着时间的推移，逐渐获得了军事和行政权力，并成为英国在印度和亚洲殖民统治的工具。
description.enUS: Queen Elizabeth I of England granted a royal charter to a group of merchants, establishing the East India Company. Initially a trading company, it gradually acquired military and administrative powers over time, becoming an instrument of British colonial rule in India and Asia.

title.zhCN: 德川家康建立江户幕府
title.enUS: Tokugawa Ieyasu Establishes the Edo Shogunate

description.zhCN: 德川家康被任命为征夷大将军，在江户（今东京）建立幕府，开始了长达二百多年的“江户时代”。这一时期日本实行锁国政策，社会相对稳定，文化艺术得到发展。
description.enUS: Tokugawa Ieyasu was appointed shogun and established the shogunate in Edo (modern-day Tokyo), beginning the 'Edo Period' which lasted for over 200 years. During this period, Japan implemented a policy of national seclusion, enjoyed relative social stability, and saw the development of its culture and arts.

description.zhCN: 阿姆斯特丹银行成立，是欧洲早期最重要的公共银行之一，极大促进了国际贸易和金融发展，标志着荷兰黄金时代的到来。
description.enUS: The Bank of Amsterdam was founded, becoming one of the most important public banks in early modern Europe. It greatly facilitated international trade and finance, marking the dawn of the Dutch Golden Age.

title.zhCN: 莫卧儿帝国与英国东印度公司建立贸易关系
title.enUS: Mughal Empire Establishes Trade Relations with British East India Company

description.zhCN: 英国东印度公司在莫卧儿皇帝贾汉吉尔的许可下，在印度建立了第一个贸易站，标志着欧洲殖民势力在印度次大陆影响力的开端。
description.enUS: The British East India Company established its first trading post in India with the permission of Mughal Emperor Jahangir, marking the beginning of European colonial influence on the Indian subcontinent.

description.zhCN: 神圣罗马帝国的布拉格掷出窗外事件引发了三十年战争，这场宗教冲突演变为欧洲主要强国之间的权力斗争，给中欧地区造成毁灭性破坏。
description.enUS: The Defenestration of Prague in the Holy Roman Empire sparked the Thirty Years' War. This religious conflict escalated into a power struggle among major European powers, causing devastating destruction in Central Europe.

description.zhCN: 明朝与后金（后来的清朝）在萨尔浒（今辽宁抚顺东）进行的战略决战，明军大败，标志着明朝在辽东防御上的全面劣势，后金崛起。
description.enUS: A decisive strategic battle between the Ming Dynasty and Later Jin (later the Qing Dynasty) at Sarhū (present-day eastern Fushun, Liaoning). The Ming army suffered a crushing defeat, marking the Ming Dynasty's complete military inferiority in Liaodong and the rise of Later Jin.

title.zhCN: 萨法维王朝收复霍尔木兹岛

description.zhCN: 萨法维王朝在英国东印度公司的帮助下，从葡萄牙人手中夺回了战略要地霍尔木兹岛，控制了波斯湾的贸易。
description.enUS: With the help of the British East India Company, the Safavid Dynasty recaptured the strategic island of Hormuz from the Portuguese, gaining control over trade in the Persian Gulf.

description.zhCN: 荷兰东印度公司在台湾南部建立热兰遮城，开始对台湾的殖民统治，对明朝海防和海洋权益构成威胁。
description.enUS: The Dutch East India Company established Fort Zeelandia in southern Taiwan, beginning its colonial rule over Taiwan, posing a threat to the Ming Dynasty's coastal defense and maritime interests.

description.zhCN: 莫卧儿皇帝沙贾汗为其爱妻泰姬·玛哈尔修建泰姬陵，这座宏伟的陵墓是伊斯兰建筑和莫卧儿艺术的杰作，也是世界文化遗产。
description.enUS: Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan commissioned the construction of the Taj Mahal for his beloved wife Mumtaz Mahal. This magnificent mausoleum is a masterpiece of Islamic architecture and Mughal art, and a UNESCO World Heritage site.

title.zhCN: 伽利略因支持日心说受审
title.enUS: Galileo Is Tried for Supporting Heliocentrism

description.zhCN: 意大利天文学家伽利略·伽利莱因其著作支持哥白尼的日心说，被罗马宗教裁判所审判。他被迫公开认错，并在软禁中度过余生。这一事件揭示了新旧思想之间的冲突，但未能阻止科学革命的进程。
description.enUS: Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei was tried by the Roman Inquisition for his writings in support of Copernicus's heliocentric theory. He was forced to publicly recant and spent the rest of his life under house arrest. This event highlighted the conflict between old and new ideas but failed to halt the progress of the Scientific Revolution.

title.zhCN: 皇太极称帝，改国号为清
title.enUS: Hong Taiji Proclaims Emperor, Changes Dynastic Name to Qing

description.zhCN: 后金汗皇太极在盛京称帝，改国号为大清，标志着清朝的正式建立，为清军入关取代明朝奠定基础。
description.enUS: Hong Taiji, Khan of Later Jin, proclaimed himself emperor in Shengjing, changing the dynastic name to Great Qing. This marked the formal establishment of the Qing Dynasty, laying the groundwork for the Qing army's entry into China proper and replacement of the Ming.

description.zhCN: 法国哲学家、数学家勒内·笛卡尔出版了《方法论》。在这部著作中，他提出了著名的“我思故我在”的哲学命题，并阐述了一种以怀疑一切为起点的理性主义哲学体系。这部著作被视为现代哲学的开端，对启蒙运动和科学发展产生了深远影响。
description.enUS: French philosopher and mathematician René Descartes published 'Discourse on the Method.' In this work, he put forth the famous philosophical proposition, 'I think, therefore I am,' and articulated a system of rationalist philosophy that began with doubting everything. This work is considered the beginning of modern philosophy and had a profound impact on the Enlightenment and scientific development.

title.zhCN: 日本实行全面锁国政策
title.enUS: Japan Enacts a Complete National Seclusion Policy

description.zhCN: 德川幕府禁止葡萄牙人来日贸易，至此，除了对中国和荷兰的有限贸易外，日本几乎断绝了与所有西方国家的联系。锁国政策旨在根除基督教并维持幕府统治，塑造了江户时代独特的社会和文化。
description.enUS: The Tokugawa shogunate banned Portuguese traders from entering Japan. With this, Japan almost completely severed ties with all Western countries except for limited trade with China and the Netherlands. The seclusion policy aimed to eradicate Christianity and maintain the shogunate's rule, shaping the unique society and culture of the Edo period.

description.zhCN: 英格兰国王查理一世与议会之间因宗教、政治和权力分配问题爆发内战，最终导致国王被处决和短暂的共和时期，深刻改变了英国的君主立宪进程。
description.enUS: Civil war erupted in England between King Charles I and Parliament over issues of religion, politics, and the distribution of power. This ultimately led to the execution of the king and a brief republican period, profoundly altering England's constitutional monarchy.

description.zhCN: 李自成领导的农民起义军攻陷明朝都城北京，崇祯帝朱由检在煤山自缢，标志着明朝在中原统治的终结。
description.enUS: Li Zicheng's peasant rebel army captured Beijing, the Ming capital. Emperor Chongzhen Zhu Youjian hanged himself on Coal Hill, marking the end of Ming rule in the Central Plains.

description.zhCN: 明朝辽东总兵吴三桂降清，引清军入关，与李自成大顺军交战，清军趁势入主中原。
description.enUS: Wu Sangui, the Ming general in charge of Liaodong, surrendered to the Qing and invited the Qing army through Shanhai Pass. They engaged Li Zicheng's Shun army, and the Qing forces seized the opportunity to enter the Central Plains.

title.zhCN: 威斯特伐利亚和约签订

description.zhCN: 《威斯特伐利亚和约》的签订标志着三十年战争的结束，确立了主权国家体系原则，即“威斯特伐利亚主权”，对现代国际关系产生了深远影响。
description.enUS: The signing of the Treaty of Westphalia marked the end of the Thirty Years' War. It established the principle of state sovereignty, known as 'Westphalian sovereignty,' which profoundly influenced modern international relations.

description.zhCN: 英国哲学家托马斯·霍布斯出版了政治哲学著作《利维坦》。该书提出了社会契约论，主张公民为避免“所有人对所有人的战争”而将权力让渡给一个强大的主权者，对后世的政治思想产生了深远影响。
description.enUS: English philosopher Thomas Hobbes published his work of political philosophy, 'Leviathan.' The book proposed the theory of a social contract, arguing that citizens should cede power to a powerful sovereign to avoid a 'war of all against all.' It had a profound impact on later political thought.

description.zhCN: 查理二世登基，标志着英格兰共和国的结束和斯图亚特王朝的复辟，但议会的权力已显著增强。
description.enUS: Charles II ascended to the throne, marking the end of the English Commonwealth and the restoration of the Stuart monarchy, though Parliament's power had significantly increased.

description.zhCN: 南明永历帝朱由榔在缅甸被吴三桂追击俘虏，南明最后一个有较大影响力的政权瓦解，明朝残余势力加速消亡。
description.enUS: The Southern Ming Yongli Emperor Zhu Youlang was pursued and captured by Wu Sangui in Myanmar. The last influential regime of Southern Ming disintegrated, and the remaining Ming forces rapidly declined.

description.zhCN: 明末抗清将领郑成功率军渡海攻打台湾，迫使荷兰殖民者投降，收复台湾，使台湾回归中国。
description.enUS: Zheng Chenggong, a Ming general who resisted the Qing, led his army across the sea to attack Taiwan, forcing the Dutch colonists to surrender and recovering Taiwan, thus bringing it back under Chinese rule.

description.zhCN: 伦敦爆发了大规模的腺鼠疫，导致约10万人死亡。这场瘟疫对伦敦的社会和经济造成了毁灭性打击，但也是城市重建和公共卫生改革的催化剂。
description.enUS: A large-scale bubonic plague outbreak in London killed an estimated 100,000 people. The plague had a devastating impact on London's society and economy but also served as a catalyst for urban reconstruction and public health reforms.

description.zhCN: 伦敦发生了一场持续四天的大火，烧毁了城市的大部分地区，包括圣保罗大教堂。这场灾难彻底改变了伦敦的面貌，为城市规划和建筑法规的现代化提供了机会。
description.enUS: A fire broke out in London that lasted for four days, destroying a large part of the city, including St Paul's Cathedral. The disaster completely transformed London's appearance and provided an opportunity for modern urban planning and building regulations.

description.zhCN: 英国清教徒作家约翰·班扬的寓言小说《天路历程》出版。这部作品以其简单的语言和深刻的宗教寓意，成为西方文学史上最畅销的书籍之一，反映了清教徒文化对世俗世界的批判和对灵魂救赎的追求。
description.enUS: The allegorical novel 'The Pilgrim's Progress' by English Puritan writer John Bunyan was published. With its simple language and profound religious allegory, it became one of the best-selling books in Western literary history, reflecting the Puritan critique of the secular world and the quest for spiritual salvation.

title.enUS: Rebellion of the Three Feudatories Suppressed

description.zhCN: 康熙帝果断决策削藩，引发吴三桂等三藩叛乱，清朝历时八年平定，巩固了中央集权，加强了对西南地区的控制。
description.enUS: Emperor Kangxi's decisive decision to reduce the power of feudal lords triggered the Rebellion of the Three Feudatories led by Wu Sangui and others. It took eight years for the Qing Dynasty to suppress it, consolidating central authority and strengthening control over the southwestern regions.

description.zhCN: 康熙帝派施琅率军攻打台湾郑氏政权，迫使其投降，将台湾纳入清朝版图，标志着清朝统一全国的完成。
description.enUS: Emperor Kangxi dispatched Shi Lang to lead an army against the Zheng regime in Taiwan, forcing them to surrender and incorporating Taiwan into the Qing Dynasty's territory, marking the completion of the Qing Dynasty's unification of the nation.

description.zhCN: 奥斯曼帝国对维也纳发动第二次大规模围攻，最终被波兰国王扬三世·索别斯基率领的援军击败，标志着奥斯曼帝国在欧洲扩张的终结和其长期衰落的开始。
description.enUS: The Ottoman Empire launched its second major siege of Vienna, but was ultimately defeated by a relief force led by Polish King John III Sobieski. This marked the end of Ottoman expansion in Europe and the beginning of its long decline.

title.zhCN: 牛顿出版《自然哲学的数学原理》

description.zhCN: 艾萨克·牛顿出版了《自然哲学的数学原理》，提出了万有引力定律和三大运动定律，奠定了经典物理学的基础，标志着科学革命的顶峰。
description.enUS: Isaac Newton published 'Principia Mathematica,' introducing the law of universal gravitation and his three laws of motion. This work laid the foundation for classical physics and marked the zenith of the Scientific Revolution.

description.zhCN: 荷兰执政奥兰治的威廉率军入侵英格兰，詹姆斯二世被推翻，威廉三世和玛丽二世共同执政，巩固了议会权力，确立了君主立宪制，是英国政治史上的一个里程碑。
description.enUS: William of Orange, Stadtholder of the Netherlands, invaded England. James II was overthrown, and William III and Mary II jointly ruled, solidifying parliamentary power and establishing a constitutional monarchy—a landmark in British political history.

description.zhCN: 清朝与沙皇俄国签订条约，划定中俄东段边界，这是中国历史上第一个与西方国家签订的国际条约。
description.enUS: The Qing Dynasty and Tsarist Russia signed a treaty, demarcating the eastern section of the Sino-Russian border. This was the first international treaty signed by China with a Western power in its history.

description.zhCN: 英格兰议会通过《权利法案》，限制了国王的权力，保障了议会的权利和公民自由，进一步巩固了英国君主立宪制度的基础。
description.enUS: The English Parliament passed the Bill of Rights, which limited the power of the monarch and guaranteed the rights of Parliament and civil liberties, further solidifying the foundations of England's constitutional monarchy.

description.zhCN: 英国哲学家约翰·洛克出版了《政府论》。他在此书中提出了自然权利、社会契约和分权制衡等重要思想，主张政府的权力源于被统治者的同意，为后来的启蒙运动和美国《独立宣言》提供了重要的理论基础。
description.enUS: English philosopher John Locke published 'Two Treatises of Government.' In this book, he put forward important ideas such as natural rights, the social contract, and the separation of powers. He argued that government's power derives from the consent of the governed, providing a crucial theoretical foundation for the later Enlightenment and the American Declaration of Independence.

title.zhCN: 西班牙王位继承战争爆发
title.enUS: War of the Spanish Succession Begins

description.zhCN: 西班牙哈布斯堡王朝绝嗣，法国波旁王朝试图继承西班牙王位，引发欧洲主要强国之间的大规模冲突，以阻止法国势力过于强大。
description.enUS: The Spanish Habsburg dynasty became extinct, and the French Bourbon dynasty attempted to claim the Spanish throne, leading to a major conflict among European powers to prevent an overly powerful France.

title.enUS: The Great Hōei Eruption of Mount Fuji

description.zhCN: 日本最著名的火山富士山最后一次喷发。这次大规模喷发给关东地区带来了严重的火山灰灾害，导致社会经济混乱，并被认为是江户时代末期一系列自然灾害的开端。
description.enUS: Mount Fuji, Japan's most famous volcano, had its last eruption. This massive eruption caused severe ashfall damage in the Kantō region, leading to socioeconomic chaos and is considered the beginning of a series of natural disasters in the late Edo period.

description.zhCN: 《乌得勒支和约》的签订标志着西班牙王位继承战争的结束，确立了欧洲均势原则，并重塑了欧洲的政治版图。
description.enUS: The signing of the Treaty of Utrecht marked the end of the War of the Spanish Succession. It established the principle of the balance of power in Europe and reshaped the continent's political map.

title.zhCN: 清军入藏，设立驻藏大臣
title.enUS: Qing Army Enters Tibet, Resident Commissioner Appointed in Tibet

description.zhCN: 清军进入西藏，驱逐准噶尔势力，清朝开始在西藏设立驻藏大臣，加强对西藏的管辖。
description.enUS: The Qing army entered Tibet, expelling the Dzungar forces. The Qing Dynasty began to establish Resident Commissioners in Tibet, strengthening its administration over Tibet.

description.zhCN: 阿富汗的吉尔吉部落在米尔·马哈茂德·霍塔克的领导下入侵波斯并攻陷伊斯法罕，导致萨法维王朝的覆灭，波斯陷入长期动荡和分裂。
description.enUS: The Ghilji tribe from Afghanistan, led by Mir Mahmud Hotak, invaded Persia and captured Isfahan, leading to the collapse of the Safavid Dynasty and plunging Persia into a long period of instability and fragmentation.

title.zhCN: 卡尔纳尔战役与莫卧儿帝国衰落
title.enUS: Battle of Karnal and Decline of the Mughal Empire

description.zhCN: 波斯统治者纳迪尔沙阿在卡尔纳尔战役中大败莫卧儿帝国军队，洗劫了德里并带走了孔雀宝座和光之山钻石，极大加速了莫卧儿帝国的衰落。
description.enUS: Nader Shah, the ruler of Persia, decisively defeated the Mughal army at the Battle of Karnal, plundered Delhi, and took the Peacock Throne and the Koh-i-Noor diamond, greatly accelerating the decline of the Mughal Empire.

title.zhCN: 奥地利王位继承战争爆发
title.enUS: War of the Austrian Succession Begins

description.zhCN: 普鲁士国王腓特烈二世入侵西里西亚，引发了围绕奥地利女大公玛丽亚·特蕾莎继承权的欧洲主要国家冲突。
description.enUS: King Frederick II of Prussia invaded Silesia, sparking a major European conflict over the succession rights of Archduchess Maria Theresa of Austria.

title.zhCN: 孟德斯鸠出版《论法的精神》
title.enUS: Montesquieu Publishes 'The Spirit of the Laws'

description.zhCN: 法国启蒙思想家孟德斯鸠出版了《论法的精神》。他在这部著作中系统地阐述了三权分立（立法、行政、司法）的政治学说，认为这是防止专制、保障公民自由的最佳途径。他的思想对美国宪法和后来的现代民主制度产生了深远影响。
description.enUS: French Enlightenment thinker Montesquieu published 'The Spirit of the Laws.' In this work, he systematically explained the political doctrine of the separation of powers (legislative, executive, and judicial), arguing it was the best way to prevent despotism and protect civil liberties. His ideas profoundly influenced the U.S. Constitution and later modern democratic systems.

title.zhCN: 法国《百科全书》第一卷出版
title.enUS: First Volume of the French 'Encyclopédie' Is Published

description.zhCN: 狄德罗和达朗贝尔主编的《百科全书》第一卷出版。这部巨著汇集了当时最先进的科学、技术和哲学知识，是启蒙运动的代表性成果，旨在传播理性、批判神学和迷信，对后来的法国大革命产生了重要影响。
description.enUS: The first volume of the 'Encyclopédie,' edited by Diderot and D'Alembert, was published. This monumental work compiled the most advanced scientific, technological, and philosophical knowledge of the time, serving as a landmark achievement of the Enlightenment. It aimed to spread reason and critique theology and superstition, profoundly influencing the later French Revolution.

description.zhCN: 普鲁士入侵萨克森，引发了欧洲列强（英国、普鲁士对抗法国、奥地利、俄罗斯等）之间在全球范围内的冲突，被认为是“第一次世界大战”，重塑了殖民帝国的格局。
description.enUS: Prussia invaded Saxony, triggering a global conflict among European powers (Great Britain and Prussia against France, Austria, Russia, etc.). This conflict is often considered the 'First World War' and reshaped the landscape of colonial empires.

title.enUS: Emperor Qianlong Implements the 'One Port Trade' Policy

description.zhCN: 清乾隆帝谕令外国商船只能在广州一口进行贸易，实行严格的对外贸易管理，标志着清朝闭关锁国政策的强化。
description.enUS: Emperor Qianlong of Qing decreed that foreign merchant ships could only conduct trade at Guangzhou port, implementing strict foreign trade management and marking the strengthening of the Qing Dynasty's closed-door policy.

description.zhCN: 阿富汗杜兰尼王朝与马拉塔帝国在印度北部的帕尼帕特发生激战，杜兰尼王朝获胜，但双方都损失惨重，为英国东印度公司在印度的扩张提供了机会。
description.enUS: The Afghan Durrani Dynasty and the Maratha Empire fought a fierce battle at Panipat in northern India. The Durranis emerged victorious, but both sides suffered heavy losses, creating an opportunity for the British East India Company's expansion in India.

description.zhCN: 法国启蒙思想家让-雅克·卢梭出版了《社会契约论》。他在这部著作中提出了“人民主权”和“公意”等核心概念，主张个人通过社会契约将权利让渡给集体，从而实现真正的自由。他的思想直接影响了法国大革命的激进派，是现代民主理论的重要来源之一。
description.enUS: French Enlightenment thinker Jean-Jacques Rousseau published 'The Social Contract.' In this work, he introduced core concepts such as 'popular sovereignty' and the 'general will,' arguing that individuals cede their rights to the collective through a social contract to achieve true freedom. His ideas directly influenced the radical faction of the French Revolution and are a crucial source of modern democratic theory.

title.enUS: Catherine the Great Ascends to Throne

description.zhCN: 叶卡捷琳娜二世通过政变登基成为俄罗斯女皇，在其统治下，俄罗斯帝国版图扩张，文化繁荣，成为欧洲主要强国之一。
description.enUS: Catherine II ascended to the throne as Empress of Russia through a coup. Under her reign, the Russian Empire expanded its territory, experienced cultural flourishing, and became one of Europe's major powers.

title.zhCN: 哈格里夫斯发明珍妮纺纱机

description.zhCN: 英国织工詹姆斯·哈格里夫斯发明了珍妮纺纱机，这是一种能同时纺出多根纱线的纺纱机。它的出现极大地提高了纺纱效率，标志着工业革命在英国纺织业中的正式开端。
description.enUS: English weaver James Hargreaves invented the spinning jenny, a machine capable of spinning multiple threads at once. Its creation dramatically increased spinning efficiency and marked the official beginning of the Industrial Revolution in the British textile industry.

description.zhCN: 苏格兰工程师詹姆斯·瓦特在纽科门蒸汽机的基础上进行了革命性改良，大幅提高了蒸汽机的效率。瓦特的蒸汽机成为了工业革命的标志性技术，被广泛应用于纺织、采矿和交通等领域，彻底改变了生产和生活方式。
description.enUS: Scottish engineer James Watt made revolutionary improvements to the Newcomen steam engine, significantly increasing its efficiency. Watt's steam engine became the iconic technology of the Industrial Revolution, was widely used in textiles, mining, and transportation, and fundamentally changed production and lifestyles.

description.zhCN: 北美殖民地代表在费城召开第一届大陆会议，旨在协调对英国压迫性法律（《不可容忍法案》）的集体抵制。尽管会议没有要求独立，但它标志着殖民地团结一致的开始，为后来的独立战争奠定了基础。
description.enUS: Representatives from the North American colonies convened the First Continental Congress in Philadelphia to coordinate a collective boycott against Britain's oppressive laws (the Intolerable Acts). Although the meeting did not call for independence, it marked the beginning of colonial unity and laid the groundwork for the subsequent Revolutionary War.

title.enUS: Adam Smith's 'The Wealth of Nations' Is Published

description.zhCN: 苏格兰经济学家亚当·斯密的《国富论》出版。该书首次系统地阐述了自由市场和劳动分工的原理，被认为是现代经济学的奠基之作，对后世的经济政策和思想产生了深远影响。
description.enUS: Scottish economist Adam Smith's 'The Wealth of Nations' was published. The book systematically laid out the principles of the free market and the division of labor for the first time. It is considered the foundational work of modern economics and had a profound impact on subsequent economic policy and thought.

description.zhCN: 北美13个殖民地通过并签署了《独立宣言》，正式宣告脱离大英帝国而独立。这份文件阐述了天赋人权、自由和平等的理念，对后来的法国大革命和世界各地的独立运动产生了深远影响。
description.enUS: The 13 North American colonies adopted and signed the Declaration of Independence, formally declaring their separation from the British Empire. This document articulated the ideals of natural rights, liberty, and equality, and profoundly influenced the subsequent French Revolution and independence movements worldwide.

title.zhCN: 康德出版《纯粹理性批判》

description.zhCN: 德国哲学家伊曼努尔·康德出版了《纯粹理性批判》。该书试图调和经验主义与理性主义的矛盾，奠定了现代认识论的基础，并开启了德国古典哲学的时代。康德的思想被认为是启蒙运动的集大成者，对后世哲学产生了深远影响。
description.enUS: German philosopher Immanuel Kant published 'Critique of Pure Reason.' The book sought to reconcile the contradictions between empiricism and rationalism, laying the foundation for modern epistemology and ushering in the era of German classical philosophy. Kant's ideas are considered the culmination of the Enlightenment and had a profound impact on subsequent philosophy.

description.zhCN: 美国与英国在巴黎签署《巴黎条约》，正式结束了美国独立战争。英国承认美国独立，并将密西西比河以东的大片土地割让给美国，确立了美国的国界。
description.enUS: The United States and Great Britain signed the Treaty of Paris, officially ending the American Revolutionary War. Britain recognized U.S. independence and ceded vast territories east of the Mississippi River to the United States, establishing the nation's borders.

description.zhCN: 在费城制宪会议上，《美国宪法》被签署。这份宪法建立了三权分立的联邦制共和政体，并为美国的政治制度奠定了基石。它被认为是人类历史上最古老的成文宪法之一。
description.enUS: The U.S. Constitution was signed at the Constitutional Convention in Philadelphia. This document established a federal republic with a system of checks and balances and laid the foundation for the American political system. It is considered one of the oldest written constitutions in the world.

title.zhCN: 乔治·华盛顿就任美国首任总统
title.enUS: George Washington Inaugurated as First U.S. President

description.zhCN: 乔治·华盛顿在纽约宣誓就职，成为美国首任总统。他的就职标志着美国新宪法体制的正式运行，为美国政府的未来运作树立了先例。
description.enUS: George Washington was sworn in as the first President of the United States in New York City. His inauguration marked the official beginning of the new constitutional system and set precedents for the future operation of the U.S. government.

description.zhCN: 巴士底狱被攻陷，标志着法国大革命的爆发。这场革命推翻了波旁王朝的专制统治，传播了自由、平等、博爱的思想，对欧洲乃至全世界产生了深远影响。
