description.enUS: The storming of the Bastille marked the outbreak of the French Revolution. This revolution overthrew the absolute monarchy of the Bourbon dynasty, propagated ideas of liberty, equality, and fraternity, and had a profound impact on Europe and the world.

description.zhCN: 法国国王路易十六在法国大革命期间被处决，标志着法国君主制的彻底终结和共和国的建立，将革命推向高潮。
description.enUS: King Louis XVI of France was executed during the French Revolution, marking the definitive end of the French monarchy and the establishment of the Republic, bringing the revolution to its climax.

description.zhCN: 英国马戛尔尼勋爵率使团访华，企图打开中国市场，乾隆帝拒绝其要求，体现了清朝对外交往的保守和对世界形势的判断失误。
description.enUS: Lord Macartney led a British embassy to China, attempting to open the Chinese market. Emperor Qianlong rejected their demands, reflecting the Qing Dynasty's conservative foreign policy and misjudgment of the global situation.

description.zhCN: 拿破仑·波拿巴率领法国军队入侵埃及，击败了马穆鲁克势力，暂时控制了埃及，标志着西方殖民主义对中东地区直接干预的开始，也带来了启蒙思想和现代科学技术。
description.enUS: Napoleon Bonaparte led French forces to invade Egypt, defeating Mamluk forces and temporarily controlling the country. This marked the beginning of direct Western colonial intervention in the Middle East, while also introducing Enlightenment ideas and modern scientific technology.

description.zhCN: 美国从法国手中购买了路易斯安那地区，使美国领土面积扩大了一倍以上。此次交易不仅确保了美国对密西西比河的控制，也为向西扩张奠定了基础。
description.enUS: The United States purchased the Louisiana Territory from France, more than doubling the nation's size. This transaction not only secured U.S. control over the Mississippi River but also laid the foundation for westward expansion.

title.zhCN: 拿破仑加冕法兰西皇帝
title.enUS: Napoleon Crowns Himself Emperor of the French

description.zhCN: 拿破仑·波拿巴在巴黎圣母院加冕为法国皇帝，标志着法兰西第一帝国的建立，并象征着法国大革命高潮的结束和拿破仑时代的开启。
description.enUS: Napoleon Bonaparte crowned himself Emperor of the French at Notre Dame Cathedral in Paris, marking the establishment of the First French Empire and symbolizing the end of the French Revolution's climax and the beginning of the Napoleonic era.

title.zhCN: 穆罕默德·阿里在埃及掌权
title.enUS: Muhammad Ali Takes Power in Egypt

description.zhCN: 奥斯曼帝国驻埃及总督穆罕默德·阿里帕夏逐步巩固权力，成为埃及的实际统治者。他推行了一系列现代化改革，使埃及成为地区强国，并在名义上仍属于奥斯曼帝国的情况下建立了半独立的王朝。
description.enUS: Muhammad Ali Pasha, the Ottoman governor of Egypt, gradually consolidated power to become the de facto ruler of Egypt. He implemented a series of modernization reforms that transformed Egypt into a regional power, establishing a semi-independent dynasty while nominally remaining part of the Ottoman Empire.

title.zhCN: 黑格尔出版《精神现象学》

description.zhCN: 德国哲学家黑格尔的哲学巨著《精神现象学》出版。这部作品被视为德国古典哲学的顶峰，它通过对意识、自我意识、理性和精神的辩证发展过程进行描述，为后来的唯心主义、马克思主义和存在主义等哲学流派奠定了基础。
description.enUS: German philosopher G.W.F. Hegel's monumental work 'Phenomenology of Spirit' was published. Considered the pinnacle of German classical philosophy, it describes the dialectical development of consciousness, self-consciousness, reason, and spirit, laying the foundation for later philosophical schools such as Idealism, Marxism, and Existentialism.

description.zhCN: 拿破仑·波拿巴在滑铁卢战役中被威灵顿公爵率领的英普联军彻底击败，标志着拿破仑战争的最终结束和拿破仑政治生涯的终结。
description.enUS: Napoleon Bonaparte was decisively defeated by the Anglo-Prussian allied forces led by the Duke of Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo, marking the final end of the Napoleonic Wars and the conclusion of Napoleon's political career.

description.zhCN: 俄罗斯沙皇亚历山大一世、奥地利皇帝弗朗茨一世和普鲁士国王腓特烈·威廉三世在巴黎签署协议，旨在维护欧洲的君主制和基督教价值观，并镇压任何革命运动。
description.enUS: Tsar Alexander I of Russia, Emperor Francis I of Austria, and King Frederick William III of Prussia signed an agreement in Paris, aiming to uphold monarchical rule and Christian values in Europe and suppress any revolutionary movements.

description.zhCN: 门罗总统在国情咨文中提出，欧洲列强不应再在美洲建立新的殖民地，也不应干涉美洲国家的事务。这一原则奠定了美国在西半球的领导地位，并成为其外交政策的长期基石。
description.enUS: President Monroe, in his State of the Union address, stated that European powers should not establish new colonies in the Americas or interfere in the affairs of American nations. This principle established the U.S. leadership role in the Western Hemisphere and became a long-standing cornerstone of its foreign policy.

description.zhCN: 法国入侵阿尔及利亚，推翻了奥斯曼帝国在当地的统治，开始了对阿尔及利亚长达132年的殖民统治，标志着欧洲列强对北非伊斯兰世界大规模殖民的开始。
description.enUS: France invaded Algeria, overthrowing Ottoman rule in the region and beginning 132 years of colonial rule over Algeria. This marked the start of large-scale European colonialization of the Islamic world in North Africa.

description.zhCN: 法国民众推翻了波旁王朝复辟的查理十世，建立了七月王朝，标志着自由主义在法国的胜利和欧洲19世纪一系列革命浪潮的开端。
description.enUS: The French populace overthrew Charles X, the restored Bourbon monarch, and established the July Monarchy. This marked a victory for liberalism in France and the beginning of a series of revolutionary waves across Europe in the 19th century.

title.zhCN: 法拉第发现电磁感应现象

description.zhCN: 英国科学家迈克尔·法拉第发现了电磁感应现象，即磁场的变化可以产生电流。这一发现为发电机、电动机和变压器的发明提供了理论基础，彻底改变了人类利用电能的方式，是第二次工业革命的开端。
description.enUS: British scientist Michael Faraday discovered electromagnetic induction, the principle that a changing magnetic field can produce an electric current. This discovery provided the theoretical basis for the invention of generators, electric motors, and transformers, fundamentally changing how humanity harnessed electrical energy and marking the beginning of the Second Industrial Revolution.

description.zhCN: 前大阪町奉行所与力大盐平八郎为救济贫困民众，在大阪发动武装起义，但很快被幕府镇压。这次起义暴露了江户幕府统治的腐败和无能，成为幕府末期社会动荡的标志性事件。
description.enUS: Ōshio Heihachirō, a former yoriki (police officer) of the Osaka magistrate's office, launched an armed rebellion in Osaka to aid the impoverished populace. The rebellion was quickly suppressed by the shogunate. It exposed the corruption and ineffectiveness of the shogunate's rule and became a landmark event of social unrest in the late Edo period.

description.zhCN: 法国画家路易·达盖尔公布了他发明的“达盖尔摄影法”，这是世界上第一个成功的摄影术。这项发明使得人们能够以更真实的方式记录瞬间，对艺术、科学和新闻传播产生了革命性影响，开启了视觉文化的新纪元。
description.enUS: French painter Louis Daguerre announced his invention of the 'Daguerreotype,' the world's first successful photographic process. This invention allowed people to record moments more realistically, having a revolutionary impact on art, science, and journalism, and ushering in a new era of visual culture.

description.zhCN: 钦差大臣林则徐在广东虎门集中销毁鸦片，显示了中国禁烟的决心，但也成为英国发动鸦片战争的导火索。
description.enUS: Imperial Commissioner Lin Zexu publicly destroyed opium at Humen, Guangdong, demonstrating China's determination to ban opium but also becoming the fuse for Britain to launch the Opium War.

title.zhCN: 奥斯曼帝国“坦志麦特”改革开始

description.zhCN: 奥斯曼帝国启动一系列广泛的改革，旨在实现现代化和中央集权，以应对内外交困的局面，包括军事、行政、教育和法律领域的改革。
description.enUS: The Ottoman Empire launched a series of extensive reforms, known as the 'Tanzimat,' aimed at modernization and centralization to address internal and external challenges. These reforms covered military, administrative, educational, and legal spheres.

description.zhCN: 英国为维护鸦片贸易和打开中国市场，对华发动战争，清朝战败，被迫签订不平等条约，中国近代史开端。
description.enUS: Britain launched a war against China to protect its opium trade and open the Chinese market. The Qing Dynasty was defeated and forced to sign unequal treaties, marking the beginning of modern Chinese history.

description.zhCN: 清朝在鸦片战争战败后，与英国签订中国近代史上第一个不平等条约，割让香港岛，开放通商口岸，严重损害中国主权。
description.enUS: After being defeated in the Opium War, the Qing Dynasty signed the Treaty of Nanking with Britain, the first unequal treaty in modern Chinese history. It ceded Hong Kong Island and opened treaty ports, severely undermining China's sovereignty.

description.zhCN: 美国于1845年将曾属于墨西哥的德克萨斯共和国并入联邦，加之两国在边境划分上存在争议，导致墨西哥与美国军队在里奥格兰德河附近发生冲突。随后，美国总统詹姆斯·波尔克以此为借口向墨西哥宣战，标志着美墨战争的正式爆发。
description.enUS: After the U.S. annexed the Republic of Texas, which was formerly part of Mexico, in 1845, a border dispute arose between the two nations. When Mexican forces clashed with U.S. troops near the Rio Grande, U.S. President James K. Polk used the incident as a pretext to declare war on Mexico, marking the official start of the Mexican-American War.

title.zhCN: 《瓜达卢佩·伊达尔戈条约》签署

description.zhCN: 美国与墨西哥签署《瓜达卢佩·伊达尔戈条约》，正式结束了美墨战争。墨西哥将包括加利福尼亚、内华达、犹他、亚利桑那等在内的一半以上领土割让给美国，极大地拓展了美国的西部边疆。
description.enUS: The United States and Mexico signed the Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo, officially ending the Mexican-American War. Mexico ceded more than half of its territory, including what would become California, Nevada, Utah, and Arizona, to the U.S., which dramatically expanded America's western frontier.

title.zhCN: 欧洲1848年革命（“民族之春”）爆发
title.enUS: Revolutions of 1848 (Spring of Nations) Erupt in Europe

description.zhCN: 一系列革命浪潮席卷欧洲，旨在推翻保守君主制，争取民族独立、自由主义和民主权利，尽管多数革命最终失败，但对欧洲政治和社会产生了深远影响。
description.enUS: A series of revolutionary waves swept across Europe, aiming to overthrow conservative monarchies and fight for national independence, liberalism, and democratic rights. Although most of these revolutions ultimately failed, they had a profound impact on European politics and society.

description.zhCN: 洪秀全在广西金田村发动大规模农民起义，建立太平天国，严重冲击清朝统治，历时十四年，是世界历史上规模最大的农民战争之一。
description.enUS: Hong Xiuquan launched a large-scale peasant uprising in Jintian Village, Guangxi, establishing the Taiping Heavenly Kingdom. It severely impacted Qing rule, lasting fourteen years, and was one of the largest peasant wars in world history.

description.zhCN: 美国海军准将马休·佩里率领“黑船”舰队驶入浦贺港，要求日本开国。这一事件打破了日本长达200多年的锁国体制，迫使日本与西方国家签订不平等条约，加速了幕府的衰落和日本近代化的进程。
description.enUS: U.S. Commodore Matthew C. Perry sailed his 'Black Ships' fleet into Uraga Harbor, demanding that Japan open its ports. This event broke Japan's 200-year-long national seclusion policy, forced Japan to sign unequal treaties with Western powers, and accelerated the decline of the shogunate and the process of Japan's modernization.

description.zhCN: 奥斯曼帝国、英国、法国和撒丁王国联手对抗俄罗斯帝国，主要战场在克里米亚半岛，这场战争削弱了奥斯曼帝国，但也使其获得了西方盟友的有限支持。
description.enUS: The Ottoman Empire, Great Britain, France, and the Kingdom of Sardinia allied against the Russian Empire. The main battlefield was the Crimean Peninsula. While the war weakened the Ottoman Empire, it also secured limited support from its Western allies.

description.zhCN: 英法联军为进一步扩大侵略权益，联合发动战争，攻陷广州、天津，火烧圆明园，清政府再签不平等条约。
description.enUS: Anglo-French forces jointly launched a war to further expand their colonial interests, capturing Guangzhou and Tianjin, burning the Old Summer Palace, and forcing the Qing government to sign more unequal treaties.

title.enUS: Darwin's 'On the Origin of Species' Is Published

description.zhCN: 英国博物学家查尔斯·达尔文出版了《物种起源》，提出了以自然选择为核心的进化论。这一理论彻底改变了人类对生物起源和自身地位的认识，引发了巨大的科学和宗教争议，是现代生物学的基础。
description.enUS: British naturalist Charles Darwin published 'On the Origin of Species,' in which he proposed the theory of evolution by natural selection. The theory fundamentally changed humanity's understanding of the origin of life and its place in the world, sparking immense scientific and religious controversy, and forming the foundation of modern biology.

description.zhCN: 井伊直弼，德川幕府的大老，因推行开国政策和镇压尊王攘夷派而遭到水户藩浪士的刺杀。这一事件动摇了幕府的统治基础，激化了倒幕派和幕府之间的矛盾。
description.enUS: Ii Naosuke, the great elder of the Tokugawa shogunate, was assassinated by rōnin (masterless samurai) from the Mito Domain due to his pro-opening policies and suppression of the sonnō jōi (Revere the Emperor, Expel the Barbarians) faction. This incident shook the foundation of the shogunate's rule and intensified the conflict between anti-shogunate forces and the shogunate.

description.zhCN: 第二次鸦片战争后，清政府与英、法、俄等国签订《北京条约》，进一步加深了中国半殖民地化程度。
description.enUS: After the Second Opium War, the Qing government signed the Treaty of Beijing with Britain, France, Russia, and other countries, further deepening China's semi-colonial status.

description.zhCN: 清政府为处理外交事务而设立总理衙门，标志着清朝中央政府机构的变动，也是洋务运动的开端之一。
description.enUS: The Qing government established the Zongli Yamen to handle foreign affairs. This marked a change in the central government structure and was one of the starting points of the Self-Strengthening Movement.

description.zhCN: 撒丁王国国王维托里奥·埃马努埃莱二世被宣布为意大利国王，标志着意大利在加富尔和加里波第等人的努力下，经过长期分裂后实现统一。
description.enUS: Victor Emmanuel II, King of Sardinia, was proclaimed King of Italy, marking Italy's unification after a long period of fragmentation, largely due to the efforts of figures like Cavour and Garibaldi.

description.zhCN: 邦联军袭击了南卡罗来纳州的萨姆特堡，标志着美国内战的爆发。这场战争是美国历史上规模最大、伤亡最惨重的冲突，主要围绕联邦的存续和奴隶制的存废问题。
description.enUS: Confederate forces attacked Fort Sumter in South Carolina, marking the outbreak of the American Civil War. The war was the largest and deadliest conflict in U.S. history, fought primarily over the issues of federal unity and the abolition of slavery.

description.zhCN: 慈禧太后与恭亲王奕訢发动政变，铲除以肃顺为首的顾命八大臣，开启了慈禧太后长达半个世纪的统治。
description.enUS: Empress Dowager Cixi and Prince Gong Yixin launched a coup, eliminating the eight regents led by Sushun, thus beginning Empress Dowager Cixi's half-century long rule.

description.zhCN: 清政府设立中国近代第一所官办外语学校京师同文馆，旨在培养外语和外交人才，是洋务运动的重要举措之一。
description.enUS: The Qing government established the Tongwen Guan, China's first official foreign language school, to train foreign language and diplomatic personnel. This was a key initiative of the Self-Strengthening Movement.

description.zhCN: 亚伯拉罕·林肯总统颁布的《解放奴隶宣言》正式生效，宣布美国南部邦联各州所有奴隶即日起获得自由。该宣言将战争目标从单纯的联邦统一扩大到解放奴隶，对战局产生了重要影响。
description.enUS: President Abraham Lincoln's Emancipation Proclamation officially took effect, declaring that all enslaved people in the Confederate states were to be set free. The proclamation expanded the war's objectives from simply preserving the Union to include the abolition of slavery, significantly influencing the course of the war.

title.zhCN: 江南机器制造总局成立

description.zhCN: 李鸿章在上海创办江南机器制造总局，是中国近代最早、规模最大的军工企业，也是洋务运动中最重要的军事工业之一。
description.enUS: Li Hongzhang founded the Jiangnan Arsenal in Shanghai. It was China's earliest and largest military industrial enterprise, and a significant part of the Self-Strengthening Movement's military industry.

title.enUS: End of Civil War and Confederate Surrender

description.zhCN: 罗伯特·李将军率领的北弗吉尼亚军团在阿波马托克斯法院向尤利西斯·格兰特将军投降，标志着美国内战的实际结束，联邦得以保存并废除了奴隶制。
description.enUS: General Robert E. Lee's Army of Northern Virginia surrendered to General Ulysses S. Grant at Appomattox Court House, marking the effective end of the American Civil War. The Union was preserved, and slavery was abolished.

title.zhCN: 第十三条宪法修正案通过
title.enUS: Thirteenth Amendment to the Constitution Ratified

description.zhCN: 美国国会通过并批准了第十三条宪法修正案，正式在美国全境废除奴隶制。这是美国历史上最重要的民权立法之一，但南方种族隔离制度的形成仍面临挑战。
description.enUS: The Thirteenth Amendment to the U.S. Constitution was passed and ratified, formally abolishing slavery throughout the United States. This was one of the most important pieces of civil rights legislation in U.S. history, although the formation of racial segregation in the South still presented a challenge.

description.zhCN: 美国以720万美元的价格从俄罗斯帝国手中购买了阿拉斯加。当时这一交易被嘲笑为“西华德的蠢事”，但后来发现阿拉斯加拥有丰富的自然资源，成为美国重要的战略资产。
description.enUS: The United States purchased Alaska from the Russian Empire for $7.2 million. The deal was initially mocked as 'Seward's Folly,' but Alaska was later found to have rich natural resources, becoming an important strategic asset for the U.S.

description.zhCN: 在讨幕派武士的推动下，明治天皇发布“王政复古”大号令，废除了幕府，恢复了天皇的权威。这标志着明治维新的正式开始，日本进入了全面向西方学习和现代化的新时代。
description.enUS: Driven by anti-shogunate samurai, Emperor Meiji issued the 'Restoration of Imperial Rule' proclamation, abolishing the shogunate and restoring the authority of the emperor. This marked the official beginning of the Meiji Restoration, ushering in a new era of wholesale Westernization and modernization for Japan.

title.zhCN: 门捷列夫提出元素周期表
title.enUS: Mendeleev Proposes the Periodic Table of Elements

description.zhCN: 俄国化学家德米特里·门捷列夫发表了他的元素周期表。他根据元素的原子量和化学性质排列了已知的元素，并预言了当时尚未发现的元素的存在。这个表格为化学科学提供了一个统一的框架，是化学史上的里程碑。
description.enUS: Russian chemist Dmitri Mendeleev published his periodic table of elements. He arranged known elements according to their atomic weight and chemical properties, and predicted the existence of elements that had not yet been discovered. The table provided a unifying framework for the science of chemistry and was a milestone in its history.

title.zhCN: 第一条横贯大陆铁路完工

description.zhCN: 联合太平洋铁路公司和中央太平洋铁路公司在犹他州的普罗蒙特里角接轨，标志着第一条横贯大陆铁路的完工。这条铁路极大地促进了美国西部的开发和经济整合，加速了工业化进程。
description.enUS: The Union Pacific and Central Pacific railroads met at Promontory Point, Utah, marking the completion of the first transcontinental railroad. This railroad greatly facilitated the development and economic integration of the American West, accelerating the process of industrialization.

description.zhCN: 连接地中海和红海的苏伊士运河正式开通，极大缩短了欧洲到亚洲的航程，对全球贸易和殖民地战略格局产生深远影响，也增加了欧洲列强对埃及的控制欲望。
description.enUS: The Suez Canal, connecting the Mediterranean Sea and the Red Sea, officially opened. It drastically shortened voyages from Europe to Asia, profoundly impacting global trade and colonial strategic layouts, and increasing European powers' desire for control over Egypt.

description.zhCN: 普鲁士在普法战争中击败法国后，德意志各邦国在凡尔赛宫宣布成立德意志帝国，威廉一世加冕为皇帝，标志着德国在俾斯麦的领导下完成统一，成为欧洲新的强大力量。
description.enUS: After Prussia defeated France in the Franco-Prussian War, the German states proclaimed the establishment of the German Empire at the Palace of Versailles, with Wilhelm I crowned as Emperor. This marked Germany's unification under Bismarck's leadership and its emergence as a new major power in Europe.

description.zhCN: 在普法战争失败后，巴黎工人和平民发动起义，建立了巴黎公社。尽管仅存在了两个多月，但它是历史上第一个由工人阶级建立的政权，对后来的共产主义运动产生了深远影响。
description.enUS: Following the defeat in the Franco-Prussian War, workers and common people in Paris revolted and established the Paris Commune. Although it lasted for only a little over two months, it was the first government in history to be established by the working class and had a profound impact on subsequent communist movements.

title.enUS: Abolition of Han System and Establishment of Prefectures

description.zhCN: 明治政府宣布废除旧有的封建藩国，取而代之的是由中央政府直接管理的府县。这项改革彻底消除了地方割据势力，实现了国家的统一和中央集权，为后续的现代化改革铺平了道路。
description.enUS: The Meiji government announced the abolition of the old feudal domains (han) and replaced them with prefectures directly controlled by the central government. This reform completely eliminated regional feudal powers, achieved national unity and centralization, and paved the way for subsequent modernization efforts.

title.zhCN: 中国第一批留美幼童派出
title.enUS: First Group of Chinese Students Sent to the U.S.

description.zhCN: 清政府选派幼童赴美留学，是近代中国官方组织的首次大规模留学活动，对后世产生了深远影响。
description.enUS: The Qing government sent young students to study in the U.S. This was the first large-scale government-sponsored study abroad program in modern China, and it had a profound impact on later generations.

description.zhCN: 明治政府颁布《学制》，确立了近代的学校教育制度，规定不分身份、性别，人人都有受教育的权利和义务。这标志着日本义务教育的开始，为社会培养了大量人才。
description.enUS: The Meiji government promulgated the Education System, establishing a modern school education system that stipulated the right and obligation for everyone to receive education, regardless of status or gender. This marked the beginning of compulsory education in Japan and trained a large number of talents for society.

description.zhCN: 由英国商人美查在上海创办的《申报》正式发行，它是中国近代史上影响力最大、发行时间最长的报纸之一。
description.enUS: Shun Pao, founded by British businessman Ernest Major in Shanghai, was officially launched. It became one of the most influential and longest-running newspapers in modern Chinese history.

description.zhCN: 明治政府颁布《征兵令》，规定所有年满20岁的男子都有服兵役的义务。这项制度取代了旧有的武士募兵制，确立了以国民皆兵为基础的近代常备军，是军事改革的核心举措。
description.enUS: The Meiji government issued the Conscription Law, which stipulated that all men over the age of 20 had the obligation to perform military service. This system replaced the old samurai recruitment system and established a modern standing army based on universal conscription, which was a core measure of military reform.

description.zhCN: 明治政府开始进行地税改革，将旧有的以稻米实物缴纳改为以土地价格为基础的现金缴纳。这项改革确保了政府的稳定财政收入，并为工业化提供了资本积累。
description.enUS: The Meiji government began land tax reform, changing the old system of paying taxes with rice to a cash payment system based on land prices. This reform ensured stable government revenue and provided capital accumulation for industrialization.

title.enUS: Guo Songtao's Diplomatic Mission to Britain

description.zhCN: 清政府任命郭嵩焘为首任驻英公使，是中国历史上首次向西方国家派出常驻外交使节，标志着清朝外交制度的转变。
description.enUS: The Qing government appointed Guo Songtao as the first resident minister to Britain. This was the first time in Chinese history that a permanent diplomatic envoy was sent to a Western country, marking a shift in the Qing dynasty's diplomatic system.

title.zhCN: 贝尔首次实现电话通话
title.enUS: Bell Makes the First Telephone Call

description.zhCN: "亚历山大·格拉汉姆·贝尔在实验室中首次成功地通过电话向助手发出了清晰的语音，这项发明彻底改变了远距离沟通的方式。
description.enUS: Alexander Graham Bell successfully made the first clear voice call to his assistant in a laboratory. This invention completely changed the way people communicated over long distances.

description.zhCN: 英国以镇压乌拉比帕夏领导的民族主义叛乱为由，军事占领了埃及，并逐步控制了埃及的经济和政治，尽管名义上仍属于奥斯曼帝国，但实际上成为英国的保护国。
description.enUS: Britain militarily occupied Egypt, citing the suppression of the nationalist Urabi Pasha rebellion. Britain gradually gained control of Egypt's economy and politics, effectively making it a British protectorate despite its nominal allegiance to the Ottoman Empire.

description.zhCN: 法国为侵略越南并扩大在华权益，与清朝爆发战争，虽有镇南关大捷，但清政府最终仍被迫签订不平等条约。
description.enUS: France launched a war against the Qing Dynasty to invade Vietnam and expand its interests in China. Despite a major victory at Zhennanguan, the Qing government was ultimately forced to sign an unequal treaty.

description.zhCN: 日本正式废除太政官制，建立内阁制度，由伊藤博文担任首任内阁总理大臣。这标志着日本政治体制从封建官僚体系向近代官僚体系的过渡，完善了中央集权。
description.enUS: Japan officially abolished the Daijō-kan system and established the cabinet system, with Itō Hirobumi serving as the first Prime Minister. This marked the transition of Japan's political system from a feudal bureaucracy to a modern one, completing the centralization of power.

description.zhCN: 在塞缪尔·冈珀斯的领导下，美国劳工联合会成立。这是一个由行业工会组成的联合体，旨在通过集体谈判和罢工等方式争取更好的工资和工作条件，成为美国劳工运动的重要组织。
description.enUS: Under the leadership of Samuel Gompers, the American Federation of Labor (AFL) was founded. It was a federation of trade unions that aimed to secure better wages and working conditions through collective bargaining and strikes, becoming a major organization in the American labor movement.

title.enUS: Establishment of the Tokyo School of Fine Arts

description.zhCN: 明治政府在东京创立了日本首个国立美术教育机构，旨在学习西方美术技法、振兴传统日本艺术。学校的建立标志着日本近代美术教育体系的形成。
description.enUS: The Meiji government established the first national art education institution in Tokyo, aiming to learn Western art techniques and revitalize traditional Japanese art. Its establishment marked the formation of Japan's modern fine art education system.

description.zhCN: 荷兰后印象派画家文森特·凡·高在法国阿尔勒创作了著名的《向日葵》系列。这些作品以其强烈的色彩和充满情感的笔触，成为凡·高最具代表性的作品，对20世纪的现代艺术产生了深远影响。
description.enUS: Dutch post-impressionist painter Vincent van Gogh created his famous 'Sunflowers' series in Arles, France. With their intense colors and emotional brushwork, these works became some of Van Gogh's most representative pieces and had a profound impact on 20th-century modern art.

title.enUS: Hertz Proves the Existence of Electromagnetic Waves

description.zhCN: 德国物理学家海因里希·赫兹通过实验证实了电磁波的存在，验证了詹姆斯·克拉克·麦克斯韦的电磁理论。这项发现为后来的无线电、电视和手机等无线通信技术的发展奠定了基础。
description.enUS: German physicist Heinrich Hertz experimentally proved the existence of electromagnetic waves, confirming James Clerk Maxwell's theory of electromagnetism. This discovery laid the foundation for the later development of wireless communication technologies such as radio, television, and mobile phones.

description.zhCN: 清政府建立近代化的海军北洋水师，曾是亚洲第一、世界第九的海军舰队，但在甲午战争中全军覆没。
description.enUS: The Qing government established the modern Beiyang Fleet, which was once the largest in Asia and ninth in the world. However, it was completely destroyed during the First Sino-Japanese War.

title.zhCN: 中国首条自建铁路通车

description.zhCN: 清政府主导修建的唐胥铁路向西延长至天津，并更名为津沽铁路，是中国历史上首条由国人自建并运营的铁路。
description.enUS: The Tangxu Railway, built under the Qing government's direction, was extended west to Tianjin and renamed the Jingu Railway. It was the first railway in Chinese history to be self-built and operated by Chinese people.

title.enUS: Promulgation of the Constitution of the Empire of Japan

description.zhCN: 日本颁布了首部现代宪法，确立了天皇神圣不可侵犯的地位和君主立宪政体。虽然宪法赋予了议会权力，但仍将最高权力集中于天皇，为军国主义的崛起埋下了伏笔。
description.enUS: Japan promulgated its first modern constitution, establishing the Emperor's sacred and inviolable status and a constitutional monarchy. Although the constitution granted power to the parliament, supreme authority remained with the Emperor, laying the groundwork for the rise of militarism.

title.zhCN: 北里柴三郎发现鼠疫杆菌
title.enUS: Shibasaburo Kitasato Discovers the Plague Bacillus

description.zhCN: 日本细菌学家北里柴三郎在香港爆发鼠疫时，成功分离并确认了鼠疫杆菌。这一发现对于鼠疫的诊断、治疗和预防具有重要意义，为人类对抗传染病提供了关键线索。
description.enUS: Japanese bacteriologist Shibasaburo Kitasato successfully isolated and identified the plague bacillus during a plague outbreak in Hong Kong. This discovery was of great significance for the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of plague, providing a crucial clue for humanity's fight against infectious diseases.

description.zhCN: 日本为争夺朝鲜半岛的控制权和进一步侵略中国，对清朝发动战争，清朝战败，北洋水师全军覆没，影响深远。
description.enUS: Japan launched a war against the Qing Dynasty to gain control of the Korean Peninsula and further invade China. The Qing Dynasty was defeated, and the Beiyang Fleet was annihilated, with far-reaching consequences.

description.zhCN: 甲午战争失败后，清政府与日本签订《马关条约》，割让台湾、澎湖列岛等，赔款巨额，刺激列强瓜分中国。
description.enUS: After its defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War, the Qing government signed the Treaty of Shimonoseki with Japan, ceding Taiwan, the Penghu Islands, and paying a huge indemnity, stimulating the scramble for concessions among foreign powers in China.

description.zhCN: 由夏瑞芳等人在上海创办的商务印书馆正式成立，是中国近代史上最具规模和影响力的出版机构之一。
description.enUS: Commercial Press was formally established in Shanghai by Xia Ruifang and others. It became one of the largest and most influential publishing houses in modern Chinese history.

description.zhCN: 美国军舰“缅因号”在哈瓦那港爆炸沉没，美国以此为借口向西班牙宣战。这场短暂的战争以美国胜利告终，使其获得了古巴、波多黎各、关岛和菲律宾等殖民地，标志着美国开始崛起为世界强国。
description.enUS: The U.S. battleship USS Maine exploded and sank in Havana Harbor. The U.S. used this as a pretext to declare war on Spain. The brief war ended in an American victory, leading to the acquisition of colonies such as Cuba, Puerto Rico, Guam, and the Philippines, and marking America's rise as a world power.

description.zhCN: 康有为、梁启超等维新派在光绪帝支持下推行变法，旨在学习西方，实行君主立宪，但遭到慈禧太后为首的守旧派镇压而失败。
description.enUS: Kang Youwei, Liang Qichao, and other reformists, supported by Emperor Guangxu, pushed for reforms aimed at learning from the West and establishing a constitutional monarchy. However, they were suppressed by conservative forces led by Empress Dowager Cixi and ultimately failed.

title.zhCN: 八国联军侵华战争爆发
title.enUS: Eight-Nation Alliance Invasion of China Breaks Out

description.zhCN: 八个列强国家为镇压义和团运动和进一步侵略中国，联合派兵入侵，攻陷北京。
description.enUS: Eight imperialist powers, to suppress the Boxer Rebellion and further invade China, jointly dispatched troops to invade and capture Beijing.

description.zhCN: 八国联军侵华战争后，清政府与列强签订巨额赔款、划定使馆界、拆毁炮台等条款的不平等条约，中国完全沦为半殖民地半封建社会。
description.enUS: After the Eight-Nation Alliance invasion, the Qing government signed an unequal treaty with foreign powers, including massive indemnities, demarcation of legation quarters, and dismantling of forts, leading China to fully become a semi-colonial and semi-feudal society.

description.zhCN: 英国与日本在伦敦签订军事同盟。这一同盟是英国在远东政策的重大转变，使日本获得了对抗俄国的外交优势，也是日本首次与西方列强建立对等地位的同盟。
description.enUS: The United Kingdom and Japan signed a military alliance in London. This alliance was a major shift in British policy in the Far East, giving Japan a diplomatic advantage against Russia and being Japan's first alliance with a Western power on an equal footing.

title.zhCN: 莱特兄弟首次成功飞行
title.enUS: Wright Brothers Achieve First Successful Flight

description.zhCN: 奥维尔和威尔伯·莱特兄弟在北卡罗来纳州基蒂霍克进行了人类历史上首次有动力、可控和持续的飞行。这次成功奠定了现代航空技术的基础，彻底改变了交通和战争的未来。
description.enUS: Orville and Wilbur Wright made the first powered, controlled, and sustained flight in human history at Kitty Hawk, North Carolina. This success laid the foundation for modern aviation technology and completely changed the future of transportation and warfare.

description.zhCN: 日本与俄国为争夺在中国东北和朝鲜半岛的利益而爆发战争。日本的胜利震惊了世界，使其成为第一个击败欧洲列强的亚洲国家，进一步巩固了其在国际舞台上的地位。
description.enUS: Japan and Russia went to war over competing interests in Manchuria and the Korean Peninsula. Japan's victory shocked the world, making it the first Asian nation to defeat a major European power and further solidifying its status on the international stage.

title.zhCN: 爱因斯坦发表“奇迹年”论文

description.zhCN: 阿尔伯特·爱因斯坦在德国《物理学年鉴》上发表了四篇具有划时代意义的论文，涵盖了光电效应、布朗运动、狭义相对论和质能方程（E=mc²）。这些研究彻底改变了物理学的面貌，奠定了现代物理学的基础。
description.enUS: Albert Einstein published four groundbreaking papers in the German journal 'Annalen der Physik.' These papers covered the photoelectric effect, Brownian motion, the special theory of relativity, and the mass-energy equivalence formula (E=mc²). His research fundamentally changed the face of physics and laid the foundation for modern physics.

description.zhCN: 孙中山在日本东京成立中国同盟会，是近代中国第一个全国性的资产阶级革命政党，其纲领是“驱除鞑虏，恢复中华，创立民国，平均地权”。
description.enUS: Sun Yat-sen founded the Tongmenghui in Tokyo, Japan. It was the first nationwide bourgeois revolutionary party in modern China, with the program of 'Expelling the Manchu, restoring China, establishing a Republic, and equalizing land rights.'

title.zhCN: 池田菊苗发现谷氨酸钠

description.zhCN: 日本化学家池田菊苗从海带中提取出谷氨酸，并发现其特殊的鲜味，命名为“旨味”（umami）。随后，他成功制备出谷氨酸钠，并申请专利，开创了味精的工业化生产。
description.enUS: Japanese chemist Kikunae Ikeda extracted glutamic acid from kelp and discovered its unique savory taste, which he named 'umami.' He then successfully prepared monosodium glutamate (MSG) and patented it, pioneering the industrial production of MSG.

description.zhCN: 中国第一部无声电影《定军山》在北京大观楼戏院上映，由谭鑫培主演，标志着中国电影事业的开端。
description.enUS: China's first silent film, 'Dingjun Mountain,' starring Tan Xinpei, premiered at the Daguanlou Theater in Beijing, marking the beginning of China's film industry.

title.enUS: Qing Dynasty Abolishes Imperial Examination System

description.zhCN: 清政府废除了延续一千三百多年的科举制度，标志着中国传统选官制度的终结，对教育和社会产生深远影响。
description.enUS: The Qing government abolished the imperial examination system, which had lasted for over 1,300 years, marking the end of China's traditional official selection system and profoundly impacting education and society.

title.enUS: Natsume Sōseki's 'I Am a Cat' Is Published

description.zhCN: 日本作家夏目漱石的长篇小说《我是猫》出版，小说以猫的视角讽刺明治时代中产阶级的虚伪与自大。该作品被认为是日本近代文学的开端。
description.enUS: The novel 'I Am a Cat' by Japanese author Natsume Sōseki was published. It satirizes the hypocrisy and arrogance of the Meiji era middle class from the perspective of a cat. The work is considered the beginning of modern Japanese literature.

description.zhCN: 奥斯曼帝国的改革派官员和知识分子发动革命，迫使苏丹阿卜杜勒-哈米德二世恢复了1876年宪法，标志着奥斯曼帝国走向立宪制和世俗化，但未能阻止帝国的最终解体。
description.enUS: Reformist officials and intellectuals of the Ottoman Empire launched a revolution, forcing Sultan Abdul Hamid II to restore the 1876 constitution. This marked the Ottoman Empire's move toward constitutionalism and secularism, but ultimately failed to prevent its final dissolution.

description.zhCN: 福特汽车公司开始大规模生产T型车，首次在汽车制造中引入流水线生产模式，大幅降低了汽车成本，使汽车成为普通家庭的交通工具。
description.enUS: Ford Motor Company began mass-producing the Model T, introducing the assembly line to automotive manufacturing. This greatly reduced costs and made the car a vehicle for the average family.

title.zhCN: 武者小路实笃创办《白桦》杂志

description.zhCN: 作家武者小路实笃等人创办文学杂志《白桦》，提倡人道主义和理想主义，反对自然主义文学。白桦派作家的活动对日本大正时期的文学和艺术产生了重要影响。
description.enUS: The writer Mushakōji Saneatsu and others founded the literary magazine 'Shirakaba,' advocating for humanism and idealism in opposition to naturalistic literature. The activities of the Shirakaba school had a significant impact on Japanese literature and art during the Taishō period.

description.zhCN: 中国东北地区爆发鼠疫，造成大量人员死亡。清政府任命伍连德主持防疫工作，最终成功控制疫情。
description.enUS: A plague outbreak in Northeast China caused a large number of deaths. The Qing government appointed Wu Lien-teh to lead the prevention and control efforts, eventually containing the epidemic successfully.

description.zhCN: 革命党人在武昌发动起义，迅速取得成功，引发各省响应，成为辛亥革命的导火索，加速了清朝的灭亡。
description.enUS: Revolutionaries launched an uprising in Wuchang, achieving rapid success and triggering responses from various provinces. This ignited the Xinhai Revolution, accelerating the fall of the Qing Dynasty.

description.zhCN: 辛亥革命后，各省代表在南京集会，选举孙中山为中华民国临时大总统，宣告亚洲第一个共和国的诞生。
description.enUS: After the Xinhai Revolution, representatives from various provinces convened in Nanjing, electing Sun Yat-sen as the Provisional President of the Republic of China, proclaiming the birth of Asia's first republic.

description.zhCN: 清隆裕太后代表宣统帝溥仪颁布《退位诏书》，宣布清朝统治结束，接受共和政体。
description.enUS: Empress Dowager Longyu issued the Abdication Edict on behalf of Emperor Puyi, ending Qing rule and accepting a republican form of government.

title.zhCN: 孙中山辞职与袁世凯接任
title.enUS: Sun Yat-sen's Resignation and Yuan Shikai's Succession

description.zhCN: 孙中山履行承诺向南京临时参议院提交辞职咨文，正式辞去中华民国临时大总统职务，并举荐袁世凯继任。同时提出三项附加条件：临时政府须设于南京、新总统须到南京就职、新总统必须遵守《中华民国临时约法》。此举标志着辛亥革命的成果正式移交袁世凯，开启共和政权过渡阶段。
description.enUS: Sun Yat-sen submitted his resignation as Provisional President to the Nanjing Provisional Senate, recommending Yuan Shikai as his successor. He stipulated three conditions: the provisional government must be located in Nanjing, the new president must be inaugurated in Nanjing, and must abide by the Provisional Constitution. This marked the formal transfer of the fruits of the Xinhai Revolution to Yuan Shikai, initiating the transition of the republican regime.

description.zhCN: 当时世界上最大的豪华邮轮泰坦尼克号在首航时撞上冰山沉没，造成超过1500人遇难。这场灾难是和平时期最严重的海难之一，也暴露了当时社会阶级差异以及技术进步背后的盲目乐观。
description.enUS: The RMS Titanic, the largest luxury liner of its time, struck an iceberg on its maiden voyage and sank, resulting in the deaths of over 1,500 people. The disaster was one of the deadliest maritime catastrophes in peacetime, exposing social class disparities and the blind optimism that sometimes accompanied technological progress.

title.zhCN: 斯特拉文斯基《春之祭》首演

description.zhCN: 伊戈尔·斯特拉文斯基的芭蕾舞剧《春之祭》在巴黎香榭丽舍剧院首演，其激进的音乐和舞蹈引起了观众的巨大争议，甚至引发骚乱。该作品被认为是20世纪现代主义音乐的里程碑，对后来的音乐和艺术产生了深远影响。
description.enUS: Igor Stravinsky's ballet 'The Rite of Spring' premiered at the Théâtre des Champs-Élysées in Paris. Its radical music and choreography caused a major scandal and even a riot. The work is considered a milestone of 20th-century modernist music and had a profound impact on subsequent music and art.

description.zhCN: 国民党理事长宋教仁在上海火车站遇刺身亡，此案矛头直指袁世凯，直接导致了“二次革命”的爆发，加剧了民初政局动荡。
description.enUS: Song Jiaoren, the chairman of the Kuomintang, was assassinated at Shanghai railway station. The accusations directly pointed to Yuan Shikai, directly leading to the outbreak of the 'Second Revolution' and exacerbating the political instability in the early Republic.

description.zhCN: 美国国会通过《联邦储备法案》，成立了美联储。美联储作为美国的中央银行，旨在管理国家的货币供应、稳定金融系统，并对现代美国和世界经济产生了深远影响。
description.enUS: The U.S. Congress passed the Federal Reserve Act, establishing the Federal Reserve System. As the central bank of the U.S., the Fed's purpose was to manage the nation's money supply and stabilize the financial system, having a profound impact on the modern American and world economies.

description.zhCN: 奥匈帝国向塞尔维亚宣战，引发了欧洲列强之间的军事联盟连锁反应，导致第一次世界大战爆发，这场战争造成了空前的人员伤亡和财产损失，从根本上改变了欧洲的政治格局。
description.enUS: Austria-Hungary declared war on Serbia, triggering a chain reaction of military alliances among European powers and leading to the outbreak of World War I. This war resulted in unprecedented casualties and destruction, fundamentally altering Europe's political landscape.

description.zhCN: 连接大西洋和太平洋的巴拿马运河正式开通。这条运河的开通极大缩短了国际航程，对全球贸易和美国在世界上的战略地位产生了深远影响。
description.enUS: The Panama Canal, connecting the Atlantic and Pacific oceans, officially opened. The canal's opening significantly shortened international shipping routes and had a profound impact on global trade and the strategic position of the United States in the world.

title.zhCN: 奥斯曼帝国加入第一次世界大战
title.enUS: Ottoman Empire Enters World War I

description.zhCN: 奥斯曼帝国与德意志帝国结盟，加入了第一次世界大战。战争期间，帝国经历了严重的军事挫折和内部动荡，最终导致其战败和解体。
description.enUS: The Ottoman Empire allied with the German Empire and entered World War I. During the war, the empire suffered severe military setbacks and internal turmoil, ultimately leading to its defeat and dissolution.

title.enUS: Rise of the New Culture Movement

description.zhCN: 以《新青年》杂志为主要阵地，以陈独秀、胡适、鲁迅等为代表，主张民主与科学，对中国思想文化产生了深远影响。
description.enUS: With the magazine 'New Youth' as its main platform, led by figures like Chen Duxiu, Hu Shi, and Lu Xun, the movement advocated for democracy and science, profoundly influencing Chinese thought and culture.

description.zhCN: 日本向袁世凯政府提出旨在灭亡中国的“二十一条”要求，袁世凯大部分接受，严重损害中国主权，引发全国愤慨。
description.enUS: Japan presented Yuan Shikai's government with the 'Twenty-One Demands' aimed at subjugating China. Yuan Shikai accepted most of them, severely undermining China's sovereignty and provoking national outrage.

description.zhCN: 袁世凯在各方支持下宣布称帝，改国号为中华帝国，引起全国范围的“护国运动”，最终在巨大压力下取消帝制。
description.enUS: With support from various factions, Yuan Shikai declared himself emperor, changing the country's name to the Chinese Empire. This sparked the 'National Protection Movement' nationwide, and he eventually abolished the monarchy under immense pressure.

title.zhCN: 袁世凯去世，北洋军阀混战开始
title.enUS: Yuan Shikai Dies, Beginning of Warlord Era

description.zhCN: 袁世凯病逝，其死后，北洋军阀失去统一领袖，各派系之间为争夺地盘和权力而陷入长期混战，国家陷入分裂割据。
description.enUS: Yuan Shikai died of illness. After his death, the Beiyang warlords lost their unifying leader, and various factions plunged into long-term conflicts over territory and power, leading the country into division and fragmentation.

title.enUS: The Battle of the Somme Begins

description.zhCN: 第一次世界大战期间，英法联军在法国索姆河地区对德军发起大规模进攻。这场战役持续数月，造成超过一百万士兵伤亡，是人类历史上最血腥的战役之一，也成为堑壕战残酷性的象征。
description.enUS: During World War I, British and French forces launched a massive offensive against German troops in the Somme region of France. The battle lasted for months and resulted in over a million casualties, making it one of the bloodiest battles in human history and a symbol of the brutality of trench warfare.

title.zhCN: 胡适发表《文学改良刍议》
title.enUS: Hu Shi Publishes 'A Preliminary Discussion on Literary Reform'

description.zhCN: 胡适在《新青年》上发表文章，倡导白话文，反对文言文，为新文化运动中的文学革命奠定了基础。
description.enUS: Hu Shi published an article in 'New Youth' advocating for vernacular Chinese over classical Chinese, laying the foundation for the literary revolution within the New Culture Movement.

title.zhCN: 美国加入第一次世界大战

description.zhCN: 美国国会正式向德国宣战，标志着美国加入第一次世界大战。美国的参战为协约国带来了巨大的军事和经济优势，并对战争结果产生了决定性影响。
description.enUS: The U.S. Congress formally declared war on Germany, marking the entry of the United States into World War I. U.S. participation brought immense military and economic advantages to the Allied Powers and had a decisive impact on the outcome of the war.

description.zhCN: 弗拉基米尔·列宁领导的布尔什维克党在俄国发动武装起义，推翻了临时政府，建立了世界上第一个社会主义国家。
description.enUS: The Bolshevik Party, led by Vladimir Lenin, launched an armed uprising in Russia, overthrowing the Provisional Government and establishing the world's first socialist state.

description.zhCN: 在第一次世界大战战败后，奥斯曼帝国被协约国瓜分。帝国疆域被分割为多个现代国家，如土耳其、叙利亚、伊拉克等。这一事件标志着伊斯兰世界最后一个强大帝国的终结，并开启了中东地区由西方列强制定的新政治格局。
description.enUS: Following its defeat in World War I, the Ottoman Empire was partitioned by the Allied powers. Its territories were divided into several modern nation-states, such as Turkey, Syria, and Iraq. This event marked the end of the last powerful Islamic empire and initiated a new political order in the Middle East shaped by Western colonial powers.

description.zhCN: 德国与协约国签订停战协定，标志着第一次世界大战的正式结束。战后，奥匈帝国、俄罗斯帝国和奥斯曼帝国解体，欧洲多国建立了新的民族国家。
description.enUS: Germany signed an armistice with the Allied Powers, marking the official end of World War I. In the aftermath of the war, the Austro-Hungarian, Russian, and Ottoman Empires were dissolved, and new nation-states were formed across Europe.

description.zhCN: 巴黎和会中国外交失败引发学生、工人、市民等大规模示威游行，反对帝国主义和封建主义，标志着中国新民主主义革命的开端。
description.enUS: The failure of Chinese diplomacy at the Paris Peace Conference triggered large-scale demonstrations by students, workers, and citizens, protesting against imperialism and feudalism. This marked the beginning of China's New Democratic Revolution.

title.enUS: Japan Joins the League of Nations

description.zhCN: 作为第一次世界大战的战胜国之一，日本成为国际联盟的创始成员国，并在国联理事会中获得常任理事国席位。这进一步提升了日本的国际地位，使其跻身于世界强国之列。
description.enUS: As one of the victorious powers in World War I, Japan became a founding member of the League of Nations and secured a permanent seat on its council. This further elevated Japan's international status, placing it among the world's great powers.

title.zhCN: 第十九条宪法修正案通过
title.enUS: Nineteenth Amendment to the Constitution Ratified

description.zhCN: 美国国会通过了第十九条宪法修正案，赋予了女性在联邦和州选举中投票的权利。这是美国妇女参政运动取得的重大胜利。
description.enUS: The Nineteenth Amendment to the U.S. Constitution was passed by Congress, granting women the right to vote in federal and state elections. This was a major victory for the women's suffrage movement in the United States.

title.enUS: Founding of the Communist Party of China

description.zhCN: 中国共产党在上海召开第一次全国代表大会，宣告了中国共产党的正式成立。
description.enUS: The Communist Party of China held its First National Congress in Shanghai.

title.zhCN: 詹姆斯·乔伊斯《尤利西斯》出版

description.zhCN: 爱尔兰作家詹姆斯·乔伊斯的长篇小说《尤利西斯》出版。这部小说以其意识流写作手法和复杂的文学结构，被认为是现代主义文学的代表作，对20世纪的文学创作产生了革命性的影响。
description.enUS: Irish writer James Joyce's novel 'Ulysses' was published. With its stream-of-consciousness narrative and complex literary structure, the novel is considered a masterpiece of modernist literature and had a revolutionary impact on 20th-century writing.

description.zhCN: 俄罗斯、乌克兰、白俄罗斯和外高加索联邦的代表在莫斯科签署了《苏联成立条约》，正式成立苏维埃社会主义共和国联盟（苏联）。这标志着十月革命成果的巩固，并建立了一个由共产党领导的多民族联邦国家。
description.enUS: Representatives from Russia, Ukraine, Belarus, and the Transcaucasian Federation signed the Treaty on the Creation of the USSR in Moscow, officially forming the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics. This event solidified the achievements of the October Revolution and established a multi-ethnic federal state led by the Communist Party.

description.zhCN: 鲁迅的短篇小说集《呐喊》出版，其中收录的《狂人日记》是中国第一部现代白话文小说，对中国文学产生了深远影响。
description.enUS: Lu Xun's short story collection 'Call to Arms' was published. The included 'A Madman's Diary' is considered China's first modern vernacular novel, and it had a profound impact on Chinese literature.

description.zhCN: 日本关东地区发生里氏7.9级大地震，造成逾10万人死亡。地震对东京和横滨造成毁灭性打击，虽然引发了经济危机，但也为日本城市重建和工业结构调整提供了契机。
description.enUS: A magnitude 7.9 earthquake struck Japan's Kantō region, killing over 100,000 people. The quake caused devastating damage to Tokyo and Yokohama. While it triggered an economic crisis, it also created an opportunity for urban reconstruction and industrial structural changes.

title.enUS: First National Congress of the Kuomintang

description.zhCN: 中国国民党第一次全国代表大会在广州召开，确立了“联俄、联共、扶助农工”三大政策，标志着第一次国共合作的正式形成。
description.enUS: The First National Congress of the Kuomintang was held in Guangzhou, establishing the three major policies of 'allying with Russia, allying with the Communists, and assisting peasants and workers.' This marked the formal formation of the First United Front between the KMT and the CCP.

description.zhCN: 苏联的缔造者弗拉基米尔·列宁逝世。他的去世引发了党内高层围绕权力继承的激烈斗争，最终由约瑟夫·斯大林脱颖而出，掌握了国家最高权力。
description.enUS: Vladimir Lenin, the founder of the Soviet Union, passed away. His death triggered a fierce power struggle among the party elite for succession, from which Joseph Stalin ultimately emerged to seize supreme power of the state.

title.zhCN: 土耳其废除哈里发制度

description.zhCN: 土耳其大国民议会在凯末尔的领导下，废除了哈里发制度，彻底终结了延续千年的哈里发传统，标志着土耳其成为一个世俗化共和国。
description.enUS: Under the leadership of Mustafa Kemal Atatürk, the Turkish Grand National Assembly abolished the Caliphate, bringing an end to the centuries-old tradition and marking Turkey's transformation into a secular republic.

description.zhCN: 上海日本纱厂工人罢工，遭到镇压，引发了全国范围内的反帝爱国运动。
description.enUS: A strike by Japanese textile mill workers in Shanghai was suppressed, triggering a nationwide anti-imperialist patriotic movement.

description.zhCN: 国民革命军从广东出师北伐，旨在推翻北洋军阀统治，统一中国，迅速取得重大进展。
description.enUS: The National Revolutionary Army launched the Northern Expedition from Guangdong with the goal of overthrowing the Beiyang warlords and unifying China, achieving significant progress quickly.

description.zhCN: 中国共产党领导的武装起义在南昌爆发，打响了武装反抗国民党反动派的第一枪，标志着中国共产党独立领导武装斗争的开始。
description.enUS: An armed uprising led by the Chinese Communist Party broke out in Nanchang, firing the first shot against the Kuomintang reactionaries and marking the beginning of the CCP's independent armed struggle.

description.zhCN: 斯大林政府开始实施第一个五年计划，旨在通过大规模工业化和农业集体化，将苏联从一个落后的农业国转变为强大的工业国。
description.enUS: The Stalinist government began implementing the First Five-Year Plan, a series of economic policies aimed at transforming the Soviet Union from a backward agrarian country into a powerful industrial nation through large-scale industrialization and agricultural collectivization.

description.zhCN: 英国细菌学家亚历山大·弗莱明意外发现青霉菌具有抑制细菌生长的能力，从而发现了世界上第一种抗生素——青霉素。这项发现为后来的大规模生产和应用奠定了基础，彻底改变了人类治疗细菌感染的方式。
description.enUS: British bacteriologist Alexander Fleming accidentally discovered that the fungus Penicillium could inhibit the growth of bacteria, leading to the discovery of the world's first antibiotic, penicillin. This discovery laid the groundwork for its later mass production and application, fundamentally changing how humanity treats bacterial infections.

title.zhCN: 华尔街股灾与大萧条开始
title.enUS: Wall Street Crash and Start of the Great Depression

description.zhCN: 美国华尔街股市崩盘，引发全球性经济大萧条。这场危机导致欧洲多国经济崩溃、失业率飙升，加剧了社会动荡和政治极端主义的崛起。
description.enUS: The Wall Street stock market crashed in the United States, triggering a global economic Great Depression. This crisis led to economic collapse and skyrocketing unemployment in many European countries, fueling social unrest and the rise of political extremism.

description.zhCN: 中国长江、淮河流域发生特大洪水，造成巨大的人员伤亡和财产损失，成为中国近代史上规模最大的自然灾害之一。
description.enUS: A massive flood occurred in China's Yangtze and Huai River basins, causing enormous casualties and property damage, and becoming one of the largest natural disasters in modern Chinese history.

description.zhCN: 日本关东军在沈阳炸毁铁路，反诬中国军队所为，并以此为借口入侵中国东北。此次事件标志着日本侵华战争的开端，也揭示了日本军国主义的全面崛起。
description.enUS: The Japanese Kwantung Army blew up a railway in Shenyang and blamed it on the Chinese military, using the incident as a pretext to invade Manchuria. This event marked the beginning of Japan's aggression against China and the full-scale rise of Japanese militarism.

description.zhCN: 由于强制推行的农业集体化政策、强硬的粮食征收和对富农的镇压，苏联多地爆发了严重的饥荒，其中乌克兰受灾最为严重，造成数百万人死亡。这场饥荒被普遍认为是斯大林政策造成的灾难。
description.enUS: A severe famine broke out in many parts of the Soviet Union, with Ukraine being the hardest hit, leading to millions of deaths. The famine was a result of forced agricultural collectivization, harsh grain requisition policies, and the repression of kulaks, and is widely considered a disaster caused by Stalin's policies.

title.zhCN: 汤川秀树提出介子理论
title.enUS: Hideki Yukawa Proposes the Meson Theory

description.zhCN: 日本理论物理学家汤川秀树提出“介子理论”，解释了原子核内质子和中子之间的强相互作用。这一理论预言了介子的存在，为粒子物理学的发展开辟了新方向，并使其获得了诺贝尔物理学奖。
description.enUS: Japanese theoretical physicist Hideki Yukawa proposed the 'meson theory' to explain the strong interaction between protons and neutrons inside the atomic nucleus. This theory predicted the existence of mesons, opened a new direction for the development of particle physics, and earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics.

description.zhCN: 富兰克林·罗斯福就任总统，并开始推行“新政”，旨在通过大规模的公共工程项目、金融改革和福利政策来应对大萧条。新政深刻改变了美国政府与经济和社会的关系。
description.enUS: Franklin D. Roosevelt was inaugurated as president and began implementing the 'New Deal,' a series of programs aimed at combating the Great Depression through large-scale public works projects, financial reforms, and welfare policies. The New Deal fundamentally changed the relationship between the U.S. government, the economy, and society.

title.enUS: Start of the Red Army's Long March

description.zhCN: 中央红军为摆脱国民党军队的围剿，从江西瑞金等地出发进行战略转移，是一次史诗般的远征。
description.enUS: To escape the encirclement of the Kuomintang army, the Central Red Army began a strategic retreat from Ruijin, Jiangxi. It was an epic expedition.

description.zhCN: 华莱士·卡罗瑟斯领导的杜邦公司研究团队，成功合成出一种新型人造聚合物——尼龙。这是一种全新的合成纤维，开创了高分子化学的新纪元，并很快被应用于牙刷、降落伞等多个领域。
description.enUS: The DuPont research team led by Wallace Carothers successfully synthesized a new type of artificial polymer called nylon. This was a completely new synthetic fiber that started a new era in polymer chemistry and was soon used in various applications like toothbrushes and parachutes.

description.zhCN: 斯大林发起了一场大规模的政治清洗运动，旨在清除党内、军方和知识分子中的“敌人”和“叛徒”。数十万人在没有正当程序的情况下被处决或送往劳改营（古拉格），严重削弱了苏联的精英阶层，但也巩固了斯大林的个人统治。
description.enUS: Stalin launched a massive political purge aimed at eliminating 'enemies' and 'traitors' within the party, military, and intellectual circles. Hundreds of thousands were executed or sent to labor camps (Gulags) without due process, severely weakening the Soviet elite but consolidating Stalin's personal rule.

description.zhCN: 英国数学家阿兰·图灵发表论文《论可计算数》，首次提出了“图灵机”的理论模型。这一抽象的计算模型为现代计算机科学奠定了理论基础，对后来的计算机发展产生了决定性影响。
description.enUS: British mathematician Alan Turing published his paper 'On Computable Numbers,' in which he first proposed the theoretical model of the 'Turing machine.' This abstract model of computation laid the theoretical foundation for modern computer science and had a decisive impact on the later development of computers.

description.zhCN: 张学良、杨虎城在西安扣押蒋介石，要求停止内战，一致抗日，促成了第二次国共合作的初步形成。
description.enUS: Zhang Xueliang and Yang Hucheng detained Chiang Kai-shek in Xi'an, demanding an end to the civil war and a united front against Japan, which facilitated the initial formation of the Second United Front.

title.zhCN: 七七事变与全面侵华战争开始
title.enUS: Marco Polo Bridge Incident and Start of the Second Sino-Japanese War

description.zhCN: 日军在北平（今北京）卢沟桥附近制造事端，随后以此为借口向中国发动全面侵华战争。这标志着第二次世界大战亚洲战场的正式开启，中国成为主战场，给两国人民带来了巨大灾难。
description.enUS: The Japanese army created a provocation near the Marco Polo Bridge in Beiping (modern-day Beijing), using it as a pretext to launch a full-scale invasion of China. This marked the official start of World War II's Asian theater, with China becoming the main battleground and bringing immense disaster to the people of both nations.

description.zhCN: 侵华日军攻陷南京后，对中国平民和战俘进行了长达六个星期的大规模屠杀和抢掠，造成了巨大的人道灾难。
description.enUS: After capturing Nanjing, invading Japanese troops conducted a six-week-long large-scale massacre and looting of Chinese civilians and prisoners of war, causing a massive humanitarian disaster.

description.zhCN: 苏联与纳粹德国签署了《苏德互不侵犯条约》，其中包含一项秘密附加议定书，划分了东欧的势力范围。该条约使得德国在没有后顾之忧的情况下入侵波兰，从而引爆了第二次世界大战。
description.enUS: The Soviet Union and Nazi Germany signed the Molotov–Ribbentrop Pact, which included a secret protocol dividing spheres of influence in Eastern Europe. The pact allowed Germany to invade Poland without fear of Soviet intervention, thus igniting World War II.

description.zhCN: 德国入侵波兰，引发了英国和法国对德宣战，标志着第二次世界大战的全面爆发。这场战争是人类历史上规模最大、伤亡最惨重的冲突。
description.enUS: Germany invaded Poland, prompting Britain and France to declare war on Germany and marking the full-scale outbreak of World War II. This war was the largest and deadliest conflict in human history.

description.zhCN: 中国共产党领导的八路军在华北地区发动的对日大规模破袭战，沉重打击了日军，鼓舞了全国人民的抗战信心。
description.enUS: The Eighth Route Army, led by the Chinese Communist Party, launched a large-scale offensive against the Japanese in North China. This dealt a heavy blow to the Japanese army and boosted the morale of the entire nation in the War of Resistance.

title.zhCN: 德意日三国同盟条约签订

description.zhCN: 德国、意大利和日本在柏林签订军事同盟条约，结成轴心国集团。该条约旨在互相支持，对抗以英美为首的同盟国，标志着法西斯主义势力在全球范围内的联合。
description.enUS: Germany, Italy, and Japan signed a military alliance treaty in Berlin, forming the Axis powers. The pact aimed to mutually support each other against the Allied powers led by Britain and the United States, marking the global coalition of fascist forces.

description.zhCN: 纳粹德国撕毁《苏德互不侵犯条约》，发动“巴巴罗萨计划”，大规模入侵苏联。苏联因此加入反法西斯同盟，苏德战争成为二战中最具决定性和最残酷的战场。
description.enUS: Nazi Germany broke the Molotov–Ribbentrop Pact and launched 'Operation Barbarossa,' a massive invasion of the Soviet Union. The Soviet Union thus joined the anti-fascist coalition, and the Soviet-German front became the most decisive and brutal theater of World War II.

title.zhCN: 日本偷袭珍珠港，美国加入二战
title.enUS: Japan Attacks Pearl Harbor, U.S. Enters WWII

description.zhCN: 日本海军偷袭美国海军在夏威夷珍珠港的基地，重创美国太平洋舰队，促使美国正式对日宣战。此次事件标志着太平洋战争的爆发，将第二次世界大战推向了全球范围。
description.enUS: The Japanese navy launched a surprise attack on the U.S. naval base at Pearl Harbor, Hawaii, severely damaging the U.S. Pacific Fleet and prompting the United States to formally declare war on Japan. This event marked the outbreak of the Pacific War, expanding World War II to a global scale.

title.zhCN: 第二次世界大战在欧洲结束
title.enUS: End of World War II in Europe

description.zhCN: 德国签署无条件投降书，标志着第二次世界大战在欧洲战场的正式结束。战后，欧洲分裂为受美国影响的西方阵营和受苏联影响的东方阵营，开启了冷战。
description.enUS: Germany signed its unconditional surrender, marking the official end of World War II in the European theater. In the post-war era, Europe was divided into a Western bloc influenced by the United States and an Eastern bloc influenced by the Soviet Union, initiating the Cold War.

title.enUS: Soviet Victory Day in the Great Patriotic War

description.zhCN: 纳粹德国向盟军投降后，苏联将5月9日定为卫国战争胜利日。尽管付出了巨大的生命代价，但苏联在战争中的胜利使其成为世界两大超级大国之一，并获得了对东欧的控制权。
description.enUS: After Nazi Germany's surrender to the Allied Powers, the Soviet Union designated May 9 as Victory Day in the Great Patriotic War. Despite immense human costs, the Soviet victory in the war established it as one of the world's two superpowers and gave it control over Eastern Europe.

title.zhCN: 美国在广岛投下原子弹
title.enUS: U.S. Drops Atomic Bomb on Hiroshima

description.zhCN: 美国在日本广岛投下第一颗用于实战的原子弹，造成数万人瞬间死亡，城市遭受毁灭性打击。三天后，美国又在长崎投下第二颗原子弹。
description.enUS: The United States dropped the first atomic bomb used in combat on Hiroshima, Japan. It caused tens of thousands of deaths instantly and resulted in the city's devastating destruction. Three days later, a second atomic bomb was dropped on Nagasaki.

title.enUS: Sino-Soviet Treaty of Friendship and Alliance Signed

description.zhCN: 在日本投降前夕，中华民国国民政府与苏联在莫斯科签署了《中苏友好同盟条约》。苏联承诺支持国民政府，但同时也获得了对外蒙古的控制权和在中国东北的特权，为战后中国的内战和国共关系埋下伏笔。
description.enUS: On the eve of Japan's surrender, the Nationalist Government of the Republic of China and the Soviet Union signed the Sino-Soviet Treaty of Friendship and Alliance in Moscow. The Soviet Union pledged support to the Nationalist Government but also gained control over Outer Mongolia and special privileges in Northeast China, setting the stage for China's post-war civil war and the relationship between the Nationalists and Communists.

description.zhCN: 日本昭和天皇通过广播发表《终战诏书》，宣布接受《波茨坦公告》，无条件投降。这标志着第二次世界大战的正式结束。
description.enUS: Emperor Hirohito of Japan delivered a radio address announcing Japan's acceptance of the Potsdam Declaration and its unconditional surrender. This marked the official end of World War II.

description.zhCN: 世界上第一台通用电子数字计算机ENIAC正式公开。它主要用于军事计算，虽然体积庞大且能耗高，但其可编程性奠定了现代计算机的基础。
description.enUS: The world's first general-purpose electronic digital computer, ENIAC, was officially unveiled. Primarily used for military calculations, its programmability laid the foundation for modern computers despite its size and high energy consumption.

title.enUS: Outbreak of the Full-Scale Civil War

description.zhCN: 国民党军队大举进攻解放区，撕毁停战协定，标志着国共两党之间大规模内战的爆发。
description.enUS: Kuomintang forces launched a large-scale attack on the Liberated Areas, tearing up the truce agreement and marking the outbreak of a full-scale civil war between the KMT and the CCP.

description.zhCN: 台湾省因查缉私烟引发民众与政府的冲突，随后演变成大规模的武装暴动和国民党当局的镇压，是台湾历史的重要转折点。
description.enUS: A conflict over an illegal cigarette raid in Taiwan Province escalated into a large-scale armed uprising and subsequent suppression by the Kuomintang authorities, marking a significant turning point in Taiwan's history.

description.zhCN: 杜鲁门总统在国会演讲中承诺，美国将向受到共产主义威胁的国家提供军事和经济援助。这标志着美国正式放弃战时与苏联的合作，开启了冷战时期的遏制政策。
description.enUS: In a speech to Congress, President Truman pledged that the U.S. would provide military and economic aid to countries threatened by communism. This marked America's official abandonment of its wartime cooperation with the Soviet Union and initiated the Cold War policy of containment.

description.zhCN: 《日本国宪法》正式实施，取代了旧有的《大日本帝国宪法》。新宪法确立了主权在民、和平主义和基本人权保障的原则，将天皇的地位从神圣的统治者变为象征性的元首，并规定日本永远放弃战争。
description.enUS: The Constitution of Japan was formally enacted, replacing the old Constitution of the Empire of Japan. The new constitution established the principles of popular sovereignty, pacifism, and fundamental human rights, transforming the Emperor from a divine ruler into a symbolic head of state and stipulating that Japan would forever renounce war.

description.zhCN: 贝尔实验室的三位科学家发明了晶体管。它取代了体积庞大、能耗高的真空管，为电子设备的微型化、低功耗化奠定了基础，是现代电子技术的核心。
description.enUS: Three scientists at Bell Labs invented the transistor. It replaced large, power-hungry vacuum tubes, laying the foundation for the miniaturization and low power consumption of electronic devices and becoming the core of modern electronics.

title.enUS: Sony Launches its Magnetic Tape Recorder

description.zhCN: 日本东京通信工业公司（索尼前身）研制出日本首台磁带录音机“G-type”。这一发明标志着日本在电子产品领域的崛起，为后来的Walkman、CD机等便携式音频设备奠定了基础。
description.enUS: Tokyo Tsushin Kogyo (the predecessor of Sony) developed Japan's first magnetic tape recorder, the 'G-type.' This invention marked Japan's rise in the field of electronics and laid the foundation for later portable audio devices such as the Walkman and CD players.

description.zhCN: 美国启动了旨在援助西欧国家重建的“马歇尔计划”。该计划不仅帮助欧洲经济从二战中恢复，也有效地阻止了共产主义在西欧的扩张，巩固了美国的盟友体系。
description.enUS: The U.S. launched the 'Marshall Plan,' a program designed to aid in the reconstruction of Western Europe. The plan not only helped European economies recover from World War II but also effectively prevented the expansion of communism in Western Europe and strengthened America's alliance system.

description.zhCN: 英国结束对巴勒斯坦的托管，以色列宣布建国，引发了第一次中东战争，导致大量巴勒斯坦阿拉伯人流离失所，并开启了延续至今的阿以冲突。
description.enUS: Britain ended its mandate over Palestine, and Israel declared its statehood, sparking the First Arab-Israeli War. This led to the displacement of a large number of Palestinian Arabs and initiated the ongoing Arab-Israeli conflict.

description.zhCN: 中国人民解放军在东北地区发动的战略决战，以解放军的胜利告终，基本解放了东北全境。
description.enUS: The People's Liberation Army launched a decisive strategic campaign in Northeast China. The victory of the PLA fundamentally liberated the entire Northeast region.

description.zhCN: 中国人民解放军与国民党军队在华北地区的战略决战，最终以和平方式解放了北平，奠定了新中国首都的基础。
description.enUS: A decisive strategic campaign between the People's Liberation Army and the Kuomintang forces in North China ended with the peaceful liberation of Beiping, laying the foundation for the capital of New China.

description.zhCN: 美国、加拿大和多个西欧国家签署《北大西洋公约》，成立北大西洋公约组织（北约），旨在集体防御以对抗苏联的影响力，是冷战时期最核心的军事同盟之一。
description.enUS: The United States, Canada, and several Western European nations signed the North Atlantic Treaty, establishing the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO). Its purpose was collective defense against Soviet influence, making it one of the core military alliances of the Cold War.

description.zhCN: 中国人民解放军渡过长江并占领国民政府首都南京，标志着国民党政权在大陆统治的瓦解。
description.enUS: The People's Liberation Army crossed the Yangtze River and captured Nanjing, the capital of the Nationalist government, signifying the collapse of the KMT regime's rule on the mainland.

title.zhCN: 苏联成功试爆第一颗原子弹
title.enUS: Soviet Union Successfully Tests First Atomic Bomb

description.zhCN: 苏联成功试爆了其第一颗原子弹“第一道闪电”，代号为RDS-1。这一事件打破了美国在核武器领域的垄断，标志着核时代的全面开启和美苏“核竞赛”的开始。
description.enUS: The Soviet Union successfully detonated its first atomic bomb, 'First Lightning,' codenamed RDS-1. This event broke the U.S. monopoly on nuclear weapons, marking the full advent of the nuclear age and the beginning of the U.S.-Soviet 'nuclear arms race.'

title.enUS: Founding of the People's Republic of China

description.zhCN: 毛泽东在北京天安门城楼庄严宣告中华人民共和国成立，标志着中国新民主主义革命取得了胜利，开启了中国历史的新纪元。
description.enUS: Mao Zedong solemnly proclaimed the founding of the People's Republic of China on the rostrum of Tiananmen Square in Beijing, marking the victory of the New Democratic Revolution and ushering in a new era in Chinese history.

title.zhCN: 《中苏友好同盟互助条约》签署
title.enUS: Sino-Soviet Treaty of Friendship, Alliance and Mutual Assistance Signed

description.zhCN: 新成立的中华人民共和国与苏联在莫斯科签署了新的《中苏友好同盟互助条约》，取代了旧条约。该条约建立了军事同盟关系，苏联承诺向中国提供经济和技术援助，帮助其进行工业化建设，标志着中苏关系的“蜜月期”开始。
description.enUS: The newly established People's Republic of China and the Soviet Union signed a new treaty in Moscow, replacing the old one. The treaty established a military alliance, and the Soviet Union pledged economic and technical assistance to China for its industrialization. This marked the beginning of the 'honeymoon period' in Sino-Soviet relations.

description.zhCN: 朝鲜入侵韩国，引发了联合国军（以美军为主）与朝鲜和中国军队之间的战争。这场战争是冷战时期首次大规模的热战，对美国和亚洲的政治格局产生了深远影响。
description.enUS: North Korea invaded South Korea, triggering a war between UN forces (primarily U.S. troops) and North Korean and Chinese forces. This conflict was the first major 'hot war' of the Cold War and had a profound impact on the political landscape of both the United States and Asia.

title.enUS: Signing of the Treaty of San Francisco

description.zhCN: 日本与包括美国在内的48个国家签订和约，正式结束了二战状态。和约恢复了日本的主权，但同时也使其放弃了对朝鲜、台湾、澎湖列岛和南沙群岛等地的所有权利。
description.enUS: Japan signed a peace treaty with 48 countries, including the United States, officially ending its state of war from World War II. The treaty restored Japan's sovereignty but also required it to renounce all rights to Korea, Taiwan, the Pescadores Islands, and the Spratly Islands.

description.zhCN: 在英国和美国情报机构的支持下，伊朗军队发动政变，推翻了民选总理穆罕默德·摩萨台，巩固了巴列维国王的统治，并确保了西方对伊朗石油资源的控制。
description.enUS: With the support of British and American intelligence agencies, the Iranian military staged a coup, overthrowing the democratically elected Prime Minister Mohammad Mosaddegh. This solidified the rule of Shah Mohammad Reza Pahlavi and secured Western control over Iran's oil resources.

title.zhCN: 沃森和克里克发现DNA双螺旋结构
title.enUS: Watson and Crick Discover the Double Helix Structure of DNA

description.zhCN: 詹姆斯·沃森和弗朗西斯·克里克在英国剑桥大学基于X射线衍射数据，共同提出了脱氧核糖核酸（DNA）的双螺旋结构模型。这项发现揭示了遗传的物质基础，是生物学领域最重要的发现之一，开启了分子生物学的新时代。
description.enUS: At the University of Cambridge in the UK, James Watson and Francis Crick, based on X-ray diffraction data, proposed the double helix structure of deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA). This discovery revealed the material basis of heredity and is one of the most important findings in biology, ushering in a new era of molecular biology.

description.zhCN: 约瑟夫·斯大林逝世，结束了他长达近三十年的统治。他的去世引发了苏联内部的权力斗争，最终由赫鲁晓夫上台，并开启了旨在清除斯大林个人崇拜和恐怖统治的“去斯大林化”运动。
description.enUS: Joseph Stalin passed away, ending his rule of nearly three decades. His death triggered a power struggle within the Soviet Union, which ultimately saw Nikita Khrushchev rise to power and launch a campaign of 'de-Stalinization' aimed at dismantling Stalin's personality cult and reign of terror.

title.enUS: Start of the First Five-Year Plan

description.zhCN: 中国开始执行第一个国民经济和社会发展五年计划，重点发展重工业，为国家的工业化奠定了基础。
description.enUS: China began its first five-year plan for national economic and social development, focusing on the development of heavy industry and laying the foundation for the country's industrialization.

title.zhCN: 黑泽明执导电影《七武士》上映
title.enUS: Akira Kurosawa's Film 'Seven Samurai' Is Released

description.zhCN: 日本导演黑泽明的电影《七武士》上映。该片以其独特的叙事结构和镜头语言，对后世的电影，尤其是西方的西部片产生了深远影响，被誉为世界电影史上的杰作。
description.enUS: The film 'Seven Samurai' by Japanese director Akira Kurosawa was released. With its unique narrative structure and cinematic language, the film had a profound impact on later cinema, especially on Westerns, and is hailed as a masterpiece in the history of world cinema.

title.zhCN: 布朗诉托皮卡教育局案判决
title.enUS: Brown v. Board of Education Ruling

description.zhCN: 美国最高法院裁定公立学校中的种族隔离违宪。这项里程碑式的判决推翻了“隔离但平等”的原则，为后来的民权运动铺平了道路，成为废除种族隔离的法律基础。
description.enUS: The U.S. Supreme Court ruled that racial segregation in public schools was unconstitutional. This landmark decision overturned the principle of 'separate but equal,' paving the way for the Civil Rights Movement and serving as the legal basis for desegregation.

title.zhCN: 第一届全国人民代表大会召开

description.zhCN: 第一届全国人民代表大会在北京召开，会议通过了《中华人民共和国宪法》，确立了人民代表大会制度。
description.enUS: The first National People's Congress was held in Beijing, where the 'Constitution of the People's Republic of China' was adopted, establishing the system of people's congresses.

description.zhCN: 为对抗北大西洋公约组织（北约），苏联与东欧社会主义阵营国家签署了《华沙条约》，成立了华沙条约组织。这标志着冷战两大军事集团正式形成，加剧了东西方之间的对峙。
description.enUS: In response to NATO, the Soviet Union and its Eastern Bloc allies signed the Warsaw Treaty, establishing the Warsaw Pact. This marked the formal creation of the two major military blocs of the Cold War, escalating the standoff between East and West.

description.zhCN: 马尔科姆·麦克莱恩将油轮“理想X”号改装成世界第一艘集装箱船，从新泽西州纽瓦克港驶往得克萨斯州休斯敦。这标志着标准化集装箱运输时代的开始，极大提高了货物运输的效率。
description.enUS: Malcolm McLean converted the tanker 'Ideal X' into the world's first container ship, which sailed from Newark, New Jersey to Houston, Texas. This marked the beginning of the standardized container shipping era, which greatly improved the efficiency of cargo transportation.

description.zhCN: 在结束二战后的占领时期并恢复主权后，日本获准加入联合国。这标志着日本重新被国际社会接纳，并以和平主义国家的形象重返国际舞台。
description.enUS: After the post-World War II occupation period ended and its sovereignty was restored, Japan was admitted to the United Nations. This marked Japan's re-acceptance into the international community and its return to the global stage as a pacifist nation.

description.zhCN: 西德、法国、意大利、荷兰、比利时和卢森堡签署《罗马条约》，成立欧洲经济共同体（EEC），为日后的欧盟奠定了基础，标志着欧洲一体化进程的开始。
description.enUS: West Germany, France, Italy, the Netherlands, Belgium, and Luxembourg signed the Treaty of Rome, establishing the European Economic Community (EEC). This laid the foundation for the future European Union and marked the beginning of the process of European integration.

title.zhCN: 苏联发射第一颗人造卫星
title.enUS: Soviet Union Launches First Artificial Satellite

description.zhCN: 苏联成功发射了世界上第一颗人造地球卫星“斯普特尼克1号”，它在轨道上运行了三个月。这一事件震惊了美国，引发了“太空竞赛”，促使美国加大对科技和教育的投入。
description.enUS: The Soviet Union successfully launched the world's first artificial satellite, 'Sputnik 1,' which orbited Earth for three months. This event shocked the United States, sparked the 'Space Race,' and prompted the U.S. to increase its investment in science and education.

title.zhCN: 帕斯捷尔纳克获得诺贝尔文学奖
title.enUS: Pasternak Wins Nobel Prize in Literature

description.zhCN: 苏联作家鲍里斯·帕斯捷尔纳克凭借长篇小说《日瓦戈医生》获得诺贝尔文学奖。然而，苏联政府将此视为对国家的背叛，施加巨大压力迫使他拒绝了该奖项。
description.enUS: Soviet writer Boris Pasternak was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature for his novel 'Doctor Zhivago.' However, the Soviet government viewed this as an act of betrayal and pressured him to decline the award.

title.enUS: Start of the Great Leap Forward

description.zhCN: 中国在全国范围内发动了旨在快速发展工农业生产的“大跃进”运动，但由于违背经济规律，造成了严重的经济困难。
description.enUS: China launched the 'Great Leap Forward' movement nationwide, aiming for rapid development of industrial and agricultural production. However, it led to severe economic hardship due to its disregard for economic principles.

description.zhCN: 日本企业家安藤百福发明了世界上第一款方便面“鸡肉拉面”。这种即食食品解决了战后粮食短缺问题，并以其便捷性风靡全球，深刻改变了现代人的饮食方式。
description.enUS: Japanese entrepreneur Momofuku Ando invented the world's first instant noodles, 'Chikin Ramen.' This ready-to-eat food solved post-war food shortages and became a global sensation due to its convenience, profoundly changing modern eating habits.

description.zhCN: 苏联赫鲁晓夫与中国毛泽东在意识形态和国家利益上的分歧日益加剧，最终导致双方关系全面破裂。苏联撤回了在华专家，并中断了所有经济和技术援助项目，中苏关系进入了长达二十多年的敌对状态。
description.enUS: Deepening ideological and national interest differences between Soviet leader Nikita Khrushchev and Chinese leader Mao Zedong led to a complete breakdown in relations. The Soviet Union withdrew its experts from China and halted all economic and technical aid, plunging Sino-Soviet relations into a hostile state that lasted over two decades.

title.enUS: Revision of the Treaty of Mutual Cooperation and Security between the United States and Japan

description.zhCN: 日本与美国修订《日美安保条约》，将同盟关系从单纯的军事协定扩展到经济、政治等多方面合作。这奠定了战后日美同盟的基础，并对日本的防卫政策产生深远影响。
description.enUS: Japan and the United States revised the Treaty of Mutual Cooperation and Security, expanding their alliance from a purely military agreement to a multi-faceted cooperation in economic and political fields. This laid the foundation for the post-war Japan-U.S. alliance and had a profound impact on Japan's defense policy.

title.zhCN: 三岛由纪夫《金阁寺》出版
title.enUS: Yukio Mishima's 'The Temple of the Golden Pavilion' Is Published

description.zhCN: 日本作家三岛由纪夫的长篇小说《金阁寺》出版。该作品深刻探讨了美、毁灭与人性的复杂关系，成为日本战后文学的重要代表作之一，奠定了三岛在文坛的地位。
description.enUS: The novel 'The Temple of the Golden Pavilion' by Japanese author Yukio Mishima was published. The work deeply explores the complex relationship between beauty, destruction, and human nature, becoming one of the most important representatives of post-war Japanese literature and cementing Mishima's status in the literary world.

title.zhCN: 尤里·加加林成为第一位进入太空的人类
title.enUS: Yuri Gagarin Becomes the First Human in Space

description.zhCN: 苏联宇航员尤里·加加林乘坐“东方一号”宇宙飞船成功进入太空并绕地球轨道飞行一圈，成为人类历史上第一位进入太空的人。这次壮举是苏联在太空竞赛中的又一次重大胜利。
description.enUS: Soviet cosmonaut Yuri Gagarin successfully entered space aboard the Vostok 1 spacecraft and completed one orbit of Earth, becoming the first human in history to travel into space. This feat was another major victory for the Soviet Union in the Space Race.

description.zhCN: 美国侦察机在古巴发现了苏联正在部署的核导弹。这场持续13天的危机将美苏两个超级大国推向核战争边缘，最终通过外交谈判解决，成为冷战时期最紧张的时刻。
description.enUS: U.S. spy planes discovered Soviet nuclear missiles being deployed in Cuba. The 13-day crisis brought the two superpowers to the brink of nuclear war but was ultimately resolved through diplomatic negotiations, becoming the most tense moment of the Cold War.

title.zhCN: 马丁·路德·金“我有一个梦想”演讲
title.enUS: Martin Luther King Jr.'s 'I Have a Dream' Speech

description.zhCN: 超过25万人在华盛顿举行大游行，呼吁种族平等和就业机会。在此次活动中，马丁·路德·金发表了著名的“我有一个梦想”演讲，成为民权运动的象征性时刻。
description.enUS: More than 250,000 people participated in the March on Washington, advocating for racial equality and employment opportunities. During this event, Martin Luther King Jr. delivered his famous 'I Have a Dream' speech, which became an iconic moment of the Civil Rights Movement.

title.zhCN: 塔科夫斯基执导《伊万的童年》

description.zhCN: 安德烈·塔科夫斯基执导的电影《伊万的童年》获得威尼斯电影节金狮奖，标志着苏联电影艺术在国际上获得了高度认可。该片以其独特的诗意风格和深刻的主题，成为世界电影史上的经典之作。
description.enUS: Andrei Tarkovsky's film 'Ivan's Childhood' won the Golden Lion at the Venice Film Festival, signifying high international recognition for Soviet cinema. The film, with its unique poetic style and profound themes, became a classic in the history of world cinema.

description.zhCN: 美国国会通过《东京湾决议》，授权约翰逊总统在不宣战的情况下对越南进行军事行动。该决议为美国大规模卷入越南战争提供了法律依据。
description.enUS: The U.S. Congress passed the Gulf of Tonkin Resolution, authorizing President Johnson to take military action in Vietnam without a formal declaration of war. This resolution provided the legal basis for America's large-scale involvement in the Vietnam War.

description.zhCN: 东京奥运会开幕，这是亚洲国家首次举办奥运会。这次盛会不仅向世界展示了日本从战后废墟中迅速复兴的成就，也标志着日本进入经济高速增长的黄金时期。
description.enUS: The Tokyo Olympic Games opened, marking the first time an Asian country hosted the event. The games showcased Japan's rapid recovery from the devastation of World War II and symbolized its entry into a golden age of high economic growth.

title.zhCN: 中国第一颗原子弹爆炸成功

description.zhCN: 中国在新疆罗布泊成功试爆第一颗原子弹，标志着中国国防事业取得了重大突破，提升了中国的国际地位。
description.enUS: China successfully detonated its first atomic bomb at Lop Nur in Xinjiang, marking a major breakthrough in national defense and enhancing China's international standing.

title.zhCN: 中国首次人工合成结晶牛胰岛素
title.enUS: China's First Artificial Synthesis of Crystalline Bovine Insulin

description.zhCN: 中国科学家在世界上首次人工合成了具有全部生物活力的结晶牛胰岛素，这是一项重要的生命科学研究成果，标志着中国在生物化学领域取得重大突破。
description.enUS: Chinese scientists achieved the world's first artificial synthesis of crystalline bovine insulin with full biological activity. This was a major achievement in life sciences and a significant breakthrough for China in the field of biochemistry.

title.zhCN: 苏联成功在月球软着陆
title.enUS: Soviet Union Achieves First Soft Landing on the Moon

description.zhCN: 苏联的“月球9号”探测器在月球表面成功实现了软着陆，并传回了月球表面的第一张照片。这一成就再次证明了苏联在太空探测领域的领先地位。
description.enUS: The Soviet Luna 9 probe successfully made a soft landing on the Moon's surface and transmitted the first-ever photographs from the lunar surface. This achievement once again demonstrated the Soviet Union's leadership in space exploration.

description.zhCN: 中国爆发了一场以“无产阶级专政下继续革命”为指导思想的政治运动，给国家和人民带来了严重的灾难。
description.enUS: A political movement guided by the theory of 'continuing the revolution under the dictatorship of the proletariat' erupted in China, bringing severe disaster to the country and its people.

title.zhCN: 索尔仁尼琴出版《癌症病房》

description.zhCN: 作家亚历山大·索尔仁尼琴的小说《癌症病房》在海外出版，书中以批判的眼光描绘了苏联社会。这部作品以及后来的《古拉格群岛》揭露了斯大林时代的恐怖统治，使他成为苏联最著名的持不同政见者。
description.enUS: Author Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn's novel 'Cancer Ward' was published abroad, offering a critical portrayal of Soviet society. This work, along with his later book 'The Gulag Archipelago,' exposed the horrors of the Stalinist era, making him the most famous dissident in the Soviet Union.

title.zhCN: 日本经济超越西德，成为世界第二大经济体
title.enUS: Japan's Economy Surpasses West Germany's, Becoming the Second Largest in the World

description.zhCN: 凭借战后重建、技术引进和出口导向型经济政策，日本经济实现了高速增长，国内生产总值超过西德，成为仅次于美国的第二大经济体。这标志着日本经济奇迹的达成。
description.enUS: With post-war reconstruction, technology imports, and an export-oriented economic policy, Japan's economy achieved high-speed growth. Its GDP surpassed that of West Germany, making it the second-largest economy in the world after the United States. This marked the achievement of the Japanese economic miracle.

description.zhCN: 法国爆发了一场由学生罢课、工人罢工和大规模示威组成的社会运动。这场运动挑战了传统的社会权威和资本主义制度，虽然没有直接推翻政府，但对法国和欧洲的社会、文化和政治产生了深远影响。
description.enUS: France saw a social movement consisting of student strikes, worker strikes, and massive demonstrations. The movement challenged traditional social authority and the capitalist system. Although it didn't directly topple the government, it had a profound impact on French and European society, culture, and politics.

title.zhCN: 华约入侵捷克斯洛伐克

description.zhCN: 华沙条约组织军队入侵捷克斯洛伐克，镇压了旨在实现“有自由面貌的社会主义”的“布拉格之春”改革运动。此次事件表明苏联不会容忍其卫星国的独立改革，并正式提出了“勃列日涅夫主义”，即有限主权论。
description.enUS: Warsaw Pact troops invaded Czechoslovakia to suppress the 'Prague Spring' reform movement, which aimed to create 'socialism with a human face.' The event demonstrated that the Soviet Union would not tolerate independent reforms in its satellite states and formally introduced the 'Brezhnev Doctrine,' or the theory of limited sovereignty.

description.zhCN: 美国国防部高级研究计划局建立的ARPANET连接了四所大学的计算机。这是互联网的雏形，为后来的计算机网络发展提供了实验基础。
description.enUS: The ARPANET, established by the U.S. Department of Defense's Advanced Research Projects Agency, connected computers at four universities. This was the prototype of the internet and provided an experimental foundation for later computer network development.

description.zhCN: 中苏两国军队在乌苏里江的珍宝岛（达曼斯基岛）爆发了多次武装冲突，造成了人员伤亡。这次冲突将中苏之间的矛盾推向了高潮，两国关系一度濒临战争边缘。
description.enUS: Chinese and Soviet troops clashed several times over Zhenbao Island (Damansky Island) in the Ussuri River, resulting in casualties. This conflict brought the tensions between the two countries to a peak, pushing their relationship to the brink of war.

description.zhCN: 阿波罗11号的宇航员尼尔·阿姆斯特朗和巴兹·奥尔德林成功登上月球，完成了人类首次登月的壮举。此次任务的成功不仅是太空竞赛的重大胜利，也极大地提升了美国的科技威望。
description.enUS: Astronauts Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin of Apollo 11 successfully landed on the Moon, accomplishing humanity's first lunar landing. The mission's success was a major victory in the Space Race and greatly boosted America's technological prestige.

description.zhCN: 中国第一条城市地铁线路——北京地铁一号线建成通车，标志着中国城市公共交通进入一个新的发展阶段。
description.enUS: China's first urban subway line, Beijing Subway Line 1, was completed and opened to traffic, marking a new stage of development for China's urban public transportation.

title.zhCN: 东方红一号卫星发射成功
title.enUS: Successful Launch of Dong Fang Hong I Satellite

description.zhCN: 中国成功发射第一颗人造地球卫星“东方红一号”，成为世界上第五个独立研制和发射人造地球卫星的国家。
description.enUS: China successfully launched its first artificial satellite, 'Dong Fang Hong I,' becoming the fifth country in the world to independently develop and launch an artificial earth satellite.

description.zhCN: 井上大佑发明了卡拉OK。这项发明让普通人有机会成为“歌手”，极大地丰富了人们的娱乐生活，并成为一种全球性的文化现象。
description.enUS: Daisuke Inoue invented karaoke. This invention gave ordinary people the chance to become 'singers,' greatly enriching people's entertainment lives and becoming a global cultural phenomenon.

title.zhCN: 英特尔发布首款微处理器

description.zhCN: 英特尔公司推出了4004微处理器，这是首款集成在单个芯片上的中央处理器。它的出现极大地降低了计算机的尺寸和成本，为个人电脑的兴起铺平了道路。
description.enUS: Intel Corporation released the 4004 microprocessor, the first CPU integrated onto a single chip. Its emergence significantly reduced the size and cost of computers, paving the way for the rise of personal computers.

title.zhCN: 中华人民共和国恢复联合国合法席位
title.enUS: PRC's Lawful Seat in the UN Restored

description.zhCN: 联合国大会通过决议，恢复中华人民共和国在联合国的一切合法权利，并将蒋介石集团的代表从联合国及其所属一切机构中驱逐出去。
description.enUS: The UN General Assembly passed a resolution restoring all lawful rights of the People's Republic of China in the UN and expelling the representatives of the Chiang Kai-shek clique from the organization and all its affiliated bodies.

description.zhCN: 美国总统尼克松访问中国，与毛泽东、周恩来等领导人会晤，两国发表了《上海公报》，标志着中美关系正常化的开始。
description.enUS: US President Nixon visited China and met with leaders such as Mao Zedong and Zhou Enlai. The two countries issued the Shanghai Communiqué, marking the beginning of the normalization of Sino-US relations.

description.zhCN: 日本首相田中角荣访问中国，与中国签署《中日联合声明》，正式建立外交关系。两国长期以来的敌对状态结束，开启了新的合作与交流时代，对东亚地区产生了重要影响。
description.enUS: Japanese Prime Minister Kakuei Tanaka visited China and signed the Joint Communiqué of the Government of Japan and the Government of the People's Republic of China, officially establishing diplomatic relations. The long-standing hostility between the two countries ended, opening a new era of cooperation and exchange and having a significant impact on the East Asian region.

title.zhCN: 《巴黎和平协约》签署与美军撤出越南
title.enUS: Paris Peace Accords Signed and U.S. Troops Withdraw from Vietnam

description.zhCN: 美国与北越在巴黎签署和平协约，标志着美国正式结束在越南的军事介入，并在不久后撤出了所有作战部队。越南战争的结束在美国国内引发了深刻的反思和分歧。
description.enUS: The U.S. and North Vietnam signed a peace treaty in Paris, officially ending America's military involvement in Vietnam and leading to the withdrawal of all U.S. combat troops shortly after. The end of the Vietnam War prompted deep introspection and division within the United States.

title.zhCN: 首次手持移动电话通话
